1, 1776, 5 mos. 5 days ; rolls dated Camp at Hull ; also, Capt. Amasa Cranston s 
co., Col. Samuel Denny s regt.; enlisted Oct. 27, 1779; discharged Nov. 23, 
1779; service, 1 mo. 7 days, at Claverack, including travel (200 miles) home; 
regiment raised for 3 months; also, Capt. Staples Chamberlin s co., Col. 
Dean s regt. ; enlisted March 7, 1781 ; discharged March 14, 1781 ; service, 11 
days, including 3 days (60 miles) travel home; company marched to Rhode 
Island by order of His Excellency John Hancock on a 40 days expedition. 

MORSE, MOSES, Warwick. Descriptive list of men belonging to Capt. Seth Pierce s 
co., Col. Seth Murray s (Hampshire Co.) regt.; rank, Private; age, 19 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; complexion, light; residence, Warwick; mustered July 
18, 1780; company detached from 6th Hampshire Co. regt. to serve for 3 
months from the time of arrival at Claverack, agreeable to order of June 22, 

1780, and mustered by Lieut. Col. Samuel Williams and Maj. Whitmore, as 
per statement affixed, dated Warwick, Aug. 4, 1780.

pay abstracts for April and June, 1776. 

MORSE, MOSES. Private, Capt. Asa Fairbanks s co., Col. Benjamin Haws s regt. ; 
service from Sept. 30, 1777, to Oct. 31, 1777, 1 mo. 2 days, at Rhode Island. 
Roll dated Wrentham. 

MORSE, MOSES. Private, Capt. Walter McFarland s co., Col. Cyprian Howe s 
regt. ; enlisted July 24, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 30, 1780 ; service, 3 mos. 10 
days, at Rhode Island ; regiment raised in Middlesex Co. to reinforce Con 
tinental Army for 3 months. 

MORSE, MOSES. Private, Capt. Heman Smith s co., Lieut. Col. Coller s regt.; 
service, 17 days; company marched from Sandisfield to Stillwater Oct. 14,

detached and served 6 days longer. Roll endorsed " Col John Ashley Reg."

Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780.

of men belonging to Capt. Mann s co. who marched to Providence, R. I., and

8, 1776 ; also, list of men belonging to Capt. Mann s co. who were drafted in 
accordance with an order from Col. Ephraim Wheelock, dated Medfield, 
April 15, 1777 ; said Morse reported as having been hired by David Lovell, 
Jr., who was drafted ; also reported as having marched April 22, 1777, and 
returned June [May] 12, 1777; service, 20 days, in a company made up from 
Medfield, Medway, Bellingham, and Walpole, and placed under command of 
Capt. Sabin Mann, ordered to march to Providence, R. I., and there serve 
under Gen. Spencer until discharged; also, Private, Capt. Mann s co., Col. 
Wheelock s regt. ; marched April 22, 1777; discharged May 10, 1777; service, 
20 days ; company marched to Rhode Island ; also, list of men belonging to

Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 

MORSE, SILAS, Dedham. Private, Capt. William Bullard s militia co. of South 
Parish in Dedham, Col. Heath s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775; service, 10 days; also, Capt. William Bullard s co. (co. of South 
Parish in Dedham), Col. William Mclntosh s regt.; service, 4 days, on the 
alarm of March 4, 1776.

regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., to camp and home, sworn to in

1 day (17 miles) ; company drafted from Roxbury, Dedham, Needham, Med- 
field, Wrentham, Walpole, Medway, Bellingham, Beverly, Danvers, Middle- 
ton, and Manchester. 

MORSE, SILAS, Dedham. Pay roll for 6 months men belonging to the town of 
Dedham raised for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 17, 1780; discharged Dec. 24, 1780; service, 5 mos. 18 days, including 
travel (220 miles) home. 

MORSE, SILAS. Private, Capt. Theophilus Wilder s co., Col. Dike s regt. , muster 
roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777; credited to town of Stoughtonham ; enlisted 
Dec. 16, 1776; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777. 

MORSE, SILAS. Private, Capt. Robert Smith s co., Lieut. Col. Symms s detachment 
of guards ; enlisted Feb. 19, 1778 ; discharged April 26, 1778 ; service, 2 mos. 
7 days, under Maj. Gen. Heath at Boston and Dorchester. 

MORSE, SILAS. Return sworn to at Dedham, Dec. 8, 1778, made by the Selectmen, 
of men detached for defence of Rhode Island to whom bounties were paid, 
agreeable to resolve of June 12, 1778. 

MORSE, SILAS. Descriptive list of men raised in Suffolk Co. in 1779 to serve in the

plexion, dark ; engaged for town of Dedham ; reported delivered to Ensign 
Edward White ; also, list of men returned as received of Maj. Stephen Bad- 
lam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, at Spring 
field, Sept. 20, 1779. 

MORSE, SILAS. Seaman, State sloop "Winthrop," commanded by Capt. George 
Little ; engaged Dec. 10, 1782 ; discharged March 17, 1783 ; service, 3 mos. 8 
days. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.

raised in Stoughton and Stoughtonham.

MORSE, URIAH. Private, Capt. Sabin Mann s co. of Medfield militia; return of 
train band with equipments, dated June 10, 1776 ; age, 46 yrs. ; reported as 
in the army July -, 1776; also, Capt. Mann s co. ; list of men raised from 
Medfield militia to reinforce the Continental Army at Canada, etc., agreeable 
to resolves of June 25, 1776, and July 11, 1776 ; said Morse reported as hired 
with money raised by fines on persons drafted and sums voluntarily con 
tributed ; also, receipt given to Capt. Mann, dated Aug. 28, 1776, signed by 
Samuel Cowele [Cowell], for the enlistment of said Morse and others, said men 
being the town s quota of 1 to every 25 of the Medfield militia ; also, list of 
men credited with turns of service "Dune in the Last Wars in the Days of 
Capt Morse the first And Captain Collidge," made up from the records 
and attested by Capt. Peter Collidge in Nov., 1776; list attested by Capt. 
Sabin Mann and Philip Blake, Clerk, Nov. 17, 1776; also, list of men be 
longing to the train band of Capt. Sabin Mann s co. drafted to march to 
Providence, R. I., at a minute s warning and there serve under Gen. Spencer, 
the same being a draft of one-fourth part of the train band, in accordance 
with an order from Col. Ephraim Wheelock, dated Medfield, April 15, 1777; 
said Morse reported as having marched April 22, 1777, and returned June 
[May] 12, 1777 ; service, 20 days, in a company made up from Medfield, Med- 
way, Bellingham, and Walpole, and placed under command of Capt. Sabin 
Mann, ordered to march to Providence, R. I., and there serve under Gen. 
Spencer until discharged; also, Private, Capt. Sabin Mann s co., Col. Whee- 
lock s regt.; marched April 22, 1777; discharged May 10, 1777; service, 20 
days ; company marched to Rhode Island ; also, list of men belonging to Capt. 
Sabin Mann s co. drafted to march to Rhode Island and there serve for 1 
calendar month at or near Bristol, in accordance with a warrant from Col. 
Benjamin Hawes, dated Wrentham, July 14, 1777, and by order from Brig. 
Lovell ; said Morse hired Jeremiah Morse to serve in his place ; also, list 
dated Sept. 16, 1777, of men belonging to Capt. Mann s co. drafted to complete 
the quota for the Continental Army, but who paid money in lieu of service ; 
said Morse reported as having paid 10.

Continental Army at the Northward and who marched Aug. 20, 1777 ; 9 men

Francis s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance to and from camp, etc., 
sworn to Nov. 29, 1776; said Morse credited with allowance for 2 days (40 
miles) travel; company drafted from Salisbury, Newburyport, Bradford, 
Haverhill, Methuen, Boxford, and Andover. 

MORSE, WILLIAM, Swanzey. List of men raised in Bristol Co. for the term of 9

20, 1778, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. 
Putnam, July 20, 1778; engaged for town of Swanzey; arrived at Fishkill 
June 19, 1778; also, Private, Capt. Jabez Barney s co., Lieut. Col. Luke 
Drury s regt. ; enlisted and marched Aug. 14, 1781 ; joined regiment at West 
Point Aug. 25, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 24, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 21 days, at West 
Point by order of His Excellency John Hancock, including 10 days (200 miles) 
travel home ; residence, Swanzey ; engaged for town of Swanzey ; reported on 
command with the boats ; regiment detached from militia to reinforce Conti 
nental Army for 3 months.

manded by Maj. Benjamin Gage ; service, 40 days ; company marched Oct. 2, 
1777, to join Northern army.

co., Col. John Paterson s regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also,

Watkins s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s detachment of Berkshire Co. militia ;

Windsor to Saratoga on an alarm at the Northward.

MORSS, ANTHONY, continued. 

bridge; enlisted May 21, 1775; service, 10 weeks 2 days; also, company re 
turn dated French Lines, Oct. 12, 1775 ; also, statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 
1777, signed by said Morse and others belonging to Col. Crafts s regt., declaring 
their refusal to leave Boston, unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made 
equivalent to those allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery ; 
also, petition addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 
25, 1777, signed by said Morss and others, requesting that the objectionable 
part of their former petition, which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, 
and asking that the sergeants of the regiment confined on account of the peti 
tion be released.

MORSS, STEPHEN. Lieut. Abel Kimball s detachment; list of men, sworn to at 
Andover, March 22, 1776, accompanying a petition to the General Court, signed 
by said Lieut. Kimball, stating that in consequence of a letter from the Com 
mittee of Safety of Gloucester, requesting that a draft be made from several 
towns to assist in preventing any attempt which might be made by the enemy 
to retake a brig laden with warlike stores, bound from Great Britain to Bos 
ton, captured and brought into Gloucester Nov. 29, 1775, he marched Nov. 30, 
1775, with 12 men, including said Morss, and served 6 days, travel home in 
cluded, and asking allowance for service and billeting money ; petition granted 
by the House of Representatives April 24, 1776, and action concurred in by 
Council April 25, 1776.

Island in Sept. and Oct., 1777.

MORTEN, SIMON, Amherst. Private, Capt. Oliver Coney s co., Col. Sears s regt. ; 
marched Aug. 12, 1781; discharged Nov. 15, 1781; service, 3 mos. 10 days, 
including travel (146 miles) home ; regiment raised to reinforce Continental 
Army for 3 months. Roll sworn to at Ware. 

MORTEN, STEPHEN. Capt. Abel Thayer s co., Col. John Fellows s regt. ; order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dorchester Camp, Nov. 22, 1775. 

MORTEN, THOMAS. Private, Capt. John Thompson s co., Col. Leonard s regt. ; en 
listed May 7, 1777 ; discharged July 8, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 10 days, including 
9 days (180 miles) travel home ; regiment raised from Hampshire Co. militia 
to reinforce Northern army for 2 months. 

MORTENDAL, WILLIAM, Lenox. Corporal, Capt. Charles Dibbell s co. of Minute- 
men, Col. John Paterson s regt., which marched April 22, 1775, in response to 
the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 13 days. 

MORTIN, BENJAMIN, Rehoboth. Corporal, Capt. John Lyon s or Capt. Jesse Per- 
rin s co., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 7 days. [The 
two Rehoboth alarm companies under Capt. Lyon and Capt. Perrin returned 
upon one roll.] 

MORTO, . [This name also appears under the form of Matts, Motts.] 

MORTO, CALEB, Middleborough. Fifer, Capt. Nehemiah Allen s co., Col. Jere 
miah Hall s regt. ; marched Dec. 8, 1776 ; service, 92 days ; company marched 
to Bristol, R. I. 

MORTO, HENRY, Boston. Bombardier, Capt. Jonathan W. Edes s (4th) co., Col. 
Thomas Crafts s (Artillery) regt.; engaged June 4, 1776; service to Nov. 1, 
1776, 5 mos. 1 day; roll sworn to at Boston; also, list of men mustered by 
Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Jan. 8, 1777 ; 
Maj. Eben Stevens s (Artillery) battalion; also, Sergeant, Capt. Stephen 
Buckland s co., Col. John Crane s (3d Artillery) regt.; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; residence, Bos 
ton ; reported as serving 13 mos. 17 days as Sergeant, 22 mos. 13 days as Pri 
vate having been reduced to the ranks ; also, same co. and regt. ; return of 
men who were in service on or before Aug. 1, 1777, and who had not been 
absent subsequently except by leave of proper authority, certified at Park of 
Artillery near Morristown, Jan. 28, 1780; also, descriptive return dated Bos 
ton, Jan. 9, 1781, made by Edward Procter, Colonel of Boston regt., of men 
who had enlisted to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 6 months 
from the time of their arrival at place of rendezvous, unless sooner discharged, 
and who had received bounty and mileage due them of said Col. Procter; 
Capt. Marston s co. ; age, 30 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, brown.

Army, as returned by Lieut. Joseph Knight, dated Middleton, Feb. 12, 1778; 
residence, Winslow ; engaged for town of Middleton ; term, 3 years.

ophilus Cotton s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; 
service, 3 mos. 8 days; also, company return dated Oct. 7, 1775; also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury, Nov. 8, 1775; also, 
return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Nathaniel 
Goodwin s co. ; residence, Plymouth ; engaged for town of Plymouth ; joined 
Capt. Joshua Eddy s co., Col. Bradford s regt.; term, 3 years; also, list of

ford s regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; enlisted by Capt. Joshua Eddy; said Morton, with 
others, reported as having passed muster at Pembroke Jan. 27, 1777; also, 
Private, 7th co., Col. Gamaliel Bradford s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Joshua 
Eddy s co., Col. Bradford s (12th) regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of 
enlistment, Dec. 25, 1776, to date of marching to Bennington, Feb. 22, 1777; 
credited with 70 days allowance, including allowance for 11 days travel on 
march from Boston to Bennington ; also, same co. and regt. ; return endorsed 
"January 28th 1778;" mustered by Perez Simons, County Muster Master, 
and by a Continental Muster Master ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll 
for July, 1778, dated White Plains ; reported joined Feb. 30 [ ? ], 1777. 

MORTON, ABNER. Private, Capt. Jotham Houghton s co. ; service from Nov. 3 to 
Nov. 19, 1778, 17 days; company detached from Col. Nathan Sparhawk s (7th) 
regt., Gen. Warner s brigade, to reinforce guards at the barracks in Rutland 
under Col. Jacob Garrish (Gerrish) and to escort troops of Saratoga con 
vention to Enfield, Conn. Roll dated Petersham. 

MORTON, AMASA. Seaman, schooner " Ellen," Ichabod Morton, Master, bound on 
voyage to Baltimore ; engaged Dec. 14, 1776; discharged April 18, 1777. Roll 
dated Boston. 

MORTON, AMBROSE, Stoughton. Private, Capt. William Briggs s co., Col. Joseph

1775; also, Capt. Simeon Leach s co., Col. Benjamin Gill s regt.; service, 5 
days ; company marched from Stoughton March 4, 1776, at the time of fortify

regt. 

MORTON, BENJAMIN, Danvers. Private, Capt. Caleb Low s co., which marched on

MORTON, BENJAMIN, Hatfield. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780; Capt. Joshua Woodbridge s co., Col. Chapin s regt. ; age, 21 yrs. ; stat 
ure, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Hatfield ; arrived at 
Springfield July 4, 1780 ; marched to camp July 5, 1780, under command of 
Capt. Frothingham, of the artillery; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a 
return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Hatfield for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched June 27, 1780; discharged Dec. 13, 1780; service, 5 mos. 22 
days, including travel (120 miles) home.

in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months

MORTON, ISAAC. Captain ; list of officers of Suffolk Co. militia appointed to com 
mand men raised for various purposes ; said Morton detached for service at

state of Massachusetts by said Morton, Captain, for State pay for service from 
July 14, 1778, to Oct. 24, 1778, 3 mos. 10 days, at North river ; reported a super 
numerary officer ; also, copy of a regimental order, dated "West Point, Oct. 12, 
1778 ; said Morton and others reported as having been discharged by Col. Poor 
from any further service in his regiment, agreeable to Gen. Washington s order.

MORTON, ISAAC, continued. 

march from Boston to Bennington ; also, Lieutenant, same co. and regt. ; sub

ton s petition to the General Court setting forth that he had been an officer 
in Col. Marshall s regt. at the time of the evacuation of Ticonderoga, and had

MORTON, JAMES. Private, Capt. Samuel Gregg s co., Col. James Cargill s regt.;

Co., and stationed there for defence of seacoast. 

MORTON, JAMES. Return of sentences by a general court-martial of the 3d Brigade, 
Maj. Duffee, President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, 
Ticonderoga, Aug. 26, 1776, taken from Col. Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said 
Morton, of Capt. Tilton s co., Col. Poor s regt., tried with others on charge of 
desertion ; all pleaded guilty and one was sentenced to receive 39 lashes on 
his bare back.

in his stead ; resignation accepted in Council May 7, 1779.

MORTON, PEREZ. Petition addressed to the General Court, signed by William 
Gale and others, praying for the incorporation of the Boston Independent 
corps, and desiring that the officers chosen by said corps be commissioned, 
Maj. Gen. John Hancock being named as Colonel, Henry Jackson as Lieu 
tenant Colonel, Benjamin Hichborn as 1st Major, said Morton as 2d Major, 
and John Steel as Adjutant ; ordered in Council Dec. 7, 1776, that said officers 
be commissioned ; also, list of men subscribing to regulations for formation of 
an Independent company to be raised in Boston ; officers of said Boston Inde 
pendent company commissioned in Council Dec. 7, 1776, Maj. Gen. John Han 
cock to serve as Colonel, Henry Jackson to serve as Lieutenant Colonel ; also, 
2d Major, Gen. John Hancock s (Boston Independent) co. commanded by 
Lieut. Col. Henry Jackson ; marched April 15,1777; arrived at camp April 
17, 1777; discharged May 5, 1777; service, 21^ days; company marched from 
Boston to Rhode Island ; also, resignation dated Boston, April 8, 1779, signed 
by said Morton and Benjamin Hichborn, resigning their commissions as Major, 
and Lieutenant Colonel, respectively, in the Boston Independent co., on 
account of business reasons and ill health ; resignations accepted in Council 
April 12, 1779.

19, 1777 ; service, 4 days, in Northern department, including travel (40 miles) 
home; company marched at request of Gen. Gates; also, Capt. White s 
co., Col. Ezra May s regt.; enlisted Sept. 20, 1777; discharged Oct. 14, 1777; 
service, 30 days, including travel (111 miles) home; company marched to 
Saratoga ; roll sworn to at Hatfield.

obtain a small portion of the amounts due them from the Commonwealth, and 
requesting accordingly that they might receive an order for linen and cloth 
ing ; request allowed by resolve of Feb. 2, 1782 ; also, Lieutenant, 2d Mass.

cers, dated July 11, 1783 ; reported on command at West Chester, N. Y. ; also, 
same regt.; returns of effectives between July 11, and Aug. 15, 1783, dated 
Philadelphia ; reported on command in West Chester Co. 

MORTON, SIMEON, Amherst. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti

returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 7, 1780 ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 3 in. ; complexion, light ; 
engaged for town of Amherst ; marched to camp July 7, 1780, under command

by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Amherst for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp 
July 1, 1780; discharged Dec. 18, 1780; service, 5 mos. 25 days, near West 
Point, including travel (144 miles) home.

and others belonging to Col. Crafts s regt., declaring their refusal to leave 
Boston unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made equivalent to those 
allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery.

manded by Capt. John Foster Williams ; engaged Feb. 12, 1780 ; discharged

for 3 months.

6 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, brown ; eyes, blue ; engaged for town of Dart 
mouth ; reported delivered to Capt. L. Bailey; also, Capt. Woodbridge s co. ; 
entered service July 11, 1779; discharged April 11, 1780; term, 9 months. 

MOSHER, MICHAEL, Middleborough. Private, Capt. Abiel Pearce s (2d Middle- 
borough) co. of militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to 
Marshfield ; service, 2 days. 

MOSHER, PHILIP, Roxbury. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Capt. Ebenezer Gore s (1st) co., Col. William Mclntosh s (1st 
Suffolk Co.) regt.; residence, Roxbury ; engaged for town of Roxbury ; joined 
Capt. Jarvis s co., Col. Henry Jackson s regt. ; term, 3 years, to expire April 
-, 1780; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for 
Suffolk Co., dated Boston, June 8, 1777 ; Capt. Jarvis s co., Col. Henry Jack 
son s regt.; also, Private, Capt. Hunt s co., Col. Henry Jackson s regt.; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 24, 1777, to May 29, 1780 ; 
reported discharged May 29, 1780; also, Capt. Thomas Cartwright s co., Col. 
Henry Jackson s regt. ; pay roll for Feb., 1778, dated " Gulph Mills," Pa. ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for June-Sept., and Nov., 1778; also, Capt. 
Thomas Hunt s (8th) co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; muster roll for April, 1779, 
dated Pawtuxet; also, same co. and regt.; return dated Camp Providence, 
July 9, 1779 ; enlisted May 24, 1777 ; also, Capt. Thomas Hunt s (4th) co., Col. 
Henry Jackson s (16th) regt. ; pay roll for Oct., 1779, dated Camp near Provi 
dence ; also, same co. and regt. ; regimental return made up to Dec. 31, 1779, 
dated Camp at Providence; also, return certified at Camp near Morristown, 
April 30, 1780, of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and 
Col. Jackson s regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sher- 
burne s regt., who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of 
Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 1779; Capt. 
Hunt s co.; rank, Private; residence, Roxbury; engaged for town of Rox 
bury; engaged May 29, 1777; term, 3 years. 

MOSHER, THOMAS, Salem. Seaman, brigantine "General Wayne" (privateer), 
commanded by Capt. John Leach ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; com 
plexion, dark; residence, Salem. 

MOSHER, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Isaac Pope s co., Col. William Shepard s (4th) 
regt.; muster roll for July, 1781, sworn to in Camp at Phillipsborough ; re-

MOSHER, ZEBULON. Private, Capt. Benjamin Willcox s co., Col. Nathaniel Free

MOSHERS, JOSIAH, Pepperell. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co. to

residence, Pepperell ; engaged for town of Pepperell ; arrived at Fishkill 
June 19, 1778. 

MOSHIE, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Isaac Pope s co., Col. William Shepard s (4th) 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 5, 1780, to Dec. 
31, 1780; also, same co. and regt.; return made up for the year 1780, dated 
Hutts near West Point ; reported a transient. 

MOSHIRE, TIMOTHY, Dartmouth. Private, Maj. Ball s co., Col. William Sheppard s

Poor s brigade ; Parson Hunteriss reported as having taken the place of said

MOSIER, JOSIAH. List of men raised in Middlesex Co. for the term of 9 months

Cathcart ; engaged Aug. 12, 1782 ; discharged Nov. 21, 1782 ; service, 3 mos. 
9 days. Roll sworn to at Boston .

MOSLEY, ALEXANDER. Private, Capt. Ichabod Pinkham s detachment; service 
from March 24, 1780, to April 24, 1780, 1 mo., at Boothbay in defence of sea- 
coast. 

MOSLEY, ASA H, Westfield. Private, in a West-field co. of Minute-men commanded 
by Lieut. John Shephard, which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the 
alarm of April 19, 1775; discharged May 12, 1775; service, 3 weeks 1 day. 

MOSLEY, DAVID. Captain; pay roll dated Westfield, of part of said Mosley s co., 
Col. John Mosley s (3d Hampshire Co.) regt., which marched to Ticonderoga 
under command of Lieut. Col. Timothy Robinson to reinforce Northern army 
by order of Gen. Schuyler and served from Oct. 21, 1776, to Nov. 17, 1776; 
also, order dated Westfield, Sept. 14, 1781, signed by said Mosley, Colonel, 
appointing and ordering Lieut. Gideon Root, of Southwick, to hold himself 
in readiness to march on the shortest notice to Connecticut for service under 
Capt. John Gray or some other officer. 

MOSLEY, EBENEZER. 2d Sergeant, Capt. Lemuel Clap s (1st Dorchester) co., Col. 
Benjamin Gill s regt.; engaged March 4, 1776; discharged March 8, 1776; 
service, 5 days, at the time of taking Dorchester Heights ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; engaged March 14, 1776; discharged March 26, 1776; service, 12 days; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. Lemuel Clap s co., Maj. Nathaniel Heath s detachment 
of guards; engaged May 11, 1779; discharged Aug. 10, 1779; service, 3 mos. ; 
company stationed at Dorchester Heights ; also, same co. and detachment ; 
engaged Aug. 11, 1779 ; discharged Nov. 10 (also given Nov. 11) , 1779 ; service, 
3 mos. ; company stationed at Dorchester Heights. 

MOSLEY, ISRAEL. Private, Capt. Daniel Sacket s co., Col. Woodbridge s regt.; 
enlisted Aug. 20, 1777; discharged Oct. 23, 1777; service, 2 mos. 3 days, in 
Northern department. 

MOSLEY, JAMES, Boxford. List of men raised for the 6 months service and re 
turned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the 
town of Boxford for service in the Continental Army during 1780; entered 
service and marched July 10, 1780; discharged Jan. 10, 1781; service, 6 mos. 
14 days, including travel (275 miles) home. 

MOSLEY, JAMES, Newbury (also given Newburyport) . Private, Capt. Jacob Ger- 
rish s co., Col. Moses Little s (17th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; 
enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 3 mos. 8 days; also, company return [probably 
Oct., 1775]; age, 38 yrs. ; also, Capt. Gerrish s co., Col. Little s regt., Gen. 
Green s brigade; receipt for bounty coat dated Nov. 2, 1775; also, account

(7th) regt. ; age, 46 (also given 47) yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, dark ; 
hair, dark; occupation, cooper ; birthplace, Britain ; residence, Newburyport ; 
engaged for town of Ipswich; engaged May 1, 1781; term, 3 years; also, Pri 
vate, 2d co. ; entries dated Oct. 21, 1783, and Dec. 26, 1783, of orders for wages 
for May-Dec, [year not given], appearing in a register of orders accepted on 
account of wages, etc. 

MOSLEY, JOHN. Colonel, 3d Hampshire Co. regt., Brig. Gen. Timothy Danielson s 
brigade ; general return of Mass, militia made by Adj. Gen. Peleg Wadsworth, 
dated July 5, 1779.

MOSLEY, JOSEPH, Sutton. Private, Capt. Abraham Batcheller s co., Col. Jonathan

Moss, LEVI. Capt. Day s co., Lieut. Col. J. Brooks s (7th) regt. ; list of men tried 
by courts-martial subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; said Moss tried May 8 [year not 
given, probably 1782 or 1783], by regimental court-martial, Capt. Lincoln, 
President, on charge of breaking a lock to the provision store ; reported 
acquitted. 

Moss, PETER. Return of men raised in Essex Co. for Continental service, agree 
able to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780; engaged for town of Salem; engaged March 
5, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

Moss, RICHARD, New Gloucester. Return of men raised to serve in the Continen 
tal Army for the town of [New] Gloucester, Cumberland Co., for 3 years or 
during the war, as attested by Capt. William Harris and Selectman Enoch 
Fogg, Nov. 24,1778; residence, New Gloucester; joined Capt. Hills s co.,Col. 
Vose s regt.

ers ; reported a Seaman.

vice, 15 days. 

Moss, SETH. Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from May 2, 
1781, 8 mos. ; also, Corporal, same regt. ; service from Jan. 1, 1782, 12 mos.

Moss, THOMAS. Sergeant, Lieut. Alexander Kelloch s co. ; service, 2 mos. ; com 
pany detached from Col. Wheaton s and Col. Jones s regts. by order of Brig. 
Gen. Gushing to protect eastern part of Lincoln Co. and stationed at Camden 
and St. Georges from Nov. 13, 1779, to Feb. 13, 1780. 

Moss, WILLIAM, Swanzey. Private, Capt. Peleg Peck s co., Col. Thomas Carpen 
ter s regt. ; entered service Aug. 2, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 8 
days; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on an alarm; by order of Col. 
Slead all the men in Swanzey were joined in one company under Capt. Peck, 
the other officers refusing to serve ; roll sworn to at Rehoboth ; also, Capt. 
Jabez Barney s co., Col. Mitchel s regt. ; entered service Aug. 26, 1780; dis 
charged Nov. 1, 1780; service, 2 mos. 8 days, at Rhode Island; regiment 
detached from militia to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months ; roll sworn 
to at Rehoboth.

his regiment, agreeable to Gen. Washington s orders.

chester s co., Col. Ruggles Woodbridge s regt.; enlisted Aug. 17, 1777; dis 
charged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 21 days, with Northern army, including 
8 days (152 miles) travel home. 

MOULTON, ELIJAH, Monson. Private, Capt. Ames Walbridge s co., Col. David 
Brewer s (9th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 13, 1775; 
service, 2 mos. 23 days; also, same co. and regt. ; company return [probably 
Oct., 1775] ; also, Capt. Walbridge s co., Col. Rufus Putnam s (late Brewer s) 
regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury, Nov. 4, 
1775; also, Private, Capt. Aaron Charles s co., Lieut. Col. Robinson s detach 
ment of Hampshire Co. militia; muster roll dated Garrison at Ticonderoga, 
Feb. 24, 1777 ; enlisted Dec. 25, 1776 ; enlistment to expire March 25, 1777 ; 
also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from 9th co., Col. 
John Bliss s (1st Hampshire Co.) regt., as returned by Capt. Caleb Keep ; 
residence, Monson; engaged for town of Monson; joined Capt. Keep s co., 
Col. Sheaperd s regt. ; engaged March 1, 1778; term, 8 months; also, Private, 
(late) Capt. Keep s co. commanded by Lieut. John Wright, Col. William 
Shepard s (3d) regt.; muster roll for July and Aug., 1778; enlisted March 1 
[year not given]; enlistment, 8 (also given 9) months; reported sick and 
absent ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Oct., 1778, dated Providence ; 
reported discharged Nov. 1, 1778. 

MOULTON, EPHRAIM. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at 
Springfield, July 13, 1780 ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, light ; 
engaged for town of Lancaster; marched to camp July 13, 1780, under com 
mand of Capt. Thomas Pritchard. [See Ephraim Houghton and Ephraim 
Hoton.] 

MOULTON, EZRA, Lynn. Private; copy of a list of men belonging to Lynn, now 
called Lynn, Lynnfield, and Saugus, who served at Concord battle and else 
where [year not given] ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 13, 1780; age, 51 yrs.; stature, 5ft. 9 in. ; com 
plexion, ruddy; engaged for town of Lynn; marched to camp July 13, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Thomas Pritchard. 

MOULTON, FREEBORN, Monson. Captain of a (Monson) company of Minute-men, 
Col. Danielson s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cam 
bridge ; left Cambridge May 6, 1775 ; service, 21 days. 

MOULTON, GEORGE, Greenwich. Descriptive list dated West Point, Jan. 10, 1781 ; 
Capt. Smith s co., Col. Rufus Putnam s (5th) regt.; rank, Private; age, 21 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, dark ; eyes, dark ; hair, dark ; residence, 
Greenwich ; enlisted May 10, 1780, by Lieut. Stowers ; enlistment, during war ; 
company joined from 15th Mass. regt.

Mills s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; muster rolls for July-Sept., 
1781 ; reported sick in Flying Hospital in Aug., 1781, sick at New Windsor in 
Sept., 1781; also, muster roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Hutts; re 
ported sick at New Windsor; also, return of the sick belonging to the 1st 
Brigade in hospital at New Windsor, dated Dec. 24, 1781 ; 7th Mass. regt. ; 
reported discharged from hospital Dec. 17, 1781 ; also, Capt. William Mills s 
co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; muster rolls for Dec., 1781, and 
Jan., 1782, dated York Hutts; reported sick but present in Dec., 1781; also, 
list of men who died or were discharged subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; said 
Mouth reported died Jan. 19, 1782, of asthma at West Point. 

MOWER, EBENEZER, Barre. Private, Capt. Benjamin Nye sco., Col. Nathan Spar- 
hawk s regt.; enlisted Aug. 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 25, 1777; service, 10 
days, including travel (96 miles) home ; company marched to reinforce army 
under Gen. Stark at Bennington ; also, same co. ; enlisted Sept. 26, 1777 ; dis 
charged Oct. 18, 1777; service, 29 days, including travel (132 miles) home; 
company marched under command of Maj. Jonas Wilder to reinforce Northern 
army for 30 days. 

MOWER, JOHN. Capt. Nicholson Broughton s co., Col. Glover s regt. ; receipt for 
advance pay, signed by said Mower and others, dated Cambridge, June 27, 
1775. 

MOWER, JOHN. Private, Capt. Samuel Lamb s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s regt. ; 
enlisted April 29, 1778 ; service to Jan. 1, 1779, 8 mos. 5 days, at Rhode Island ;

co. and regt. ; muster rolls dated East Greenwich, Sept. 17, Sept. 22, Nov. 14, 
and Dec. 30, 1778 ; enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

MOWER, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Abijah Lamb s co., Col. Jacob Davis s 
(Worcester Co.) regt.; enlisted July 29, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; ser 
vice, 15 days, including 4 days (80 miles) travel home ; company marched to 
Tiverton, R. I., July 29, 1780, on an alarm. 

MOWER, JOSIAH. List of men mustered by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for

13, 1777 ; term, 3 years. 

MOWER, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Samuel Lamb s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s regt. ;

ter Co.) regt.; enlisted July 29, 1780; discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 14

MULLIKEN, ABNER. List of men raised in Cumberland Co. for the term of 9 months 
from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20,

missioner, at Fishkill, June 25, 1778; engaged for town of Scarborough;

Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778. 

MULLIKEN, AMOS. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Gage s co., Col. James Frye s regt. ; 
return of men in camp at Cambridge, dated May 17, 1775. 

MULLIKEN, AMOS, Jr. Lieut. Abel Kimball s detachment; list of men, sworn 
to at Andover, March 22, 1776, accompanying a petition to the General 
Court, signed by said Lieut. Kimball, stating that in consequence of a letter 
from the Committee of Safety of Gloucester, requesting that a draft be made 
from several towns to assist in preventing any attempt which might be made 
by the enemy to retake a brig laden with warlike stores, bound from Great 
Britain to Boston, captured and brought into Gloucester Nov. 29, 1775, he 
marched Nov. 30, 1775, with 12 men, including said Mulliken, and served 6 
days, travel home included, and asking allowance for service and billeting 
money ; petition granted by the House of Representatives April 24, 1776, and 
action concurred in by Council April 25, 1776. , 

MULLIKEN, BENJAMIN, Newburyport. Private, Capt. Joshua French s co., Lieut. 
Col. Enoch Putnam s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 12, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 27, 1781 ;

home ; regiment raised in Essex and Plymouth counties to reinforce Conti 
nental Army for 3 months.

to Aug. 20, 1779, on Penobscot expedition.

MULLIN, WILLIAM. Receipt dated May 13, 1783, for wages for service to May 10,

MULLINECK, ROBERT, Bradford. List of deserters from 6th Mass. regt. made up

MULLINS, JOHN. Return dated Boxford, of men mustered by John Gushing, Mus 
ter Master for Essex Co., to join the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, 
agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779 ; also, descriptive list of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, returned as received 
of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. Christopher Marshall, at Springfield, 
July 16, 1779; Col. Cross s regt. ; age, 22 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 63 in. ; complexion,, 
dark ; engaged for town of Newburyport ; also, petition dated Newburyport, 
signed by said Mullins and others, who enlisted agreeable to resolve of April 
20, 1778, and served in the Continental Army for 9 mos. in 1779 and 1780, 
asking that they receive wages for said service; petition endorsed " to with 
draw ; " also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Newburyport 
for service in the Continental Army during 1780; reported deserted. 

MULLIT, EPHBAIM. Receipt dated Cambridge, Feb. 21, 1778, signed by said Mullit 
and others belonging to Capt. John Walton s co., for wages for service to 
Feb. 3, 1778, said wages having been granted by the State as a bounty for ser 
vice as guards.

from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 
1778, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. 
Putnam, July 20,1778; engaged for town of Charlestown ; arrived at Fishkill 
June 20, 1778.

MULLIT, THOMAS, Marblehead. Private, Capt. Symonds s (9th) co., Col. John 
Glover s (21st) regt.; company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

MULLOTT, JOHN SMITH. Corporal, Capt. Ezra Badlam s co., Col. L. Baldwin s 
(26th) regt.; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., for the year 1776, sworn 
to April 23, 1777 ; reported discharged 280 miles from home. 

MULLOY, HUGH, Brunswick. Corporal, Capt. William Lithgow s co. ; marched 
Feb. 19, 1776; service to Aug. 31, 1776, 6 mos. 11 days; company stationed at 
Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast; also, Sergeant, Capt. 
William Lithgow, Jr. s co., Col. Mitchel s regt.; service from Aug. 31, 1776, 
to date of discharge, Nov. 23, 1776, 2 mos. 23 days; reported promoted from 
Corporal Oct. 16, 1776; company stationed at Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for 
defence of seacoast ; also, Lieutenant, Col. Tupper s regt. ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported as serv 
ing 19 mos. 12 days as Ensign, 16 mos. 18 days as Lieutenant ; promoted Aug. 
12, 1778; also, Capt. George White s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt.; sub

also, Ensign, Capt. George White s co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s regt.; return 
dated Jan. -, 1778; residence, Brunswick; mustered by Col. Varrick, Conti-

nental Muster Master; also, petition addressed to the General Court, dated

also, company return dated Oct. 7, 1775; also, Capt. King s co., 9th regt.

alent in money dated Roxbury Camp, Dec. 2, 1775.

MUNROE, ABIJAH, Lincoln. Private, Capt. William Smith s co. of Minute-men,

return dated Sept. 30, 1775 ; reported sick and absent ; also, receipt dated 
Lincoln, signed by said Munroe and others belonging to Capt. John Hartwell s 
co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt., for wages for service in March, 1776, at the 
time of taking Dorchester Heights; also, Corporal, Capt. James Swan s (1st) 
co., Col. Thomas Crafts s (Artillery) regt. ; abstract for advance pay, etc., 
sworn to at Boston, June 8, 1776; also, same co. and regt. ; service from Aug. 
1, 1776, to Dec. 1, 1776, 4 mos. ; rolls dated Boston ; also, Capt. Philip Marett s 
(1st) co., Col. Crafts s regt. ; service from Dec. 1, 1776, to Feb. 1, 1777, 2 mos. ; 
also, Sergeant, same co. and regt. ; service from Feb. 1, 1777, to May 8, 1777, 
3 mos. 7 days ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778 ; Capt. Farrar s co., Col. Brooks s 
regt. ; age, 22 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; residence, Lincoln ; engaged for town 
of Lincoln ; arrived at Fishkill June 17, 1778. 

MUNROB, ABRAHAM, Harvard. 4th Sergeant, Capt. Jonathan Davis s co., Col. 
John Whitcomb s regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775, to Cambridge; left place of rendezvous April 25, 1775; service, 6 
days; also, 1st Sergeant, Capt. Jonathan Davis s co., Col. Asa Whetcomb s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; engaged April 26, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 
13 days; also, company receipts for wages for Aug. and Sept., 1775, dated 
Camp at Prospect Hill. 

MUNROB, ABRAHAM, Harvard. Private, Capt. Benjamin Brown s co., Col. Michael 
Jackson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from April 1, 

1777, to March 11, 1778 ; residence, Harvard ; reported died March 11, 1778. 

MUNROE, AMOS, Shutesbury. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Capt. Zaccheus Crocker s co., Col. Phineas Wright s regt., dated 
Shutesbury, Jan. 28, 1778; residence, Shutesbury; engaged for town of 
Shutesbury; joined Capt. Shays s co., Col. Putnam s regt.; term, 3 years; 
also, Private, Major s co., Col. Putnam s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to. Feb. 6, 1780. 

MUNROE, ANDREW. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for Middle 
sex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, descriptive 
list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, 
agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Com 
missioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 15, 1780; age, 16 
yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, dark; engaged for town of Woburn ; 
marched to camp July 15, 1780, under command of Capt. James Cooper. 

MUNROE, ASA, Lexington. Private, Capt. Simon Hunt s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; 
company return [year not given] ; said Munroe reported as having been sent 
with the wounded. 

MUNROE, ASAHEL. List of men raised in Berkshire Co. for the term of 9 months 
from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 

1778, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Put 
nam, July 20, 1778; engaged for town of Great Barrington ; arrived at Fish- 
kill June 1, 1778. 

MUNROE, BENJAMIN, Pembroke. Private, Capt. James Hatch s co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from West Parish in Pem 
broke to Scituate and Marshfield ; discharged April 29, 1775 ; service, 11 days. 



216 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

MUNROE, BENJAMIN, Stow. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Benjamin Edgel s (6th) co., Col. 
John Robinson s regt. ; list of officers chosen in said company ; ordered in 
Council Feb. 12, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commis 
sioned Feb. 12, 1776 ; also reported that commissions be dated Feb. 5, 1776 ; 
company raised in Beading, Woburn, "Wilmington, Maiden, Medford, Stone- 
ham, Charlestown, and Stow, to reinforce the army and serve until April 1, 
1776 ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. David Jewell s 6th (2d Stow) co. ; list of 
officers chosen in 1st and 2d Stow cos., as returned by Maj. Jonathan Hapgood, 
dated Stow, July 2, 1776; reported commissioned July 5, 1776; also, Captain, 
6th (2d Stow) co. ; list of officers chosen in said company, as returned by Maj. 
Jonathan Hapgood, dated Stow, Dec. 11, 1776 ; ordered in Council Dec. 16, 1776, 
that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned Dec. 16 (also given 
Dec. 15), 1776; also, commission dated Boston, Dec. 16, 1776, appointing said 
Munroe Captain of the 6th co., Col. Ezekiel Howe s (4th Middlesex Co.) regt. 
of Mass, militia ; also, Captain ; entered service Dec. 24 [year not given, prob 
ably 1777] ; service, 3 mos. 10 days; also, report of guard detail, dated Camp 
at Quidneset, North Kingston, Feb. 2, 1778, made by said Munroe, Captain, 
officer of the day, to Maj. Abner Perrey ; Sergeant Farrar reported in com 
mand of said Munroe s guard ; also, weekly returns made by said Munroe, 
Captain, of the company under his command, Col. Sprout s regt., from Jan. 
12, 1778, to March 31, 1778 [the foregoing from Dec. 24, 1777, appear among 
orders, returns, etc., taken from said Munroe s papers]. 

MUNROE, DANIEL. Capt. Edward Payson Williams s co., Col. John Greaton s 
regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge 
Camp, Dec. 22, 1775. 

MUNROE, DANIEL. Seaman, brigantine "Freedom," commanded by Capt. John 
Clouston ; engaged Sept. 6, 1777 ; discharged Sept. 14, 1777 ; service, 8 days. 

MUNROE, DAVID. Orders, returns, etc., taken from Capt. Benjamin Munroe s 
papers ; list of men belonging to the alarm list of Capt. Benjamin Munroe s 
(6th) co., 4th Middlesex Co. regt., who were under 50 years of age, probably 
made up in 1776. 

MUNROE, EBENEZER. Capt. Miles s co. ; company receipt, given to Edmund 
Munro, dated Lexington, Feb. 18, 1777, for mileage and travel home; service 
on campaign at Ticonderoga. 

MUNROE, EBENEZER. Private, Capt. Samuel Farrar s co., Col. Reed s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 29, 1777; discharged Nov. 7, 1777; service, 1 mo. 10 days; com 
pany detached from Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. to reinforce army under Gen. 
Gates at the Northward. 

MUNROE, EDMUND. Council warrant dated May 24, 1779, for 100, drawn in favor 
of Rebecca Munro, widow of said Munroe, (late) Captain, Col. Bigelow s 
regt., on account of money allowed him by resolve of Feb. 6, 1779. 

MUNROE, ELIJAH. Return of men raised in Suffolk Co. for Continental service, 
agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780; engaged for town of Boston; engaged 
June 4, 1781. 

MUNROE, ISAAC, Lincoln. Capt. John Minot s co., Col. Dike s regt. ; pay abstract 
for mileage to and from Dorchester Heights and travel allowance home ; mile 
age (40 miles) and travel for 1 day allowed said Munroe ; warrant allowed in 
Council Nov. 30, 1776. 

MUNROE, ISAAC. Receipt dated Lincoln, Sept. 21, 1776, signed by said Munroe and 
others belonging to Capt. John Hartwell s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt., for 
wages for service in March, 1776, at the time of taking Dorchester Heights.

for April, 1776, dated New York ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay abstract for

miles from home. 

MUNROE, ISAAC. Private, Capt. Parker s co., Col. Jeduthan Baldwin s regt. of 
artificers; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 21, 1777, to 
Dec. 31, 1779 ; term, 3 years. 

MUNROE, JAMES. Petition dated Boston, March 31, 1781, signed by William and 
John Shattuck, in behalf of themselves and others, asking that said Munroe 
be commissioned as commander of the ship " Belisarius" (privateer) ; advised 
in Council April 14, 1781, that a commission be issued. 

MUNROE, JEDEDIAH, Roxbury. Private, Capt. Moses Whiting s co., Col. John 
Greaton sregt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; 
service, 13 days.

ton s (3d) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 7, 1778,

MUNROE, JOHN, Athol. Private, Capt. Ezekiel Knowlton s co., Col. Dike s regt. ;

nental Army, as returned by Capt. Thomas Lord ; residence, Athol ; engaged 
for town of Athol ; joined Capt. Blanshard s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; term to

Master for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Blanchard s co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; mus 
tered June 13, 1777 ; term, 3 years. 

MUNROE, JOHN. Sergeant, in a company commanded by Lieut. Amos Fairbank, 
Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; entered service Sept. 6, 1777 ; marched Sept. 8, 1777 ; 
service, 2 mos. 24 days, under Brig. Warner ; reported furloughed Nov. 29, 
1777 ; company drafted from militia and marched to join Continental Army 
at the Northward.

at the Northward. 

MUNROO, SQUIRE. Corporal, Capt. Joseph Franklin s (Rehoboth) co., Col. John 
Daggett s regt. ; entered service Jan. 1,1778; discharged March 31, 1778; ser

1778. 

MUNROW, ABEL. Capt. Silas Goodrich s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire Co.) 
regt. ; enlisted Aug. 15, 1778 [7] ; discharged Aug. 21, 1778 [7] ; service, 7 days, 
under Brig. Gen. Stark ; company took part in action at Bennington Aug. 16, 
1778 [7], and was discharged by Brig. Gen. Stark.

dence, Shutesbury; engaged for town of Shutesbury; mustered by Col. 
Woodbridge.

Woburn for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 10, 
1780; discharged Dec. 8, 1780; service, 5 mos. 9 days, including travel (220 
miles) home. 

MUNROW, " ASEL." Capt. Silas Goodrich s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berkshire Co.)

Brig. Gen. Stark ; company took part in action at Bennington Aug. 16, 1778 [7], 
and was discharged by Brig. Gen. Stark. 

MUNROW, DAN. Private, Capt. William Cannon s co., Col. David Leonard s regt. ; 
service, 70 days; company drafted, marched to Ticonderoga May 6, 1777, 
and returned home July 14, 1777. Roll sworn to at Blandford and also at 
Westfield. 

MUNROW, EDMUND. Account of the seven years half pay allowed agreeable to re 
solve of Aug. 24, 1780, to widows and orphans of officers who were killed or 
died in service; [Col.] Bigelow s regt.; rank, Captain; reported killed at 
Monmouth June 28, 1778 ; half pay allowed to June 28, 1785. 

MUNROW, EDMUND. Private, Capt. Benjamin Peabody s co., Lieut. Col. Enoch 
Putnam s regt. ; enlisted Oct. 8, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 3, 1781 ; service, 2 mos. 
8 days, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Essex 
and Plymouth counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

MUNROW, EPHRAIM. Surgeon, Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; engaged July 29, 1778; 
discharged Sept. 11, 1778; service, 1 mo. 14 days, at Rhode Island. 

MUNROW, ISAAC. Fifer, Capt. Benjamin Blaney s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. 
of guards; joined Jan. 12, 1778; service to April 3, 1778, 83 days, at Cam 
bridge; also, "fife Mg B rad," Capt. Stephen Frost s co.,Col. Cyprian How s 
regt. ; entered service Aug. 12, 1780, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Nov. 
1, 1780; service, 2 mos. 24 days, at Rhode Island, including travel (60 miles) 
home ; regiment raised for 3 months.

Lieut. Col. Joseph Webb; marched Sept. 8, 1781; discharged Dec. 3, 1781;

pany detached from Col. Dana s regt. ; regiment raised to join Continental 
Army near West Point for 3 months. Roll sworn to in Middlesex Co.

MUNROW, JOHN, Athol. Private, Capt. John Blanchard s Co., Col. James Wes

Col. Thomas Marshall s regt., for advance pay for 1 month, etc. ; also, Pri 
vate, Capt. Micah Hamlen s co., Col. Thomas Marshall s regt. ; enlisted June

at Dartmouth, Bedford, and Falmouth, Sept. 6, 1778; also, list of men raised 
for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed 
muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780.

Jan. 1, 1780, dated West Point, Dec. 24, 1780.

MUNROW, JOSIAH, Dorchester. Private, (late) Capt. Samuel Foster s co., Col.

ter; mustered by County Muster Master Barber; also, Private, in a company 
commanded by Lieut. James Tisdale, Col. Greaton s regt. ; muster roll dated

Col. Borsick ; also, (late) Capt. Foster s co. commanded by Lieut. James Tis 
dale, Col. Greaton s regt.; muster roll dated White Plains, Aug. 5,1778;

roll for Aug., 1778, dated White Plains ; reported on command with Col. Var 
rock ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Sept., 1778; reported on com

Hutts; reported reduced to Private Jan. 1, 1782; also, descriptive list dated

12 to Oct. 19, 1780.

of the United States") ; pay roll for Oct., 1778.

June 5, 1778 ; residence, Stockbridge.

MURRAY, JOHN, Milton. Order dated Dorchester, May 30, 1778, signed by Stephen 
Badlam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., for the apprehension of said Murray 
and others at Milton, they having been reported to him as Continental soldiers 
at home without leave, unless they could produce physicians certificates of 
their inability to march or were supplied with proper furloughs, in which case 
they were to be permitted to remain at home ; also, certificate dated May 30, 
1775, signed by John Sprague, Physician, certifying that said Murray, being 
ill with fever and ague, was unable to " walk a single mile." 

MURRAY, JOHN, Southampton. List of men raised by the town of Southampton to 
serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Capt. Lemuel Pomeroy and the 
Selectmen, dated March 30, 1779; residence, Southampton ; engaged for town 
of Southampton; joined Capt. Danforth s co., Col. Shepard s regt.; term, 3 
years; also, Private, Capt. Field s co., Col. William Sheppard s regt. ; Conti 
nental Army pay accounts for service from March 1, 1777, to July 1, 1777; 
reported deceased; also, Capt. Reuben Slayton s co., Col. Shepard s regt.; 
return dated Valley Forge, Jan. 30, 1778; mustered by County and Continen 
tal Muster Masters; reported executed.

MURRAY, SETH, Hatfield. Lieutenant, Capt. Perez Graves s co., which marched 
April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Ware ; service,

ment raised to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

also, same co. and regt. ; enlisted May 3, 1780; discharged Nov. 20, 1780; ser

MURRY, WILLIAM, Newbury. List of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

MURRY, WILLIAM, Newbury. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, 
as returned by Moses Noyes, Chairman of Selectmen and Committee of New 
bury, sworn to Aug. 23, 1777 ; residence, Newbury ; engaged for town of New 
bury; joined Capt. Daniel Pilsbury s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; term, 
3 years; also, Private, Lieut. Colonel s co., Col. Vose s regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780. 

MURRY, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Stephen Jenkins s co., Col. Thomas Poor s 
regt.; engaged May 28, 1778; discharged Jan. 29, 1779; service, 8 mos. 16 
days, at North river, including 13 days (260 miles) travel home; also, same 
co. and regt.; pay roll for Sept., 1778, dated Fort Clinton; term, 8 months 
from time of arrival at Peekskill ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Nov. 
and Dec., 1778, dated King s Ferry. 

MURRY, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Jedediah Goodwin s co., Col. Joseph Prime s 
regt. ; muster roll made up from time of marching from home to July 1, 
1780, including 3 days march, dated Falmouth; joined May 5, 1780; term, 
8 months; also, same co. and regt. ; enlisted May 3, 1780; discharged Nov. 20, 
1780; service, 6 mos. 18 days, under Brig. Gen. Wadsworth at the Eastward ; 
roll sworn to in York Co. 

MURRY, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. John Williams s co., Col. Joseph Vose s (1st) 
regt. ; muster roll for Feb. and March, 1781; reported transferred to corps of 
invalids at Boston Feb. 25, 1781. 

MURTHER, JOHN. Capt. Robert Davis s co., Col. Freeman s regt. ; service, 37 days ; 
company raised to serve on a secret expedition at Rhode Island. Roll sworn 
to in Suffolk Co., Dec. 4, 1777. 

MUSCROFT, . [This name also appears under the form of Mascroft.] 

MUSCROFT, JOHN. Private, Capt. William Clark s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
regt.; entered service Aug. 14, 1777; service, 8 days; company marched from 
Gageborough to Bennington Aug. 14, 1777, by order of Gen. Stark on an 
alarm. 

MUSE, BARZILLAI. Private, Capt. Daniel Warner s (1st) co. ; enlisted Jan. 27, 
1776 ; service to Feb. 29, 1776, 1 mo. 5 days ; company stationed at Gloucester 
for defence of seacoast. 

MUSHWACK, MICHAEL. Descriptive list of men detached from Boston regt. to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months from the time of their 
arrival at place of rendezvous, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned 
as received of Maj. Stephen Badlam, by Capt. Anthony Burk, at Roxbury, 
July 3, 1779, to be delivered to Justin Ely, Esq., at Springfield ; age, 22 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; hair, brown ; eyes, blue ; complexion, fair and pitted ; re 
ported detached from Capt. Davis s co. ; also, list of men returned as received 
of Stephen Badlam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., by Justin Ely, Commis 
sioner, at Springfield, July 9, 1779, at the hands of Mr. Anthony Burk. 

MUSKWASK, MICHAEL. Descriptive list of men detached from Boston regt. to serve 
in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June

MUSSEY, BENJAMIN. Matross, Capt. Abner Lowell s co. of matrosses stationed at

Mitchell s regt.; detached July 7,1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service,

Capt. Peter Warren s co., Col. Jonathan Mitchell s regt.; detached July

expedition.

MUSTARD, DAVID. Private, Capt. John Reed s co., Col. James Hunter s corps 
raised for defence of eastern Massachusetts; enlisted April 18, 1782; dis 
charged Nov. 20, 1782; service, 7 mos. 3 days. 

MUSTERD, JAMES, Topsham. Captain, 2d co., 1st Lincoln Co. regt. of Mass, militia ;

officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned July 1, 1776 ; also, Captain, 
2d co., Col. Samuel McCobb s (Lincoln Co.) regt. ; regimental return made 
by Lieut. Col. Dummer Sewall, dated Georgetown, Nov. 19, 1779; residence, 
Topsham. 

MUSTERD, JAMES. Private, Capt. Acter Patten s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s regt. ; 
enlisted July 6, 1779; discharged Aug. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo. 18 days, on 
Penobscot expedition. Roll certified at Topsham. 

MUTCH, JOHN. Private, Capt. Abner Crane s co., Col. Jacob Garish s (Gerrish s) 
regt. ; enlisted Oct. 11, 1779; discharged Dec. 2, 1779; service, 1 mo. 19 days; 
company marched to Claverack. Roll dated Stoughton.

Roll dated Boston. [See Reuben Merchant.]

miles) from West Point home. 

MUXHAM, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Joseph Parker s co.,Col. John Cushing s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 21, 1776 ; service, 59 days, at Rhode Island.

others, for bounty for service at Rhode Island in Capt. Samuel Briggs s co., 
Col. Cotten s regt., payable to Lieut. Solomon Young.

co., Col. Cotten s regt., payable to Lieut. Solomon Young. 

MUXOM, NATHAN. Private, Capt. David Nye s (14th) co., 4th Plymouth Co. regt. ; 
service, 10 days; company marched to Rhode Island Dec. 10, 1776, on an

marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; company 
marched to Rhode Island on an alarm ; roll sworn to at Middleborough. 

MUXOM, REUBEN. Private, Capt. Haffield White s co., Col. Rufus Putnam s (5th) 
regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1781, dated West Point ; enlisted July 9, 1780 ; dis 
charged Jan. 9, 1781; enlistment, 6 months. 

MUXOM, REUBEN. Private, Capt. Ignatius Loring, Jr s co., Lieut. Col. Putnam s 
regt. ; enlisted Sept. 4, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 8, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 17 days, 
including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; company raised in Plymouth Co. ; 
regiment raised to reinforce army under Gen. Washington for 3 months. 

MUXOM, SAMUEL, Middleborough. Private, Capt. Isaac Wood s 2d Middleborough

regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1,1775; enlisted May 8, 1775; service, 3 mos. 1 day. 

MUXSOM, CALEB. Private, Capt. Abishai Tinkham s co., Col. Ebenezer Sproutt s 
regt. ; entered service May 6 ; discharged May 9 ; entered service Sept. 6 ; dis 
charged Sept. 12 ; service, 9 days ; company marched from Middleborough to 
Dartmouth on two alarms in 1778. 

MUXSOM, ELLIS. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Washburn s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s 
regt. of guards; enlisted Nov. 11, 1777; service, 24 days, at Cambridge; re 
ported deserted Dec. 5, 1777. 

MUXSOM, JOSEPH, Bridgewater. Private, Lieut. Zachariah Watkins s co., Col. 
Ezra Wood s regt. ; enlisted May 13, 1778; service, 3 mos. 27 days, at North 
river; regiment raised for 8 months from time of arrival at Peekskill; also,

kins, dated White Plains, Sept. 12, 1778, signed by said Muxsom, for wages, 
etc., for service in Col. Wood s regt. in 1778.

for 3 months. Roll dated Wareham.

Hancock to serve for 40 days, unless sooner discharged. 

MUXUM, JOHN. Private, Capt. Amasa Soper s co., Col. Marshall s regt. ; subsistence

Asa Whitcomb s regt. ; muster roll dated Camp at Ticonderoga, Nov. 27, 
1776 ; enlisted Dec. 1, 1775; reported sick in general hospital.

term to expire Jan. 10, 1778.

Spencer; engaged for town of Spencer; regiment raised for 3 months; roll 
sworn to at Brookfield.

reinforce Continental Army for 3 months and stationed at Rhode Island.

pany detached from Col. Dana s regt. ; regiment raised to join Continental 
Army near West Point for 3 months. Roll sworn to in Middlesex Co.

liam Henry, dated Barre, Dec. 29, 1777; residence, Barre; engaged for town 
of Barre ; joined Capt. Gates s co., Col. Putnam s regt. ; term, 3 years.

commissioned Jan. 29, 1776.

Samuel Denny s (Worcester Co.) regt. ; marched Sept. 27, 1777 ; discharged 
Oct. 18, 1777; service, 1 mo., including 8 days (157 miles) travel home; com 
pany marched to reinforce Northern army; roll dated Spencer.

MUZZY, NATHAN, Spencer. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeahle to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 7, 1780; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complex 
ion, light ; engaged for town of Spencer ; marched to camp July 7, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Dix; also, Private, Capt. Abel Holden s (Light Infantry) 
co., Col. Thomas Nixon s (6th) regt. ; payrolls for July-Oct., 1780; enlisted 
July 7, 1780; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by 
Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Spencer for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched July 5, 
1780; discharged Nov. 9, 1780; service, 4 mos. 17 days, including travel (260 
miles) home. 

MUZZY, NATHAN. Fifer, Capt. David Prouty s co., Maj. Asa Baldwin s division, 
Col. Samuel Denny s (Worcester Co.) regt.; marched Sept. 27, 1777; dis 
charged Oct. 18, 1777; service, 1 mo., including 8 days (157 miles) travel 
home ; company marched to reinforce Northern army. Roll dated Spencer. 

MUZZY, ROBERT, Dublin (also given Holliston) . Capt. Lealand s co., Col. Ephraim 
Doolittle s regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Muzzy and others, 
dated Cambridge, June 24, 1775; also, Sergeant, Capt. Jacob Miller s co., Col. 
Ephraim Doolittle s (24th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged 
April 25, 1775; service, 3 mos. 16 days; also, company return dated Camp at 
"Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money 
dated Winter Hill, Oct. 31, 1775; also, Lieutenant, Col. John Bailey s (2d) 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 
31, 1779 ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Isaac Warren s co., Col. Bailey s regt. ; com 
pany return dated Camp Valley Forge, Jan. 24, 1778; mustered by County 
Muster Master; also, order on the Board of War, payable to Lieut. Col. Ezra 
Badlam, dated Camp White Plains, N. Y., Aug. 19, 1778, signed by said 
Muzzy and others, for the State donation on account of service in the Conti 
nental Army; also, return of officers for clothing, certified at Dorchester,

fied at Dorchester, Sept. 24, 1779 ; also, Lieutenant, 2d Mass. regt. commanded 
by Lieut. Col. Ezra Badlam ; return of officers, certified at Boston, Dec. 7, 
1779. 

MUZZY, THADDEUS, Lexington. Private, in a detachment from Lexington militia 
co. commanded by John Bridge; service, 5 days; detachment reported on 
command at Cambridge from May 11 to May 15, 1775, by order of Committee 
of Safety; also, Private, in a detachment from Lexington militia co. com 
manded by Capt. John Parker; service, 2 days; detachment reported on

Prospect Hill, Oct. 26, 1775; also, petition signed by said Myrick and others

days, including travel (120 miles) home. [See Caleb Nurse.] 

NASH, CALEB. Petition addressed to the General Court, dated Concord, Sept. 30, 
1777, signed by said Nash and others who were drafted to guard Continental 
stores at Little Cambridge, Concord, Sudbury, etc., under Capt. Isaac Woods, 
asking for additional wages; petition endorsed "Leave to withdraw."

NASH, DANIEL, Greenfield. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Ebenezer Arms s (10th) co., Col. 
David Field s (5th Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers 
chosen in said regiment, dated Deerfield, April 22, 1776 ; ordered in Council 
May 3, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned May 
3, 1776; also, petition addressed to the Council, dated Greenfield, April 13, 
1780, signed by said Nash, of Greenfield, stating that he had been commis 
sioned Lieutenant of the 10th co., 5th regt., May 3, 1776, and that by reason of 
old age and infirmity he was no longer able to serve in that capacity, and ask 
ing permission to resign his commission ; certificate attached, signed by Lieut. 
Col. David Wells, certifies that said Nash was both old and infirm and unable 
to serve either at home or abroad ; ordered in Council April 25, 1780, that the 
resignation be accepted.

company ordered to Fort Edward ; also, Capt. Silas Goodrich s co., Col. John

Northern department; company ordered out by Maj. Gen. Gates.

Mitchell s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of

NASH, DAVID, Abington. Private, Capt. William Reed s co., Gen. John Thomas s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 27, 1775 ; service, 2 mos., 
2 weeks, 1 day; also, company return dated Camp at Roxbury, Oct. 6, 1775; 
reported died July 6, 1775; also, order dated Abington, March 2, 1776, signed 
by the Selectmen, for money in lieu of bounty coats due said Nash and others, 
deceased. 

NASH, DAVID, Abington. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 15, 1780; age, 26 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 in. ; complexion, 
dark ; engaged for town of Abington ; marched to camp July 15, 1780, under 
command of Capt. James Cooper; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a re 
turn dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Abington for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched to camp July 10, 1780; discharged Jan. 15, 1781; service, 
6 mos. 17 days, including travel (240 miles) home. 

NASH, DAVID, South Hadley. Private, Capt. Noah Goodman s (South Hadley) 
co., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days; also f 
Capt. James Hendrick s co. ; pay abstract for mileage to and from headquar 
ters, dated Charlestown, Camp No. 3, Jan. 13, 1776; mileage for 100 miles 
allowed said Nash ; also, Lieut. Reuben Judd s co., Col. Elisha Porter s 
(Hampshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 9, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 12, 1777 ; ser 
vice, 39 days, with Northern army, including travel (110 miles) home. 

NASH, DAVID. Private, Capt. Edward Cobb s co., Col. Edward Mitchel s regt.,. 
Gen. Cushing s brigade; service, 2 weeks 1 day; company marched from 
Abington to Bristol, R. I., Dec. 9, 1776, on an alarm. 

NASH, DAVID. Communication addressed to the Council, dated South Hadley, 
May 21, 1777, signed by R. Woodbridge, Lieutenant Colonel, 4th Hampshire 
Co. regt., stating that said Nash had been chosen Captain of the militia co. in 
South Hadley May 8, 1777, and asking that he be commissioned ; ordered in 
Council June 11, 1777, that a commission be issued ; reported commissioned 
June 7 [ ?], 1777 ; also, communication addressed to the Council, dated South 
Hadley, March 26, 1778, signed by R. Woodbridge, Lieutenant Colonel, stating 
that said Nash, Captain of 2d co., 4th Hampshire Co. regt., had resigned, 
giving as reason that " he is not able Bodied for the Duties of his Station," 
and asking that the vacancy be immediately filled ; ordered in Council April 
2, 1778, that the resignation be accepted.

service, 6 days, on an alarm at Rhode Island. 

NASH, SOLOMON, Abington. Private, Capt. William Reed s co., Gen. John 
Thomas s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 27, 1775 ; ser

brigade by order of the General Court of Aug. 9, 1777, to reinforce Northern 
army ; company raised in Berwick and from 2d York Co. regt. ; also, 2d Lieu 
tenant, Capt. Samuel Grant s co., (late) Col. Storer s regt.; engaged Aug. 
14, 1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 123 days, with Northern army, 
including 15 days (300 miles) travel home ; company discharged at Queman s 
Heights. 

NASON, JOSHUA. Corporal, Capt. Silas Wild s co., Col. Edmund Phinney s regt. ; 
muster roll dated Garrison at Fort George, Dec. 8, 1776; enlisted Jan. 1, 1776. 

NASON, JOSHUA. Captain, 7th (Arundel) co., 3d York Co. regt. of Mass, militia;

ordered in Council March 29, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported 
commissioned March 27 [ ? ], 1776; also, Captain, (late) Col. Storer s regt.; 
engaged Aug. 14, 1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 123 days, with 
Northern army, including 15 days (300 miles) travel home ; company dis 
charged at Queman s Heights. 

NASON, JOSIAH. Private, Capt. Samuel Knight s co. ; enlisted July 15, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 6 mos. 1 day; company stationed at Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for

Feb. 1, 1776; company raised in North Yarmouth, Brunswick, Harpswell, 
New Gloucester, New Boston (Gray), and Windham, Cumberland Co., for 
2 months service during the siege of Boston in 1776. 

NASON, MOSES, Berwick. List of men mustered by Joseph Bragdon, Jr., Muster

Col. John Bailey s regt. ; residence, Berwick ; term, 3 years ; reported received 
State bounty; also, Private, 2d co., Col. John Bailey s regt.; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 3, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. 
Samuel Darby s (2d) co., Col. Bailey s regt. ; company return dated Camp

Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Feb. 15, 1780; 
also, Capt. Jedediah Goodwin s co., Col. Joseph Prime s regt. ; muster roll 
made up from time of marching from home to July 1, 1780, including 3 days

co. and regt. ; enlisted May 3, 1780 ; discharged Nov. 20, 1780 ; service, 6 mos. 
18 days, under Brig. Gen. Wadsworth at the Eastward.

NAZRO, NATHANIEL, Worcester. Captain Lieutenant, Capt. Edward Crafts s co.,

NEEDHAM, FB. DRAKE, Belchertown. Private, Capt. Oliver Coney s co., Col.

Continental Army for 3 months. Roll sworn to at Ware.

at the time of the reduction of Gen. Burgoyne.

of pay to last of July, 1775; enlisted May 3, 1775 ; also, (late) Capt. Bragdon s 
co., Col. Scammon s regt.; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money 
dated Nov. 1, 1775; also, receipt dated March 8, 1777, for bounties paid said 
Nelle and others by Col. Benjamin Brown, Muster Master, for enlisting into 
the Continental Army; said Nelle joined Capt. Ashly s co., Col. Paterson s 
regt. 

NELLE, WILLIAM. Order dated Cambridge, June 30, 1775, signed by Lieut. Col. 
William Bond, for accoutrements for the use of said Nelle and others belonging 
to Capt. Benjamin Bowne s co., Col. Thomas Gardner s regt. ; also, Private, 
Capt. Bowne s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (late Col. Thomas Gardner s) 
37th regt. ; company return dated Camp Prospect Hill, Oct. 7, 1775 ; reported 
as belonging to Georgia.

NELLING, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Isaac Morton s co., commanded by Lieut. 
Zaccheus Thayer subsequent to Oct. 12, 1778, Col. Thomas Poor s regt. ; en 
listed July 19, 1778; discharged Aug. 7, 1778; service, 1 mo. 1 day, including

time of arrival at Peekskill. 

NELLSON, BENJAMIN. Receipt dated Brimfield, April 1, 1781, for bounties paid 
said Nellson and others by the town of Brimfield to serve in the Continental 
Army for the term of 3 years. 

NELLSON, EBENEZER. Corporal, Capt. Amos Washburn s co., Col. Ebenezer 
White s regt.; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 
9 days; company marched to Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at 
Middleborough. 

NELLSON, GERSHOM, Mendon. Captain ; list of officers appointed to command 
men enlisted or drafted from [Worcester Co.] brigade, as returned to Maj. 
Gen. Warren [year not given] ; company drafted from Col. Ezra Wood s 
regt. to join Col. Josiah Whitney s or Col. Nathan Sparhawk s regt. 

NELLSON, ISAAC. Certificate dated Halifax Harbor, Oct. 7, 1778, signed by said 
Nellson, Lieutenant, and others, certifying that none of the American pris 
oners, of whom they formed a part and who were to be sent to Boston in the 
cartel " Silver Eel " to be exchanged for British subjects, had been compelled 
to proceed on board, but that all the convalescents went of their own free 
will and at their earnest desire ; also, list of prisoners sent in the cartel 
" Silver Eel " from Halifax to Boston Oct. 8, 1778, to be exchanged for British 
prisoners, as returned by Bat. Fox, Commissary of Prisoners; reported Lieu 
tenant of an armed vessel. 

NELLSON, JOHN. Major, 4th Plymouth Co. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Eben 
ezer White ; entered service July 31, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 8, 1780 ; service, 
9 days, at Rhode Island. Roll dated Rochester. 

NELLSON, JOSIAH. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned

Mass, regt., at Springfield, July 6, 1780 ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; com 
plexion, light; engaged for town of Upton; marched to camp July 6, 1780, 
under command of Lieut. Taylor, of 2d Mass. regt.

regt. ; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; com

vice between June 1, 1778, and Jan. 31, 1779, 7 mos. 25 days, at Peekskill and

army under Gen. Gates and serve for 30 days. Roll dated Monson.

accepted ; resignations of said officers approved and recommended by Lieut. 
Col. Samuel Craggin on the ground that the acceptance of the same would be 
for the public good ; resignations accepted in Council Nov. 16, 1779.

company marched on an alarm at Bennington. Roll sworn to at Lancaster. 

NELSON, JOSEPH, Ipswich. Private, Capt. Abraham How s co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from West Parish in Ipswich ; service, 2 days.

NELSON, JOSIAH (also given JOSIAH, Jr.), Upton. List of men raised for the 6

NELSON, JOSIAH. Sergeant, Lieut. Seth Thayer s co., 3d Worcester Co. regt.;

NELSON, LEMUEL, Brimfield. Receipt dated Brimfield, April 1, 1781, for bounty 
paid said Nelson and others by the town of Brimfield to serve in the Continen 
tal Army for the term of 3 years ; also, descriptive list of men raised in Hamp 
shire Co. to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Noah Goodman, 
Superintendent ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. (also given 5 ft. 3 and 5 ft. 5 in.) ; 
complexion, light; hair, light; eyes, light; occupation, farmer (also given 
yeoman and laborer) ; residence, Brimfield ; engaged for town of Brimfield 
(also given Blandford) ; engaged March 29 (also given April 29) , 1781 ; joined 
Capt. James Tisdale s co., Col. John Greaton s (3d) regt. ; term, 3 years ; also,

ter rolls for Jan. and Feb., 1783; also, Capt. Tisdale s (4th) co., 3d Mass. regt.

balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 7 mos. 28 days; also, 3d co., 3d 
Mass. regt. ; list of men who died or were discharged in 1783 ; said Nelson dis 
charged Oct. 14, 1783, at West Point.

.NELSON, SAMUEL, Newbury (also given Newburyport) . Private, Capt. Benjamin 
Perkins s co., Col. Moses Little s (17th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775;

Oct., 1775] ; age, 26 yrs. ; also, order dated Newburyport, June 17, 1776, signed 
by Moses Hoyt, attorney to Anna Hoyt, administratrix, for money in lieu of 
a bounty coat due said Nelson who was killed at Bunker Hill ; also, account 
showing sums of money to be paid from the public treasury to sundry persons 
for losses sustained at battles of Lexington and Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed 
in Council June 27, 1776 ; the amount for the use of the heirs of said Nelson 
was paid to Stephen Cross.

IX THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 325 

NEOPORT, JAMES, Kingston. Private, 7th co., Col. Gamaliel Bradford s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 18, 1777, to July 7, 
1777; reported killed; also, Capt. Joshua Eddy s co., Col. Bradford s regt.; 
subsistence allowed from date of engagement, Feb. 8, 1777, to date of march 
ing to Bennington, Feb. 22, 1777 ; credited with 25 days subsistence, including 
allowance for 11 days travel on march from Boston to Bennington ; also, same 
co. and regt.; return endorsed " January 28th 1778;" residence, Kingston; 
enlisted for town of Kingston ; mustered by Perez Simons, County Muster 
Master, and by a Continental Muster Master ; reported joined Feb. 30, 1777 ; 
died July 7, 1778. 

NEPO, PETER. Receipt dated West Springfield, March 3, 1781, for bounty paid 
said Nepo by Benjamin Leonard and others, on behalf of a class of the town 
of "West Springfield, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years; 
also, descriptive list of men raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the Conti 
nental Army as returned by Noah Goodman, Superintendent; age, 16 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 2 in.; complexion, black; hair, black; occupation, farmer; en 
gaged for town of West Springfield ; engaged Feb. 21, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

NEPTEY, PETER, Great Barrington. Return of men raised to serve in the Conti 
nental Army from Capt. William Duglass s (Hancock) co. [year not given] ; 
residence, Great Barrington ; engaged for town of Hancock ; joined Capt. 
Worren s (Warren s) co., Col. Baley s (Bailey s) regt. ; term, 3 years. 

NEPTON, JOHN. Pay roll of a number of Indians under Lieut. Andrew Gilman, 
sworn to at Boston ; service from July 15, 1779, to Aug. 21, 1779, on Penobscot 
expedition. 

NEPTON, PETER. List of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, 
by Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; term, 3 years or 
during war ; reported received State bounty; also, receipt dated June 13, 1777, 
for bounty paid Ensign Sturgin Sloan by Capt. William Douglas for enlisting 
said Nepton and others to serve in the Continental Army to the credit of the 
town of Hancock. 

NEPTUNE, , Boxford. Return dated Boxford, Feb. 13, 1778, made by a com 
mittee appointed to raise one-seventh part of the male inhabitants of the town 
of Boxford to serve in the Continental Army ; residence, Boxford ; engaged 
for town of Boxford; joined Capt. Jabez Lane s co., Col. Thomas Nixon s 
regt. ; term to expire Jan. 1, 1780. 

NERO, . Boy, ship " Mars," commanded by Capt. Simeon Samson; engaged 

June 2, 1780; reported as entitled to share in the brig " Tryall " if made 
a prize. 

NEROW, FESTUS. Descriptive list of men raised in Worcester Co. to serve in 
the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by 
Seth Washburn, Superintendent; Capt. Wateson s (Watson s) co., (late) Col. 
Deanny s (Denny s) regt.; age, 23 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 11 in.; complexion, 
black; occupation, farmer; engaged for town of Leicester; engaged April 9, 
1781 ; term, 3 years. 

NESANAUKHAH, DAVID. Private, Capt. Enoch Noble s co. ; enlisted Oct. 23, 1780; 
discharged Nov. 7, 1780; service, 16 days; company marched to Bennington. 
to guard frontiers on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Sheffield. 

NESBIT, JAMES. List of prisoners sent from port of Halifax by order of Sir George 
Collier June 28, 1777, to be exchanged for British prisoners, as returned by 
John Emerson, Commissary; said Nesbit, a Seaman, reported as having been 
taken in a trading vessel.

NESS, RICHARD, Boston. Descriptive list of men mustered to serve in the Conti

complexion, dark; hair, dark; occupation, farmer; residence, Boston; en 
listed for town of Boston ; deserted July 1, 1780, from Boston.

days.

wich, Sept. 17, Sept. 23, and Nov. 13, 1778.
