NEWBIT, CHRISTOPHER. Private, Capt. Philip M. Ulmer s co., Col. Samuel 
McCobb s regt. ; service from July 8, 1779, to Sept. 24, 1779, 2 mos. 16 days, on 
Penobscot expedition ; reported wounded July 27, 1779; also, certificate dated 
Waldoborough, July 24, 1780, signed by Maj. Philip M. Ulmer, certifying that 
said Newbit was a soldier in his company and lost his arm in battle at Major- 
bagaduce July 28, 1779, and that he behaved himself as a good soldier while 
under his command ; also, resolve dated Feb. 20, 1781, allowing said Newbit 
half pay from Sept. 28, 1779, the date of his discharge, he having been wounded 
at Majorbagaduce July 28 [1779], while in service in Capt. Philip M. Ulmer s 
co.

dated Castle Island, Sept. 17, 1779; also, Capt. Amos Lincoln s (2d) co., 
[Lieut.] Col. Paul Revere s corps of artillery; service from Jan. 1, 1780, to 
May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 8 days ; roll dated Boston. 

NEWCOMB, PETER, Braintree. Private, Capt. John Hall, Jr. s co. of North Parish 
in Braintree, Col. Benjamin Lincoln s regt., which assembled April 19, 1775, 
and also April 29, 1775; service, 7 days; also, Capt. Seth Turner s (Inde 
pendent) co. ; enlisted May 13, 1775 ; service, 8 mos., 1 week, 1 day ; also, same 
co. ; enlisted Jan. 1, 1776; service to May 22, 1776, 4 mos. 23 days; company

Marshall s regt. ; enlisted May 23, 1776 ; service to Jan. 1, 1777, 7 mos. 9 days ;

NEWCOMB, SAMUEL, Norton. Capt. James Perry s co., which marched on the

NEWCOMB, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Edmund Billings s co. of North Precinct in

June 13, 1776, to drive British ships from Boston harbor.

mos. 22 days ; company stationed at Truro for defence of seacoast.

Co. militia to serve for 6 days.

Col. Edmund Phiney, stating that he had commanded a regiment in the army 
at Cambridge during " the present Campaign " but had never been commis 
sioned, and asking that he, with the officers in his regiment, be recommended 
to Gen. Washington for commissions ; ordered in Council Oct. 6, 1775, that 
said officers be recommended for commissions in the Continental Army.

sioned May 3 [ ?], 1776; commissions reported dated June 1, 1776.

named.

NEWELL, EBENEZER, Cape Elizabeth. Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Dunn s co., Col.

with 78 days allowance ; also, 1st Lieutenant, same co. and regt. ; company 
return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. John Wentworth s co. 
of matrosses, Col. Peter Noyes s regt. ; company mustered by Col. Noyes May 
20, 1777, and stationed at Fort Hancock, Cape Elizabeth ; also, list of men 
who moved from the town of Cape Elizabeth subsequent to 1776, dated Cape 
Elizabeth, Jan. 17, 1782. 

NEWELL, EBENEZER, East Hoosuck. Return of men raised to serve in the Conti 
nental Army from Capt. Enos Parker s (East Hoosuck) co. ; residence, East 
Hoosuck ; engaged for town of East Hoosuck ; joined Capt. Cleaveland s co., 
Col. Jackson s regt.; term, during war; also, list of men mustered between

shire Co. ; Capt. Cleveland s co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; reported received State 
bounty ; also, Private, Capt. Ephraim Cleavland s co., Col. Michael Jackson s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Dec. 2, 1777, to Dec. 
2, 1778 ; reported deserted.

of officers dated Boston, April 18, 1777, submitted by Col. Crafts to the Coun 
cil for approval ; said officers approved in Council April 18, 1777.

Newhall, dated Cambridge, June 10, 1775, signed by said Newhall and others, 
for advance pay for 1 month; also, Private, Capt. Ezra Newhall s co., Col. 
John Mansfield s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; 
service, 1 mo. 26 days; also, Capt. Newhall s co., Col. Mansfield s (19th) regt. 
commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson ; company return dated Oct. 6, 
1775; reported enlisted into the train June 26, 1775; also, Matross, Capt. 
Edward Burbeck s co., Col. Richard Gridley s (Artillery) regt. ; company 
return dated Oct. 7, 1775. 

NEWHALL, JAMES, Lynn. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Jus 
tin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 11, 
1780; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, ruddy; engaged for town 
of Lynn ; arrived at Springfield July 10, 1780 ; marched to camp July 11, 1780, 
under command of Capt. George Webb; also, list of men raised for the 6 
months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months 
men raised by the town of Lynn for service in the Continental Army during 
1780 ; marched June 27, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 6, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 21 days, 
travel (220 miles) included.

nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 16, 1780; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft.; complexion, light;

days, including travel (160 miles) home.

NEWHALL, JOSIAH, Pepperell. Petition addressed to the Council, dated Pepperell, 
Sept. 31, 1779, signed by said Newhall and others, of Pepperell, stating that 
they marched to Rhode Island, joined the army under Gen. Sulivan in the 
expedition against Newport in Aug., 1778, and continued in service at Rhode 
Island for the term of 6 weeks under Capt. John Nutting, and asking that 
said Capt. Nutting be directed to make up a roll for their State pay which 
they had not received ; petition granted and resolve passed thereon Nov. 26, 
1779.

where [year not given].

NEWIEL, SAMUEL, Attleborough. Private, Capt. Enoch Robinson s co., Col. Isaac 
Dean s regt.; marched July 31, 1780; discharged Aug. 8, 1780 ; service, 8 days; 
2 days travel also allowed on march home from Tiverton to Attleborough ; 
company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on an alarm. 

NEWIL, ABIJAH, Monson. Private, Capt. Reuben Munn s (Monson) co., which 
marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cam 
bridge ; left Cambridge April 25, 1775 ; service, 8 days. 

NEWILL, BENJAMIN. Drummer, Capt. Nathaniel Heath s detachment, Col. Thomas 
Crafts s regt. ; service, 1^ mos. ; detachment drafted for service at and about 
Boston agreeable to resolve of Sept. 16, 1777; also, Capt. Nathaniel Heath s 
co., Col. Jonathan Reed s detachment of guards; muster roll dated Boston, 
May 14, 1778; enlistment, 3 months from April 2, 1778; also, same co. and 
detachment ; engaged April 14, 1778 ; discharged July 2, 1778 ; service, 2 mos. 
19 days ; detachment drafted to serve at Cambridge. 

NEWILL, JOHN. Captain ; regimental pay abstract, returned by Col. Jabez Hatch, 
for service of militia belonging to the town of Boston as guards under Maj. 
Gen. Gates ; service between Jan. 3, 1779, and Feb. 7, 1779, 3 days, at Boston. 

NEWILL, JOSEPH LEE. Private, Maj. Nathaniel Heath s co. ; enlisted June 1, 
1779 ; discharged July 31, 1779 ; service, 2 mos., with guards at and about Bos 
ton ; company raised for 3 months; also, same co. : enlisted May 1, 1780; ser 
vice, 3 mos.; also, same co. ; enlisted Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Oct. 6, 1780; 
service, 2 mos. 6 days ; above service from May .1, 1780, with guards at and 
about Boston under successive engagements of 3 months. 

NEWKIBK, AARON. Descriptive list dated Aug. 6, 1776 ; Capt. Moses Cantine s co., 
Col. Levi Pawling s (Ulster Co., N. Y.) regt., Gen. Clinton s brigade ; age, 33 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9^ in. ; complexion, fair; hair, brown ; eyes, brown ; occu 
pation, yeoman; birthplace, Hurly; enlisted Aug. 5, 1776; marched Aug. 10, 
1776 ; regiment reported as serving as part of Continental Army and stationed 
near King s Bridge. 

NEWLAND, . [This name also appears under the form of Knowland, Neulond, 

Nowland, Nuland.] 

NEWLAND, . General order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 19, 1776, 

taken from Col. Wheelock s Orderly Book; Lieut. Col. Balwin (Baldwin), 
1st Engineer, ordered to take the direction of the works on the side of Ticon 
deroga with said Newland, Captain, and others as his assistants.

enlisted into the army.

March in another regiment. 

NEWLAND, JABEZ. Private, Capt. Isaac Hodges s co., Col. John Hathaway s regt. ;

at Rhode Island ; roll sworn to at Taunton ; also, same co. and regt. ; company 
return dated Little Compton, April 10, 1779; statement affixed made by Israel 
Fisher, of Warwick, one of said company, states that service was for 5 or 6 
months at Rhode Island. 

NEWLAND, JABEZ. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental 
Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned 
as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at 
Springfield, July 16, 1780; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light; 
engaged for town of Norton ; marched to camp July 16, 1780, under command 
of Lieut. Zebulon King; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town 
of Norton for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched July 15, 
1780; discharged Dec. 17, 1780; service, 5 mos. 13 days, including travel (200 
miles) from camp home. 

NEWLAND, JABEZ. Receipt dated Mansfield, May 1, 1781, for bounty paid said 
Newland by Capt. John Pratt, on behalf of a class of the town of Mansfield, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years, agreeable to resolve 
of Dec. 2, 1780.

NEWLAND, WILLIAM. Company receipts, given to Capt. Oliver Soper, for wages 
for May- Aug., 1776. 

NEWLAND, WILLIAM. Statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said New- 
land and others belonging to Col. Crafts s regt., declaring their refusal to leave 
Boston, unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made equivalent to those 
allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery; also, petition 
addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed 
by said Newland and others, requesting that the objectionable part of their 
former petition, which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, and asking 
that the sergeants of the regiment confined on account of the petition be 
released ; also, Matross, Capt. William Todd s (6th) co., Col. Thomas Crafts s 
(Artillery) regt.; pay roll for Aug. and Sept., 1777; also, return of men 
belonging to the State regt. of artillery entitled to an additional bounty of 15, 
as returned by Col. T. Crafts, dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778; Capt. Tood s (6th) 
co. ; also, Capt. John Gill s co., Col. Crafts s regt. ; list of men who received 
bounty from April 30, 1777, to Dec. 30, 1777, 8 mos. ; also, Gunner, Capt. Perez 
Cushing s (1st) co., Col. Paul Revere s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts

regiment.

detachment of Hampshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated Garrison at Ticon- 
deroga, Feb. 24, 1777; also, same co. and detachment; entered service Dec. 
23, 1776 ; discharged April 1, 1777 ; service, 100 days, at Ticonderoga. 

NEWMAN, JOHN. Capt. Lawrance Kemp s co. ; enlisted May 10,1777; discharged 
July 17, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 9 days ; company detached from Hampshire Co. 
militia for service under Col. David Wells in Northern department. Roll 
dated Shelburne. 

NEWMAN, JOHN. Private, Capt. Hugh McClallen s co., Col. David Field s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 19, 1777 ; service, 6 days, including 3 
days (60 miles) travel home ; company marched from Colrain to Bennington 
on the alarm of Aug. 17, 1777.

travel (180 miles) home.

NEWMAN, JOHN. Descriptive list dated Deerfield, July 24, 1780, of men detached

who were not included in above arrangement ; reported resigned.

Independent co. to be raised in Boston ; officers of said Boston Independent 
co. commissioned in Council Dec. 7, 1776, Maj. Gen. John Hancock to serve 
as Colonel, Henry Jackson to serve as Lieutenant Colonel ; also, Private, Gen. 
John Hancock s (Boston Independent) co. commanded by Lieut. Col. Henry 
Jackson ; arrived at camp April 17, 1777 ; discharged May 5, 1777 ; service, 
21 days; company marched from Boston to Rhode Island. 

NEWMAN, WILLIAM. Mate, ship "Versailles," John Chapman, Master; engaged 
Jan. 15, 1777; discharged June 25, 1777; service, 5 mos. 10 days, on voyage 
from Boston to Nantes and return. 

NEWMAN, WILLIAM. List of prisoners brought to Marblehead in the cartel 
" Pacific," to be exchanged for British prisoners, as returned by Thomas 
Stone, Commissary [year not given]. 

NEWMAN, WINGATE. Petition signed by Philip Moore and Archibald Mercer, of 
Boston, owners of the brigantine "Hancock " (privateer) , asking that Daniel 
McNeil be commissioned as commander of said vessel ; vessel reported as 
having been nearly 12 months in commission under command of said Newman, 
Captain, but he had resigned and sent his commission to the Continental 
Congress ; ordered in Council Nov. 30, 1776, that a commission be issued ; also, 
petition dated Boston, July 14, 1781, signed by Tristram Coffin, in behalf of 
Josaph Marquand and others, of Newbury, asking that said Newman be com 
missioned as commander of the ship " Lyon " (privateer) ; advised in Council 
July 14, 1781, that a commission be issued. 

NEWMARSH, GEORGE, Marblehead. Capt. Daniel Pillsbury s co., Col. Edward 
Wigglesworth s regt.; return [year not given]; residence, Marblehead; en 
listed for town of Marblehead; mustered by County Muster Master; also, 
descriptive list of deserters from 13th Mass. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. 
Calvin Smith, endorsed " July 13th 1780 ; " Capt. Pillsbury s co. ; age, 23 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark ; deserted April -, 1777.

NEWPORT, DANIEL, Sandwich. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental

including travel (150 miles) home.

NEWTON, DAVID. Private, Capt. Thomas Whipple s co. of guards; enlisted April 
20, 1780; discharged Dec. 20, 1780; service, 8 mos. 1 day; company raised 
for 8 months and stationed at Rutland; also, Capt. Timothy Ruggles s co. of 
guards; enlisted Jan. 24, 1781; discharged Dec. 26, 1781; service, 10 mos. 28 
days, at Rutland. 

NEWTON, EBENEZER, Southborough. Private, Capt. Elijah Bellows s co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 17 days; also, Capt. Silas 
Gates s co. ; pay abstract for service in Dec. [1775] and Jan., 1776; enlisted 
Dec. 4 [1775] ; company raised in Marlborough, Southborough, and North- 
borough ; also, Capt. Silas Gates s co., Col. Ward s regt. ; return for mileage 
to and from camp, dated Dorchester, Jan. 13, 1776 ; mileage for 60 miles allowed 
said Newton ; also, Capt. Seth Newton s co., Col. Whitney s regt.; enlisted 
Aug. 21, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 26 (also given Aug. 27) , 1777 ; service, 6 days, 
on an alarm at Bennington ; company proceeded from Southborough to Had 
ley on horses, by order of the Brigadier, and horse hire and mileage (80 miles) 
allowed home. 

NEWTON, EDMUND, Southborough. Private, Capt. Josiah Fay s co. of Minute-men 
and militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 16 days. 

NEWTON, EDWARD, Lancaster (probably). Ensign, Capt. Daniel Robbins s co. of 
militia, Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 
1775, to Cambridge; returned May 1,1775; service, 14 days; company made 
up from 2d and 13th cos. in said regiment ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Fortu- 
natus Eager s (7th) co., Col. Josiah Whitney s (2d Worcester Co.) regt. of 
Mass, militia; list of officers to be commissioned, as returned by Lieut. Col. 
Ephraim Sawyer and Maj. Silas Bailey, dated Lancaster, March 18, 1776; 
ordered in Council March 20, 1776, that said officers be commissioned with the 
exception of those of the 6th and 12th cos. ; reported commissioned March 20, 
1776; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Solomon Stuart s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt. ; marched Aug. 21, 1777 ; returned Aug. 25, 1777 ; service, 5 days ; com 
pany marched on an alarm at Bennington; also, Capt. William Greenleaf s 
co., Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; engaged Sept. 1, 1777; service, 2 mos. 29 days, 
with Northern army; reported furloughed Oct. 26, 1777; also, same co. ; pay 
abstracts dated Scaresdeal, Nov. 30, 1777, and sworn to in Worcester Co.

NEWTON, ELIJAH, Hubbardston. Private, Capt. Jonathan Sibley sco., Col. Luke 
Drury s regt. ; entered service Aug. 9, 1781 ; marched Aug. 13, 1781 ; arrived 
at camp Aug. 22, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 3, 1781 ; service, 2 mos. 5 days, 
including 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; residence, Hubbardston ; engaged 
for town of Hubbardston ; regiment raised for 3 months. 

NEWTON, ELIJAH, Spencer. Capt. Jonathan Carriel s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt.; company receipt for advance pay, etc., dated Point Shirley, June 13, 
1776; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; service from May 26, 1776, 4 days pre 
ceding march, to Aug. 1, 1776, 2 mos. 6 days ; also, same co. and regt. ; service

also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 1776 ; service, 1 mo. 4 days, includ 
ing travel (85 miles) home. 

NEWTON, ELIJAH. Private, Capt. William Marean s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s

Marean s co., Col. Stairns s (Stearns s) regt. of guards; service from March 
27, 1778, to July 2, 1778, 3 mos. 6 days, at Cambridge guarding troops of con 
vention. 

NEWTON, ELIJAH. Sergeant, Capt. Adam Henry s co. of guards ; engaged Jan. 7, 
177!); discharged April 6 (also given April 1), 1779; service, 3 mos. (also 
given 2 mos. 25 days) ; company detached from militia to guard troops of 
convention at Rutland for 3 months from Jan. 1, 1779. 

NEWTON, ELIPHAZ. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Goodale s co., in a regiment com 
manded by Lieut. Col. Samuel Williams ; enlisted July 11, 1777 ; discharged 
Aug. 12, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 9 days, including travel home ; company marched 
to join Northern army and was discharged 110 miles from home. 

NEWTON, EPHRAIM, Framingham. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex 
Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Super 
intendent for said county ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; 
hair, red ; eyes, light; occupation, farmer ; engaged for town of Framingham ; 
engaged Feb. 12, 1781 ; term, 3 years ; also, Private, Capt. Benjamin Hey wood s 
co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt.; muster roll for May, 1781, dated 
West Point ; reported on command at Clarkstown ; also, muster rolls for June 
and July, 1781 ; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, sworn to at Camp Peekskill ; 
also, muster roll for Sept., 1781, sworn to at Camp Bald Hill; also, muster 
roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, sworn to at Quarters Highlands ; reported on com 
mand with Col. Scammell from June, 1781 ; also, descriptive list dated Jan. 
1, 1782; Capt. Benjamin Heywood sco., 6th Mass. regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, light; hair, light; occupation , yeoman ; birthplace,

1781 ; term, 3 years ; also, muster rolls for Dec., 1781-March, 1782, dated Hutts 
New Boston; reported on command at the Southward Dec., 1781-Feb., 1782;

muster rolls for April-Oct., 1782; also, Capt. Heywood s (5th) co., 6th Mass,

Col. Benjamin Tupper s (6th) regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1782, Jan., March, 
and April, 1783 ; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 8 months 15 days.

pation, farmer; engaged for town of Marlborough; engaged March 21, 1781;

NEWTON, FRANCIS, Boston. Descriptive list of men mustered for Continental ser 
vice subsequent to Sept. 16 [year not given], by James Leonard, Muster Master 
for Bristol Co. ; Capt. Jonathan Drown s co., Col. Lea s (Lee s) regt. ; age, 
21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; engaged for town of Rehoboth ; also, return certi 
fied at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 1780, of officers and men belonging to 
Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and men belonging to 
Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., who were incorporated into 
a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the 
arrangement of April 9, 1779 ; rank, Private ; residence, Boston ; engaged Nov. 
12, 1777 ; said Newton appears among men belonging to Col. William R. Lee s 
regt. who had been discharged from the rolls prior to above arrangement ; re 
ported deserted April 3, 1778.

Capt. Hastings s co., Col. Rice s regt. ; engaged for town of Hardwick ; mus

wick, May 2, 1781, signed by said Newton, for 9 hard money, or its equiva 
lent, paid him by the town of Hardwick for serving in the Continental Army 
for 3 months " the year past;" the time served to be so reckoned by the 
town in making an average as to be equivalent to 9 more. 

NEWTON, HANANIAH, Chelmsford. Private, Capt. Joseph Fox s co.,Col. Henry 
Jackson s (16th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from July 
10, 1777, to July 10, 1780 ; residence, Chelmsford ; credited to town of Chelms 
ford ; also, Col. David Henley s regt. ; return of recruits for knapsacks, dated 
Boston, Feb. 16, 1778; reported under marching orders; also, Capt. Joseph 
Fox s co., Col. Henley s regt. ; pay roll for Nov., 1778; also, Capt. Fox s (7th) 
co., Col. Jackson s regt. ; muster roll for April, 1779, dated Pawtuxet; enlisted

also, Capt. Joseph Fox s (3d) co.,Col. Jackson s regt. ; muster roll for Oct., 
1779, dated Camp Providence; reported on command at Newport; also, same 
co. and regt.; regimental return made up to Dec. 31, 1779, dated Camp at 
Providence; also, return certified at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 1780, 
of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s 
regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., 
who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry 
Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9,1779; Capt. Fox s co; rank, 
Drummer ; residence, Chelmsford ; engaged for town of Chelmsford ; engaged 
July 10, 1777; term, 3 years; reported reduced to Private July 6, 1778; also, 
Capt. Joseph Fox s (3d) co., Col. Henry Jackson s regt. ; pay rolls for April- 
July, 1780 ; reported discharged July 10, 1780.

co. ; enlisted June 20, 1778 ; discharged July 13, 1778 ; service, 26 days ; com 
pany joined Col. Wade s regt. June 22, 1778, for 21 days service at Rhode 
Island; roll dated Grafton.

co., (late) Col. Wigglesworth s regt. commanded by Maj. John Porter ; muster 
roll for March and April, 1779.

NEWTON, JAMES, Framingham. Petition addressed to Col. Samuel Bullard, dated 
Framingham, June 1, 1776, signed by said Newton and others belonging to 
Capt. Jesse Emes s co., Col. Bullard s (5th Middlesex Co.) regt., asking that 
the company be divided into two companies ; also, Private, Capt. Aaron Gard 
ner s co., Col. Brooks s regt.; company return endorsed "1776;" said New 
ton reported as having lost articles in battle and as sick in camp.

also, descriptive list of men raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fish- 
kill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778; Capt. Kellogg s co., Col. Mosley s 
regt.; age, 34 yrs.; stature, 5ft. 10 in.; complexion, light; hair, brown; 
engaged for town of Westfield; arrived at Fishkill June 16, 1778; also, list 
of men returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. 
R. Putnam, July 20, 1778.

regt. of Minute-men, which marched in response to the alarm of April 19, 
1775; entered service April 22, 1775; service, 1 mo. ; reported returned home.

also, same co. and regt.; entered service Oct. 27, 1780; discharged Oct. 28, 
1780 ; service, 2 days, at the Northward by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm. 

NEWTON, JASON. Sergeant, Capt. Samuel Clark s co., in a detachment from Col. 
Barnabas Sears s regt. ; engaged July 18, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 2, 1781 ; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 21 days, "up the Mohawk River," including 5 days (100 miles) 
travel home ; regiment raised for 3 months. Roll sworn to in Berkshire Co. 

NEWTON, JEDUTHAN, Southborough. Private, Capt. Josiah Fay s co. of Minute- 
men and militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 17 
days ; reported returned home ; also, Capt. Silas Gates s co. ; pay abstract for 
service in Dec. [1775] and Jan., 1776 ; enlisted Dec. 4 [1775] ; company raised 
in Marlborough, Southborough, and Northborough ; also, Capt. Silas Gates s 
co., Col. Ward s regt. ; return for mileage to and from camp, dated Dorchester, 
Jan. 13, 1776 ; mileage for 60 miles allowed said Newton ; also, Capt. Manasseh

roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777; enlisted Dec. 1, 1776; regiment raised to serve

Col. Williams s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service,

July 10, 1777; discharged Aug. 12, 1777; service, 1 mo. 8 days, in Northern

Chapen s (3d) regt. ; enlisted Oct. 27, 1779; discharged Nov. 22, 1779; service, 
1 mo. 2 days, at Claverack, including 6 days (120 miles) travel home.

enlisted Aug. 20, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 18 days, in

dated Dorchester Camp, Feb. 15, 1776.

Dec. 20, 1776; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777. 

NEWTON, JOHN. Corporal, Capt. Timothy Childs s co., Col. David Leonard s regt. ;

given at the Westward) ; company marched from Grafton ; also, receipt dated

Capt. Brigham s co., for wages for 3 mos. service. 

NEWTON, PAUL. Capt. Reuben Dickinson s co., Col. Portor s regt.; return for 
equipments, dated Nov. 9, 1778 ; also, list of men appearing on a credit bill of 
Capt. Reuben Dickinson s co. [year not given] ; said Newton credited with 4 
mos. 3 weeks service. 

NEWTON, PETER, Rutland. Private, Capt. David Bent s (Rutland) co. of militia, 
Col. Nathaniel Sparhawk s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response 
to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 6 days.

NEWTON, PHINEAS, Spencer. Private, Capt. Joel Green s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Learnard s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 12, 1775; ser 
vice, 2 mos. 25 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Capt. 
Jonathan Carriel s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; company receipt for 
advance pay, etc., dated Point Shirley, June 13, 1776; also, Private, same co. 
and regt. ; service from May 26, 1776, 4 days preceding march, to Nov. 1, 1776,

of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Col. Denny s regt., as 
returned by Capt. David Prouty; residence, Spencer; engaged for town of 
Spencer; joined Capt. Martin s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; term, 3 years; also, 
Private, Capt. Adam Martin s co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from March 18, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, 
muster roll for Jan.-Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island and sworn to at 
Camp near Half Moon ; enlisted March 18, 1777 ; also, muster roll sworn to at 
Camp near the "Gulph," Dec. 18, 1777; reported on furlough; also, Col. 
Bigelow s regt. ; return of men enlisted by Capt. Adam Martin, dated Feb. 3, 
1778; mustered by Worcester Co. Muster Master; also, Capt. Martin s co., 
Col. Bigelow s regt.; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Provi 
dence ; also, Major s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 18, 1780. 

NEWTON, PHINEAS. Private, Capt. John Morgan s co. ; enlisted Jan. 3, 1778; dis 
charged July 1, 1778 ; service, 5 mos. 28 days ; company detached from militia 
of Hampshire and Worcester counties to guard stores and magazines at Brook- 
field and Springfield. 

NEWTON, PHINEAS. Marine; agreement signed by said Newton and others, en 
gaging themselves to serve on board the sloop " Winthrop," commanded by 
Capt. George Little, for the term of 6 months from time of sailing from Boston, 
unless sooner discharged [year not given]. 

NEWTON, PRIMUS. Receipt dated Springfield, June -, 1782, for bounty paid said 
Newton by Maj. Bemont, Chairman of Class No. 1 of the town of Shrewsbury, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 

NEWTON, REUBEN, Southborough. Private, Capt. Elijah Bellows s co., which

Newton s co., Col. Whitney s regt. ; engaged Aug. 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 
26 (also given Aug. 27) , 1777 ; service, 6 days, on an alarm at Bennington ;

Brigadier, and horse hire and mileage (80 miles) allowed home.

NEWTON, SOLOMON, Framingham. Petition addressed to Col. Samuel Bullard, 
dated Framingham, June 1, 1776, signed by said Newton and others belonging 
to Capt. Jesse Emes s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s (5th Middlesex Co.) regt., 
asking that the company be divided into two companies; also, list of men 
belonging to Capt. John Gleason s co., endorsed "North Kingston June 26th 
1777 ; " deposition made by Micah Balcoin July 26, 1844, states that he 
engaged the first part of May, 1777, in Capt. Gleason s co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s regt., and rendered 2 mos. 8 days service at Rhode Island ; said company 
was made up of men from Marlborough, Stow, Sudbury, Framingham, Natick, 
Sherburne, Holliston, and Hopkinton ; also, descriptive list of men raised in 
Middlesex Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph 
Hosmer, Superintendent for said county; age, 30 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 10 in.; 
complexion, light; hair, brown ; eyes, blue ; occupation, farmer ; engaged for 
town of Framingham; engaged Feb. 12,1781; term, 3 years; also, Private, 
Capt. Benjamin Pike s co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt. ; return for 
wages for the year 1781; wages allowed said Newton from Feb. 12, 1781, to 
Sept. 13, 1781, 7 mos. 2 days; reported died Sept. 13, 1781 ; also, order on Capt. 
Hayward, Paymaster, 6th Mass, regt., for wages for Continental service, pay 
able to Ephraim Newton, dated Framingham, May 24, 1784, signed by Hannah 
Newton, widow of said Solomon Newton, and Selectmen of Framingham.

May, 1779, dated Highlands ; enlisted March 1, 1777 ; also, same co. and regt. ;

Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to April 1, 1780 ; 
also, (late) Capt. John Holden s co., Col. Nixon s regt. ; pay roll for Jan.- 
June, 1780; reported discharged April 1, 1780; also, order on Capt. Benjamin 
Hayward, dated Westminster, Sept. 28, 1785, signed by said Newton, for 
clothing due him to be delivered to Dr. Bartlett. 

NEWTONE, ASAHEL. Capt. Josiah Fay s co., Col. Ward s regt. ; order for advance 
pay, signed by said Newtone and others, dated June 13, 1775. 

NEWTOWN, GIDEON. Private, Capt. Timothy Paige s co., Col. John Rand s regt. ; 
entered service July 5, 1780; discharged Oct. 10,1780; service, 3 mos. 15 days, 
at West Point, including 9 days (180 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for 
3 months. 

NEY, JABEZ, Ware. Private, Capt. C. Woodbridge s co., Col. Calvin Smith s (late 
Col. Wigglesworth s) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 1, 1777, to May 16, 1778; reported died May 16, 1778; also, Capt. Israel 
Davis s co., Col. Edward Wigglesworth s regt. ; return [year not given] ; resi 
dence, Ware ; engaged for town of Ware ; mustered by Capt. Newell ; also, 
(late) Capt. Davis s co., Col. Wigglesworth s regt. ; muster roll for May, 1778, 
dated Camp at Valley Forge. 

NEY, JAMES. Receipt given to Capt. Amos Green, dated Charlestown, March 21, 
1777, signed by said Ney and others, for wages, etc., for service in 2d division 
of militia ; discharged March 6, 1777. 

NEY, JONATHAN, Middleborough. Private, Capt. Joshua Benson s co., Col. 
Theophilus Cotton s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 7, 
1775; service, 3 mos. 2 days; also, Lieut. William Tomson s (probably Capt. 
Joshua Benson s) co., Col. Cotton s regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equiva 
lent in money dated Roxbury, Nov. 14, 1775.

NET, JOSEPH, continued. 

May, 1778, dated Camp at Valley Forge; also, same co. and regt. ; muster

command at Newtown. 

NEY, JOSEPH. Private, Maj. Peter Harwood s co., Col. Thomas Nixon s (6th) 
regt. ; pay rolls for Nov. and Dec., 1779; also, Major s co., Col. Nixon s regt. ; 
return for clothing for the year 1780 ; receipt for said clothing, dated Peeks- 
kill, Dec. 5, 1779. 

NEY, LEVI. Private, Capt. Amos Porter s co., Col. David Roseter s (Rossiter s) 
regt. ; entered service Oct. 14, 1780; discharged Oct. 17, 1780; service, 3 days, 
on the alarm at Berkshire of Oct. 14, 1780 ; also, same co. and regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 18, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 21, 1780 ; service, 4 days, on the alarm 
at Berkshire of Oct. 18, 1780. 

NEY, NATHAN. Private, Lieut. Col. Cobb s co., Col. Henry Jackson s (16th) regt. ; 
pay roll for June and July, 1780; reported sick and absent ; also, pay roll for 
6 months men raised by the town of Middleborough for service in the Conti 
nental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp July 11, 1780; discharged Dec. 
11, 1780; service, 5 mos. 12 days, including travel (240 miles) from place of 
discharge home. 

NEY THOMAS. Private, Capt. Micah Hamlen s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s (1st) 
regt. of guards ; marched April 7, 1778 ; service to July 6, 1778, 2 mos. 28 days, 
at Cambridge, including 4 days (80 miles) travel home ; roll sworn to in Barn- 
stable Co. ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Cambridge, June 1, 
1778 ; enlisted May 7, 1778 ; enlistment, 3 months from April 2, 1778. 

NEY, TIMOTHY. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Joseph Smith s co. ; entered service July 1, 
1775; discharged Dec. 31, 1775; service, 6 mos. 16 days, in defence of seacoast. 

NIAS, ISAAC, Harwich. List of men mustered by Joseph Otis, Muster Master for 
Barnstable Co. ; Capt. Webb s co., Col. Sheppard s regt. ; engaged for town 
of Harwich; mustered March 28, 1777; term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. 
George Webb s co., Col. William Sheppard s (3d) regt.; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from May 29, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Har 
wich ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Oct., 1778, March, and April, 1779, 
dated Providence; enlisted May 29 (also given May 27), 1777; enlistment, 
during war ; reported on command at the Western shore in March and April, 
1779; also, Capt. Holbrook s co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, Capt. Webb s 
co., Col. William Shepard s (4th) regt. ; return for gratuities, dated High 
lands, Feb. 24, 1780; also, Capt. David Holbrook s co., Col. Shepard s regt.; 
return made up for the year 1780; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for 
May, 1781, dated West Point ; also, muster rolls for June-Sept., 1781 ; reported 
with Light Infantry from May, 1781; also, muster rolls for Oct., 1781-Jan. 
1782, dated York Hutts; reported sick at the Southward in Oct. and Nov., 
1781, sick but present in Dec., 1781, died Jan. 27, 1782. 

NIBERT, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Caleb Champney s co. ; enlisted Feb. 3, 1779 ; 
discharged May 2, 1779; service, 3 mos., with guards at and about Boston, 
under Maj. Gen. Gates.

able to order of Council of Nov. 7, 1777 ; residence, Marblehead ; engaged for 
town of Marblehead ; term, 3 years.

NICHOLS, JAMES, Newbury. 2d Lieutenant, schooner "Lee" (privateer) ; petition 
dated Boston, Nov. 27, 1776, signed by Nathaniel Odiorne, of Portsmouth, 
N. H., in behalf of himself, and others of Newbury, asking that he be 
commissioned as commander of said vessel ; ordered in Council Nov. 27, 

1776, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Dec. 13, 

1777, signed by Robert Hill, a British prisoner, stating that said Nichols, 
Captain, of Newbury, was held a prisoner at Rhode Island ; that his family 
was in distress and dependent upon him ; and as a means of securing his re 
lease, asking to be permitted to proceed to Rhode Island to effect his exchange ; 
ordered in Council Dec. 12, 1777, that the petitioner be permitted to proceed 
to Rhode Island for the purpose mentioned, giving his parole to secure the 
exchange of said Nichols or another officer of equal rank or to return within 
one month ; also, list dated Feb. 24, 1778, of prisoners to be exchanged for 
British prisoners under parole to be returned by Col. Johonnott ; said Nichols, 
Captain, to be exchanged for Robert Hill. 

NICHOLS, JAMES, Penobscot. Corporal, Capt. John Lane s co. ; enlisted July 14, 
1775; service to Nov. 1, 1775, 3 mos. 25 days; company probably stationed at 
Cape Ann for defence of seacoast. 

NICHOLS, JAMES, Yarmouth. List of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. [See James Nickerson.] 

NICHOLS, JAMES. Seaman, brigantine "Hawke," commanded by Capt. Jonathan 
Oakes; engaged May 3, 1777; service, 1 mo., with the fleet under Commodore 
John Manley. Roll sworn to in Middlesex Co. 

NICHOLS, JAMES. Private, Capt. Ephraim Hathaway s co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s 
regt. ; service from July 20, 1777, to Aug. 24, 1777, 1 mo. 5 days, at Rhode 
Island. Roll sworn to at Dighton. 

NICHOLS, JAMES. Capt. Miles Greenwood s co.. Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of guards ; 
enlisted Nov. 11, 1777 ; service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 23 days. Rolls dated 
Camp at Winter Hill. 

NICHOLS, JAMES. Certificate dated Roxbury, Feb. 13, 1776, signed by Col. John 
Bailey, certifying that Capt. James Briggs, said Nichols, Lieutenant, and 
Ensign Philip Hartheway served as officers commanding a company in his 
regiment from Dec. 10, 1775, to Feb. 1, 1776 ; ordered in Council Feb. 13, 1776, 
that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned Feb. 13, 1776 ; also, 
Captain, Col. John Daggett s regt. ; pay abstract for wages and mileage due 
officers and soldiers belonging to said regiment stationed at Rhode Island for 
3 months from Jan. 1, 1778, approved at Providence and also at Tiverton July 
8, 1778, by Brig. Gen. Esek Cornell who states that service was performed in 
his brigade. 

NICHOLS, JAMES. Treasury pay roll of officers and crew of the brigantine " Pallas," 
commanded by Capt. James Johnson, for service from July 3, 1779, to Aiig. 
20, 1779, on Penobscot expedition.

pany marched to Rhode Island on an alarm.

service, 3 days, in Aug., 1777, at Hull.

men, Col. Danielson s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, 
to Cambridge; left Cambridge May 4,1775; service, 19 days; also, Capt. 
Isaac Colton s co., Col. David Brewer s (9th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775; enlisted July 27, 1775; service, 4 days; also, Capt. Colton s co., Col. 
Rufus Putnam s (late Brewer s) regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent 
in money dated Roxbury Camp, Nov. 10, 1775. 

NICHOLS, MICAH (also given MICHAL) , Leominster. Private, Lieut. Obadiah Beal s 
detachment of guards; enlisted Dec. 12, 1775; service to April 3, 1776, 3 mos. 
24 days ; detachment stationed at Hull ; roll sworn to at Hingham ; also, 
order on Paymaster General, payable to Joseph Shurtleff, Quarter Master, 
endorsed "Hull July 15, 1776," signed by said Nichols and others belonging 
to Capt. Andrew HaskelFs co., Col. T. Marshall s regt., for advance pay for 
1 month, travel allowance, etc.; also, Private, Capt. Andrew Haskell s co., 
Col. Thomas Marshall s regt. ; service from Aug. 1, 1776, to Dec. 1, 1776, 
4 mos. 2i days; also, Capt. Job Cushing s co., Col. Solomon Lovell s regt.; 
enlisted Dec. 18, 1776; discharged March 17, 1777; service, 3 mos. 15 days, 
including travel (15 days) home ; also, petition dated April 10, 1777, signed 
by said Nichols and others belonging to Capt. Job Cushing s co., asking for 
unpaid portion of allowance for travel to Danbury, Conn., subsequent to 
engagement in Dec., 1776; enlistment, 3 months; company marched to 
Hingham and Cohasset ; also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from 8th Worcester Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Nathaniel Carter; 
residence, Leominster ; engaged for town of Leominster ; joined Capt. Wil 
liam Warner s co., Col. Marshal s regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, 3d co., 
Col. Thomas Marshall s (10th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from March 11, 1777, to July 12, 1778; reported died July 12, 1778; also, 
Capt. William Warner s (6th) co., Col. Marshall s regt. ; return of men who 
were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, etc. 

NICHOLS, MOSES. Private, Capt. Jacob Haskins s co., Col. Isaac Dean s regt.; 
enlisted March 6, 1781 ; discharged March 14, 1781 ; service, 10 days, at Rhode 
Island ; company raised to serve for 40 days, unless sooner discharged. 

NICHOLS, N. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Roxbury for service

been mustered in place of said Nichols. 

NICHOLS, NAAMAN. Private, Capt. Silas Wild s co., Col. Brooks s regt. of guards;

tinental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as attested by James Wil

received of James Williams, Superintendent for Bristol Co., by Joshua Wil- 
bore, at Taunton, March 21, 1781, to be conducted to Springfield and delivered

(also given 5 ft. 5) in.; complexion, dark (also given black) ; eyes, black;

charged subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; said Nichols discharged June 8, 1783, by 
Gen. Washington, term of enlistment having expired.

co., Col. Wood s regt., in 1778.

residence, Salem. 

NICHOLS, SIMEON (also given SIMON), East Hoosuck (also given Adams). Return

detachment from Capt. Andrew Lusk s co., Col. Asa Barns s regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 14, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 5, 1781; service, 22 days; detachment 
marched to join army at Saratoga by order of Gen. Fellows on the alarm at 
the Northward of Oct. 14, 1781.

NICHOLS, THOMAS. Captain, serving as volunteer, Col. Joab Stafford s co. of 
volunteers ; marched July 16, 1777 ; returned July 30, 1777 ; service, 15 days ; 
company marched from New Providence by order of Maj. Gen. Schuyler to 
reinforce troops under Col. Warner at Manchester; also, same co. ; marched 
Aug. 14, 1777 ; service, 6 days ; company raised from the alarm lists of New 
Providence, Lanesborough , East Hoosuck, and Gageborough, and fought in 
battle near Bennington Aug. 16, 1777. 

NICHOLS, THOMAS. List endorsed " June 22, 1777," of men employed at the Labo 
ratory making small arms and cartridges after Col. Crafts s regt. was dis 
banded, as certified by Thomas Crafts, Colonel of the Artillery; said Nichols 
employed 1 mo.; also, statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said 
Nichols and others belonging to Col. Crafts s regt., declaring their refusal to 
leave Boston unless their wages or bounty, or both, were made equivalent to 
those allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery. 

NICHOLS, THOMAS. Capt. Nathaniel Lakin s co., Col. John Robinson s regt. ; 
engaged July 7, 1777; service, 2 mos. 17 days, at Rhode Island; reported

as unfit for duty; 2d Mass, regt.; age, 38 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; engaged 
for town of Boston ; term, 3 years ; reported as having had a very bad sore 
leg since 1775.

as commander of the ship " Monmouth " (privateer) ; ordered in Council Nov. 
5, 1778, that a commission be issued.

Mass. regt. Dec. 17, 1782; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 12 months 
8 days.

NICHOLS, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. John Noyes s co., Col. Samuel John son s regt. ; 
entered service Aug. 24, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 18 
days, with Northern army, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home. 

NICHOLS, WILLIAM. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Nov. 23, 1776; said Nichols, Captain, chosen Naval Officer for the port 
of Gouldsborough ; appointment concurred in by Council Dec. 2, 1776 ; also, 
official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated Jan. 24, 1778 ; 
said Nichols chosen Naval Officer for the port of Gouldsborough ; appointment 
concurred in by Council Jan. 27, 1778; also, official record of a ballot by the 
House of Representatives, dated Feb. 4, 1779 ; said Nichols chosen Naval 
Officer for the port of Gouldsborough ; appointment concurred in by Council

Capt. Joseph Hoar, Jr. s co., Col. Gideon Burt s regt. ; entered service June 
16, 1782; service, 6 days; mileage to and from Northampton (90 miles) 
allowed said Nichols ; company marched to Springfield and Northampton for 
defence of the government and was allowed horse rations.

Cathcart; engaged July 25, 1782; discharged Nov. 21, 1782; service, 3 mos. 27

NICKERSON, YATES. Seaman, brigan tine "Independence," commanded by Capt. 
Simeon Samson ; engaged May 8, 1776 ; service to Sept. 22, 1776, 4 mos. 14 
days; roll dated Plymouth ; also, same vessel and commander; payroll made 
up for men under Lieut. Daniel Adams, who brought the prize brigantine 
" Nancy " into Plymouth, by order of Capt. Samson ; when last paid, Sept. 22, 
1776; discharged Jan. 20, 1777; also, order on the Board of War, dated East- 
ham, Dec. 15, 1777, signed by said Nickerson and others, for the delivery to 
Aaron Higgins of guns allowed by resolve of the General Court to members 
of the crew who were taken with Capt. Samson, of Plymouth, in place of those 
lost by them.

near Morristown, April 30, 1780, of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, 
Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts 
in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., who were incorporated into a regiment under 
the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 
9, 1779; Lieut. Colonel s co. ; rank, Sergeant; residence, Rehoboth; engaged 
Jan. 25, 1778; term, during war. 

NICKOLS, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Timothy Childs s (Greenfield) co., Col. 
David Field s regt. ; service, 4 days, on the alarm at Bennington of Aug. 14, 
1777. 

NICKOLS, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Ichabod Wade s (Light Infantry) co., Col. 
George Williams s regt.; service, 21 days; company stationed at Tiverton 
Oct. 7, 1777. Roll sworn to at Rehoboth. 

NICKOLS, NOAH, Scituate. Private, Capt. William Turner s (3d Scituate) co. of 
militia, Col. Anthony Thomas s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775 ; service, 4 days. 

NICKOLS, RICHARD, Hancock. List of men raised in Berkshire Co. to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 
1778, as returned by Truman Wheler, Muster Master, dated Great Barrington, 
June 5, 1778. 

NICKOLS, ROBERT. Private, Capt. David Batcheller s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ; 
arrived at camp June 5, 1778 ; discharged Jan. 29, 1779 ; service, 8 mos. 15 
days, at North river, including 3 days to prepare for camp and 18 days (360 
miles) travel out and home ; regiment raised for 8 months. 

NICKOLS, THOMAS, Marblehead. List of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Col. Jonathan Glover s (5th Essex Co.) regt., as returned agree 
able to order of Council of Nov. 7, 1777 ; residence, Marblehead ; engaged for 
town of Marblehead ; term, 3 years. 

NICKOLS, THOMAS, Worcester. Private, Capt. Timothy Bigelow s co. of Minute- 
men and militia, Col. Arternas Ward s regt., which marched on the alarm of 
April 19, 1775 ; service, 1 mo. 6 days. 

NICKOLS, THOMAS, Worcester. Private, Capt. Jonas Hubbard s co., Col. Ward s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 26, 1775; service, 3 mos. 
13 days. 

NICKOLS, THOMAS. Private, Capt. David Chadwick sco. ; service, 5 days; company 
marched to Bennington on an alarm ; State pay allowed agreeable to resolve 
of Sept. 23, 1777.

and marched to reinforce Northern army under Gen. Gates.

from militia of Suffolk and Essex counties to reinforce army under Gen.

NICOLAS, GILES. List of French prisoners sent from Halifax to Boston Oct. 8, 1778,

"Rainbow," at Halifax, Oct. 8, 1778, accompanying list, requests that said 
men be exchanged for British prisoners.

Nicolas to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years.

Penniman prior to Sept. 15, 1777, Col. Benjamin Gill s regt. ; engaged Aug. 
15, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 16 (also given 3 mos. 15) 
days, in Northern department. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

NILES, JOHN. Quarter Gunner, Capt. Lieut. William Burbeck s co. ; enlisted Dec.

for defence of Castle and Governor s Islands and commanded by his Excel 
lency John Hancock. 

NILES, JOHN. Return of men raised in Suffolk Co. for Continental service, agree

said Niles for Dec. [year not given]. 

NILES, JOHN. Matross; entered service Jan. 15, 1781; discharged May 1, 1781;

department ; reported in the artillery ; also, pay roll for wages of troops 
employed in the Eastern Indian department, for service from March 1, 1782,

to April 15, 1783, as returned by Col. John Allan, commanding officer; said

NILES, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Stephen Smith s co., Col. Foster s (Lincoln Co.) 
regt. ; service, 13 days; company served at Machias from July 16 [1777], to 
Oct. 10 [1777], when British ships lay in the harbor; also, Capt. Reuben 
Dyer s co. ; enlisted July 29, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 24, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 
27 days; company raised for expedition against St. Johns, N. S., and con

Northern department, including travel (117 miles) home.

nicide," on Penobscot expedition ; also, petition signed by said Nivens, 1st

position of the forces about Boston and dividing the army into 3 grand divi 
sions to consist of 2 brigades each ; said Nixon s regt. assigned to a brigade 
to be commanded by Brig. Gen. Sullivan, which was to form part of left wing

vateer), commanded by Capt. David Porter, dated Boston, June 16, 1781; 
age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 4 ft. 8 in. 

NOBLE, ANTHONY, Pearsontown (also given " Palmoth ") . Private, Capt. Jonathan 
Sawyer s (late Capt. Wentworth Stuart s) co., Col. Edmund Phiney s regt. ; 
muster roll dated Garrison at Fort George, Dec. 8, 1776 ; enlisted Dec. 1, 1775 ; 
reported re-engaged Nov. 13, 1776; also, return of men raised to serve in the 
Continental Army from Capt. Josiah Shaw s co., Col. Timothy Pike s (3d 
Cumberland Co.) regt. ; residence, Pearsontown ; enlisted for town of Pearson- 
town ; joined Capt. George Smith s co., Col. Vose s (also given Col. Patter 
son s) regt.; enlistment, 3 years; also, Private, Lieut. Colonel s co., Col. 
Joseph Vose s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. George W. Smith s co., Col. Vose s regt. ; 
muster roll for Dec., 1777, sworn to at Camp near Valley Forge ; enlisted Jan.

dated Feb. 3, 1781 ; Capt. John Williams s co., 1st Mass. regt. ; rank, Private ; 
age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, light ; occupation, 
yeoman ; birthplace, " Palmoth ; " residence, " Palmoth ; " enlisted Dec. 11, 
1779, by Maj. Ashly, at Highlands; enlistment, during war; also, Private, 
Capt. John Williams s co., Col. Joseph Vose s (1st) regt. ; muster roll for 
Jan., 1781, dated West Point; also, muster roll for May, 1781; reported on

kill; also, muster roll for Sept., 1781; also, muster roll for Oct. and Nov., 
1781, dated York Hutts; also, muster roll for Jan., 1782, sworn to at West 
Point.

NOBLE, AKTHUR. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Jan. 30, 1776 ; said Noble chosen Brigadier for Lincoln Co. ; appoint 
ment non-concurred in by Council Feb. 8, 1776. 

NOBLE, ASA, Westfield. Sergeant, Westfield co. of Minute-men, commanded by 
Lieut. John Shephard, which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm 
of April 19, 1775 ; discharged May 12, 1775 ; service, 3 weeks 1 day. 

NOBLE, ASHBEL, Westfield. Private, Westfield co. of Minute-men, commanded 
by Lieut. John Shephard, which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the 
alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 1 week 1 day; reported enlisted into the 
army April 28, 1775; also, Capt. Warham Parks s co., Col. Timothy Daniel- 
son s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 28, 1775 ; service, 3 
mos. 10 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775], dated Roxbury; 
also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Roxbury, 
Dec. 23, 1775; also, return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. David Mosley s (Westfield) co. ; residence, Westfield ; engaged 
for town of Westfield; joined Capt. Ball s co., Col. William Shepard s regt. ; 
term, during war; also, Corporal, Capt. Learned s co., Col. William Shep- 
pard s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 1, 1777, to 
Aug. 13, 1777 ; also, Private, Capt. Job Alvord s co., Col. Shepard s (3d) regt. ; 
return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777; also, Corporal, 
same co. and regt. ; return dated Jan. 31, 1778; mustered by State and Conti 
nental Muster Masters ; reported died Aug. 13, 1777. 

NOBLE, BARTHOLOMEW, Westfield. Private, Westfield co. of Minute-men, com

Oct. 7, 1775; also, Capt. Henry s co., Col. Rufus Putnam s (late Brewer s) 
regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury Camp, 
Dec. 23, 1775.

into the public store at Chatham ; date of delivery, Jan. 13, 1777.

taken by the enemy; also, Captain; engaged Oct. 23, 1780; discharged Nov. 
7, 1780; service, 16 days; company marched to Bennington to guard frontiers, 
on an alarm.

NOBLE, EZRA. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 7, 1780; age, 41 yrs. ; stature, 5ft. Sin. ; complexion, light ; engaged 
for town of Ipswich ; arrived at Springfield July 6, 1780 ; marched to camp 
July 7, 1780, under command of Capt. Dix. [See Ezra Knowlton.]

and Lieut. Sait s [?] cos.; engaged for town of Westfield; term, 3 months; 
also, Private, Capt. Levi Ely s co., Col. John Brown s regt. ; entered service 
July 20, 1780; service, 3 mos. ; reported killed Oct. 19, 1780; regiment raised 
for 3 months.

Westfield.

for service on expedition against St. Johns. 

NOBLE, SHADBACH. Private, Capt. David Mosely s co., Col. John Mosely s regt. ; 
enlisted Sept. 21, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 17, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days, on 
expedition to Saratoga, including travel (120 miles) home. 

NOBLE, SILAS, Blandford. Sergeant, Capt. John Ferguson s co. of Minute-men, 
Col. Timothy Danielson s regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to

Roxbury, Oct. 6, 1775; reported deceased. 

NOBLE, SILAS. Private, Capt. Samuel Sloper s (12th) co., Col. David Mosley s 
(3d Hampshire Co.) regt. ; entered service June 12, 1782 ; discharged June 
14, 1782 ; service, 3 days ; company marched to Northampton June 12, 1782, 
in support of the government and was allowed horse rations. 

NOBLE, SIMEON, Great Barrington. Return of men raised for Continental service 
probably from Capt. Goodrich s co. ; engaged for town of Great Barrington ; 
joined Capt. Jenkins s co., Col. Brewer s regt.; term, 3 years; also, list of 
men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, by Truman Wheler, 
Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. Ginkins s co. ; reported received 
State bounty; also, Private, Capt. Sewall s co., Col. Ebenezer Sprout s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 10, 1777, to Aug. 15, 
1778; residence, Great Barrington; reported died Aug. 15, 1778; also, Capt. 
Josiah Jenkins s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; return certified at Camp 
near Valley Forge, Jan. 23, 1778; mustered by Capt. Wheelar ; reported sick 
and absent. 

NOBLE, SOLOMON. Private, Capt. Samuel Clark s co., Col. Powel s (Berkshire Co.) 
regt; ; enlisted July 22, 1779 ; discharged Aug. 26, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 12 days, 
at New Haven, Conn., including 7 days (131 miles) travel home. 

NOBLE, SOLOMON. Private, Capt. John Spoor s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt.; entered service April 26,1777; discharged May 20, 
1777; service, 25 days, at Saratoga by order of Maj. Gen. Gates; also, Capt. 
Enoch Noble s co., Col. John Brown s regt.; entered service June 29, 1777; 
discharged July 21, 1777 ; service, 24 days, with Northern army ; mileage 
from camp home (120 miles) allowed; company called out by order of Brig. 
Gen. Fellows and Committee of Safety at request of Maj. Gen. Schuyler ; roll 
certified at Sheffield; also, Capt. Elijah Deming s detachment from Col. 
Ashley s regt.; entered service June 4, 1778; discharged July 15, 1778; ser 
vice, 41 days; detachment ordered to Albany by Gen. John Fellows; also, 
Capt. Roswell Downing s co., Col. Powel s regt. ; entered service July 19, 
1779 ; discharged Aug. 27 (also given Aug. 23) , 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 9 days ; 
company marched to New Haven, Conn., to serve for 1 month ; roll sworn to 
in Berkshire Co. ; also, receipt dated Sheffield, Aug. 28, 1780, for bounty paid 
said Noble by Capt. Roswell Downing, on behalf of the town of Sheffield, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 months. 

NOBLE, TIMOTHY. Capt. John Kellogg s co., Col. Leonard s regt.; engaged May 
16, 1777 ; discharged July 15, 1777 ; service, 61 days, in Northern department. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 499 

NOBLE, TIMOTHY. Private, Capt. Silas Fowler s co., Col. David Mosely s regt.; 
enlisted June 12, 1782 ; discharged June 17, 1782 ; service, 7 days ; company 
probably mounted and stationed at Springfield and Northampton for defence 
of the government. Roll sworn to at Westfield. 

NOBLE, ZACHABIAH. Private, Lieut. Jeremiah Hickok s co., Col. John Ashley s 
regt. ; entered service July 6, 1777 ; discharged July 18, 1777 ; service, 12 
days; company marched to Kingsbury July 6, 1777, at request of Maj. Gen. 
Schuyler ; roll sworn to in Berkshire Co. ; also, Capt. Enoch Noble s co., Col. 
John Ashley, Jr. s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; entered service Oct. 15, 1780; dis 
charged Oct. 17, 1780 ; service, 4 days ; company marched to the Northward 
by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows on an alarm at the time Forts Ann and George 
were taken by the enemy ; roll sworn to at Sheffield. 

NOBLE, ZENAS. Private, Capt. Peter Porter s co., Col. John Brown s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt.; entered service July 10, 1777; discharged July 25, 1777; service, 
15 days; company called out by order of Maj. Gen. Schuyler and marched to 
" Manchester on the Grants in the state of Vermount." 

NOBLE, ZENAS. Corporal, Lieut. James McKnight s detachment, Col. David 
Rositer s regt. ; enlisted Oct. 15, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 18, 1780 ; service, 3 days, 
on an alarm at the Northward ; detachment ordered to march to Bennington 
by Gen. Fellows ; roll sworn to in Berkshire Co. [See Jonas Noble.] 

NOBLES, BENJAMIN, Great Barrington. Return of men drafted from Berkshire Co. 
militia to march to Horse Neck under command of Col. Benjamin Simonds 
[year not given], but who failed to join regiment ; drafted from town of Great 
Barrington ; drafted into Capt. King s co. 

NOBLES, DAVID, Pittsfield. Captain, Col. John Paterson s (26th) regt. ; company 
return dated Oct. 6, 1775. 

NOBLES, ELI. Private, Capt. John Grannis s co. ; marched Jan. 20, 1776; service 
to Feb. 20, 1776, 1 mo. 12 days. Roll endorsed " Tarpaulin Cove." 

NOBLES, ELIHU, Westfield. Private, Capt. Reuben Munn s co., Col. Nicholas 
Dike s regt. ; pay abstract for mileage, dated Roxbury, Sept. 17, 1776 ; mileage 
for 108 miles allowed said Nobles; also, list of men raised in Hampshire Co.

to resolve of April 20, 1778, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Com 
missioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; engaged for town of Westfield ; 
marched June 17, 1778 ; arrived at Fishkill June 19, 1778. 

NOBLES, ISAAC, Dartmouth. Private, Capt. Thomas Kempton s co., Col. Daniel- 
son s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 8, 1775; service,

gade; reported a wagoner; also, muster rolls for Dec., 1781-Feb., 1782, dated 
Hutts 1st Brigade and sworn to at West Point ; term, during war.

NOBLES, MARK, Hadley. Private, Capt. Joshua Benson s co., Col. Rufus Put

NOBLES, OBADIAH, Sheffield or Taconic Mt. Descriptive list of men raised in

NORK, NICHOLAS. Return of sentences by a general court-martial appearing in a 
general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Aug. 24, 1776, taken from Col. 
Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Nork, of Col. Reed s regt., tried on charges of 
desertion, enlisting into another regiment and accepting 9 bounty; pleaded 
guilty and sentenced to receive 39 lashes on the bare back for the first offence 
and 39 for the second offence, ordered to return to his duty in Col. Read s regt., 
and the money received by him to be stopped out of his wages and repaid. 

NORK, RICHARD. Return of sentences by a general court-martial appearing in a 
general order, dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Aug. 24, 1776, taken from 
Col. Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Nork, of Col. Patterson s regt., tried on 
charges of refusing his duty and of striking his officer ; found guilty and 
sentenced to receive 39 lashes on the bare back for each offence.

for York Co., dated Wells, March 6, 1777 ; Capt. Daniel Wheelwright s co.,

NORRIS, . [This name also appears under the form of Narrise, Nores, Noris,

NORRIS, BENJAMIN, Exeter. List of men belonging to Capt. Isaac Sherman s co. 
who took the oath in Middlesex Co. June 24, 1775, required by Congress to be 
taken by the Mass, army; also, Private, Capt. Isaac Sherman s co., Col. 
Samuel Gerrish s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 17, 1775 ; 
service, 2 mos. 15 days; also, Capt. Sherman s (4th) co., Lieut. Col. Loammi 
Baldwin s (late Col. Gerrish s) 38th regt.; pay abstracts for Aug. and Sept., 
1775, dated Camp at Sewall s Point ; also, company return dated Sewall s 
Point, Sept. 26, 1775; also, Capt. Sherman s co., Col. Loammi Baldwin s 
(26th) regt.; return for advance pay for Jan., 1776; also, (late) Capt. Sher 
man s co., Col. Baldwin s regt. ; pay abstracts for Feb. and March, 1776 ; also, 
same co. and regt. ; pay abstracts for April, May, and June, 1776, dated New 
York ; also, Capt. Caleb Robinson s co., Col. Baldwin s regt. ; pay roll for 
mileage, etc., for the year 1776, dated Exeter, Feb. 22, 1777; said Norris re 
ported discharged 400 miles from home ; amount due for mileage, etc., receipted

NORRIS, DAVID, Boston (also given Exeter). List of men raised to serve in the

lery) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from March 15, 1777,

ney s regt. ; enlisted July 29, 1778; discharged Sept. 13,1778; service, 1 mo. 
16 days ; company raised in Plymouth Co. and marched to Rhode Island on 
an alarm. 

NORRIS, EPHRAIM. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Hammond s co. ; enlisted July 17, 
1775 ; service, 5 mos. 20 days ; company stationed at Wareham and Rochester

NORRIS, HUGH. Receipt dated May 14, 1782, for wages for service to May 10, 1783,

NORRIS, JAMES. List of prisoners taken by Lieut. Gen. Burgoyne to be exchanged

regt.

win s regt.

NORRIS, JOHN, Salem. Sailor, brigantine " Speedwell," commanded by Capt. John 
Ingersoll ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to May 27, 1780 ; age, 23

1 share. 

NORRIS, JOHN. Return showing number of prisoners, comprising officers and crews 
of 5 privateers belonging to Salem, Marblehead, and Cape Ann, taken by a 
British ship of war, accompanying a petition to the General Court, asking 
that measures be taken to effect their release [year not given] ; signature of 
said Norris appears with others, probably owners and agents of the captured 
privateers, affixed to said return. 

NORRIS, JONATHAN, Boston. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army

NORRIS, JONATHAN, Wrentham (also given Suncook). List of men raised to

discharged at Queman s Heights.

NORTH, JOSEPH. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
Jan. 30, 1776 ; said North chosen Colonel, 2d Lincoln Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; 
appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 8, 1776; reported commissioned 
Feb. 8, 1776 ; also, list of officers appointed to command men raised in the year 
1776 in accordance with an act passed to raise one-fourth part of the men in 
Lincoln Co., as returned by Samuel Harnden to Maj. Gen. James Warren ; 
also, petition dated Boston, March 25, 1777, signed by said North, Colonel, 
requesting that the men belonging to his regiment stationed at Tiverton, R. I., 
whose terms of enlistment were to expire April 10, 1777, be allowed mileage 
on account of their poor circumstances and the distance from their homes, 290 
miles in some instances; mileage allowed by resolve of March 29, 1777 ; also, 
Colonel, 2d Lincoln Co. regt., Brig. Gen. Charles Cushing s brigade; general 
return of Mass, militia made by Adj. Gen. Peleg Wadsworth, dated July 5, 
1779 ; also, same regt. ; supplement to the general return of 1779, made by Adj. 
Gen. Peleg Wadsworth, dated Boston, March 6, 1780.

Rosseter s brigade; entered service Oct. 20, 1781; discharged Oct. 28, 1781;

Col. Hyde s regt., Gen. Rosseter s brigade ; entered service Oct. 29, 1781 ; dis 
charged Nov. 6, 1781 ; service, 12 days, on an alarm at Stillwater.

tion of clothing allowed by the several towns of the State ; certificate attached 
to order dated Boston, May 24, 1779, signed by Lieut. Osgood Carleton, certi 
fies that said North and others had been transferred to the corps of invalids 
stationed at Boston under his command and had not received the clothing 
which they should have had " the last winter; " also, Private, Lieut. Osgood 
Carleton s co. of invalids stationed at Boston, Col. Lewis Nichola s regt.; 
muster roll dated Sept. 9, 1779 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls for Sept. 
and Oct., 1779; also, descriptive list endorsed "1777 to 1780;" Capt. John 
Lillie s co., Col. John Crane s (Artillery) regt.; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 
6 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged for town of Boston ; engaged March -, 1780 ; 
also, descriptive list of men mustered to serve in the Continental Army, as 
returned by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, 
May 25, 1780 ; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; occupation, 
gentleman soldier; residence, Boston ; mustered by Capt. John Lillie. 

NORTH, SAMUEL. List of prisoners on board the cartel " Hostage " to be exchanged 
for British prisoners, as returned by Thomas Stone, Commissary [year not 
given, probably 1776] ; said North reported taken in a prize brig of the schooner 
" General Putnam " (privateer) , by the British ship " Milford." 

NORTH, SAMUEL. List of prisoners sent in the cartel " Silver Eel " from Halifax 
to Boston, Oct. 8, 1778, to be exchanged for British prisoners, as returned by 
Bat. Fox, Commissary of Prisoners; reported a Seaman. 

NORTH, SOLOMON. Private, Capt. John Bacon s co., Col. David Rosseter s regt., 
Gen. John Fellows s brigade ; entered service Oct. 13, 1781; discharged Oct. 
20, 1781 ; service, 11 days, with militia sent as reinforcements to army under 
Gen. Stark at Stillwater on an alarm. Roll endorsed " Col. Hides Reg t." 

NORTH, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Aaron Rowley s co., Col. John Brown s detach 
ment of militia ; enlisted June 30, 1777 ; discharged July 26, 1777, at Saratoga ;

on an alarm at Ticonderoga ; also, Capt. John Bacon s co., Col. Rosseter s regt., 
Gen. John Fellows s brigade ; enlisted Nov. 5, 1780; discharged Nov. 7, 1780; 
service, 4 days ; company marched to reinforce army under Gen. Stark at Still- 
water on an alarm.

NORTH, WILLIAM, Boston. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. John Gill s (6th) co., Col. Crafts s

pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780 ; reported as serving 
5 mos. 9 days as Captain, 6 mos. 21 days as Captain and Aide-de-camp; also 
reported as Aide-de-camp to Maj. Gen. Steuben ; also, return certified at Camp 
near Morristown, April 30, 1780, of officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, 
Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts 
in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., who were incorporated into a regiment under 
the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 
9, 1779 ; rank, Captain ; residence, Boston ; appointed May 10, 1777 ; also, 
Captain, Col. Henry Jackson s regt. ; return of officers, dated Boston, Dec. 7, 
1780; also, Captain, Col. Henry Jackson s (4th) regt.; returns of effectives 
between April 4, 1781, and May 30, 1783, datedMass. Hutts, Camp near New

acting as Aide-de-camp to Baron Steuben; also, Captain, Col. Henry Jack 
son s (4th) regt.; list of officers of 1st Mass. Brigade [year not given, prob 
ably 1782 or 1783], showing dates of commissions; said North commissioned 
May 10, 1777.

Thomas s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 10, 1775; ser 
vice, 2 mos., 3 weeks, 5 days. 

NORTON, . [This name also appears under the form of Norson, Nortan, Norten, 

Nosno.] 

NORTON, ABIJAH, Richmond. Return of men drafted from Berkshire Co. militia 
to march to Horse Neck under command of Col. Benjamin Simonds [year 
not given], but who failed to join regiment ; drafted from town of Richmond ; 
drafted into Capt. Hewins s co. ; also, Private, Capt. Amos Rathbun s co., 
Maj. Caleb Hyde s detachment of militia; entered service July 8, 1777; dis 
charged July 26, 1777 ; service, 19 days ; company marched to reinforce North 
ern army and was dismissed 97 miles from home. 

NORTON, ABNER. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Norton s (4th) co., Col. Beriah 
Norton s (Dukes Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen by the sev 
eral companies in said regiment ; ordered in Council April -, 1776, that said 
officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 3, 1776. 

NORTON, ABNER. Master s Mate, brigantine " Tyrannicide," commanded by Capt. 
Allen Hallet ; engaged March 5, 1779 ; discharged April 30, 1779 ; service, 1 
mo. 25 days. 

NORTON, AMOS. Private, Capt. Samuel Huse s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. of 
guards ; engaged Nov. 10, 1777 ; service to April 4, 1778, at Winter Hill ; also, 
Capt. Stephen Jenkins s co., Col. Gerrish s regt.; entered service Oct. 14, 
1779; discharged Nov. 22, 1779; service, 1 mo. 20 days, at Claverack, includ 
ing travel (240 miles) home ; regiment detached from militia of Suffolk and 
Essex counties to reinforce army under Gen. Washington. 

NORTON, ANSEL. Receipt given to Benjamin Smith, signed by said Norton and 
others, for wages for service from June 1, 1776, to Sept. 1, 1776, in Capt. 
Smith s co. ; also, Private, Capt. Benjamin Smith s co. ; service from Sept. 1, 
1776, to Nov. 21, 1776, 2 mos. 21 days ; company stationed at Martha s Vine 
yard for defence of seacoast. 

NORTON, AZARIAH, Manchester. Private, Capt. Andrew Marsters s co., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Medford ; service, 3 days. 

NORTON, BENJAMIN, Dighton. Order dated Camp at Hull, June 21, 1776, signed 
by said Norton and others belonging to Capt. Zebedee Redding s co., Col. 
Josiah Whitney s regt., for advance pay for 1 month, etc.; also, Private, 
Capt. Zebedee Redding s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; service from 4 
days preceding march to Aug. 1, 1776, 2 mos. 2 days. 

NORTON, BENJAMIN, Sanford. Private, Capt. Morgan Lewis s co., which marched 
April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days.

NORTON, BENJAMIN. Private, Capt. Peleg Peck s co., Col. George Williams s 
regt. ; service between Sept. 29, 1777, and Oct. 30, 1777, 24 days, under Maj. 
Gen. Spencer on a secret expedition; company stationed at Tiverton, R. I. ; 
roll sworn to at Swanzey ; also, list of men mustered subsequent to Jan. 17, 
1778, by James Leonard, Muster Master for Bristol Co. ; Col. William Lea s 
(Lee s) regt. ; engaged for town of Swanzey. 

NORTON, BENJAMIN. Private, brigantine "Freedom," commanded by Capt. John 
Clouston ; engaged June -, 1776; reported deserted. 

NORTON, BENJAMIN. Corporal, Capt. Erastus Sargent s co., Col. Benjamin 
Simonds s detachment of Berkshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated Ticon- 
deroga, Feb. 25, 1777 ; enlisted Dec. 16, 1776 ; enlistment to expire March 15, 
1777 ; also, same co. and detachment ; enlisted Dec. 16, 1776 ; discharged March 
22, 1777; service, 97 days, at Ticonderoga, including 7 days (140 miles) travel 
home ; also, Capt. Job Woodbridge s co., Col. Brown s (Berkshire Co.) regt. ;

pany formed part of a detachment under Maj. Caleb Hide which marched from 
Stockbridge on the evacuation of Ticonderoga; also, Capt. Ebenezer Cook s 
co., Col. John Brown s (Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Sept. 22, 1777; 
discharged Oct. 14, 1777 ; service, 22 days, at the Northward. 

NORTON, BENJAMIN. Private, Lieut. Benjamin Bates s co., in a regiment com 
manded by Maj. Eliphalet Gary; marched July 30, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 
1780; service, 11 days; company marched from Abington to Tiverton, R. I., 
on an alarm. 

NORTON, BERIAH. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
Feb. 1, 1776; said Norton chosen Colonel, Dukes Co. regt. of Mass, militia; 
appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 2, 1776; reported commissioned 
Feb. 1, 1776; also, list of officers chosen by the 1st co., Dukes Co. regiment of 
Mass, militia and recommended for commissions, as returned by said Norton, 
Colonel, and Brotherton Daggett, 1st Major, dated Edgartown, June 4, 1776 ; 
also, Colonel, Dukes Co. regt. ; general return of Mass, militia, made by Adj. 
Gen. Peleg Wadsworth, dated July 5, 1779. 

NORTON, BISHOP, Newburyport. Fifer, Capt. Ezra Lunt s co., Col. Moses Little s 
(17th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 2, 1775; service, 
13 weeks; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; age, 23 yrs. 

NORTON, CHARLES. Private, Capt. David Wheeler s co., Col. John Brown s 
detachment of militia ; entered service June 30, 1777 ; discharged July 25,

vice, 11 days; company marched from Lanesborough to Saratoga Oct. 29, 
1781, on an alarm.

NORTON, MATTHEW. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Hammond s co. ; enlisted July 21,

for defence of seacoast and discharged Dec. 23, 1775.

29, 1776 ; service, 7 mos. 6 days ; company stationed at Dartmouth for defence 
of seacoast. Roll dated Dartmouth. 

NORTON, MELATIAH. List of men mustered between Sept. 10, and Sept. 15, 1777, by

dence, allowing 1 mo. 2 days service at Rhode Island, including travel home.

several classes of the town of Berwick, to serve in the Continental Army ; said 
Norton hired by Class No. 31 and received bounty.

NOTONKSHON, WILLIAM. Capt. William Goodrich s co., Col. Paterson s regt. ; 
order for advance pay, signed by said Notonkshon and others, dated July 1, 
1775. 

NOTONKSIN, WILLIAM, Stockbridge. Private, Capt. William Goodrich s co. of 
Indians, Col. Patterson s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 
2, 1775; service, 3 mos. 7 days.

county; also, descriptive list of men " enlisted and received at this Post," as 
returned by Seth Banister, Captain, 4th Mass, regt., and Commandant at 
Springfield ; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11 (also given 5 ft. 10) in. ; hair, black ; 
eyes, black; occupation, hunter; engaged for town of Watertown ; engaged 
Dec. 29, 1781; term, 3 years; reported as having arrived at Springfield Jan. 
4, 1782; also reported an Indian. 

NOTT, . [This name also appears under the form of Knott, Neet, Nett, Not.]

NOTT, LEWIS, Boston. List of men raised by the town of Boston to serve in the

plexion, pock -pitted ; hair, dark ; eyes, gray ; residence, Boston ; endorsement

Co., dated Dorchester, June 29, 1778; conducted to camp by Maj. Thomas 
Cogswell, of Col. Vose s regt.

pany marched to Rhode Island to serve for 2 months from time of arrival at 
Providence.

on Penobscot expedition ; vessel reported lost. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.

Col. Benjamin Tupper, stating that His Excellency Gen. Washington had 
expressed his opinion that all vacancies which existed before Nov. 1, 1780, 
ought to be rilled in order to bring about a settlement of ranks as authorized 
under the new arrangement for the army, and recommending that certain 
officers be promoted to fill vacancies in the llth Mass. Line regt. ; said Nowell, 
Ensign, to be promoted to a Lieutenant, his appointment to date from Oct. 27, 
1780; ordered in Council Dec. 15, 1780, that warrants be issued to said officers.

NOYCE, DUDLEY, Methuen. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti

returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 7, 1780; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, 
light ; engaged for town of Methuen ; arrived at Springfield July 6, 1780 ; 
marched to camp July 7, 1780, under command of Capt. Dix ; also, list of men 
raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having 
passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll 
for 6 months men raised by the town of Methuen for service in the Continen 
tal Army during 1780; marched July 1, 1780; discharged Dec. 5, 1780; ser 
vice, 5 mos. 17 days, including travel (240 miles) home. 

NOYCE, JACK, Stoneham. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army

said officers be commissioned.

the 8 months service in 1775 ; said Nutting reported as having enlisted for 
Quebec Sept. 8, 1775. 

NUTTING, DANIEL, Dunstable. Private, Capt. Reuben Butterfield s co. of militia, 
Col. David Green s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to 
Cambridge; left place of rendezvous April 23, 1775; service, 4 days; also, 
Capt. Ebenezer Bancroft s co., Col. Ebenezer Bridge s (27th) regt. ; receipt 
for advance pay, signed by said Nutting and others, dated Camp before Bos 
ton, July 24, 1775; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 

I, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; service, 3 mos. 5 days; also, order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Nov. 4, 1775; also, account dated Dec. 

II, 1775, of articles lost in battle at Bunker Hill June 17, 1775; amounts 
allowed in House of Representatives June 24, 1775. 

NUTTING, DAVID, Boston (also given Bennington). Capt. John Wentworth s co., 
Col. Aaron Willard s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance from home to 
Bennington, dated Boston, Jan. 6, 1777 ; 182 miles travel allowed said Nutting ; 
also, return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Peter 
Peniman s (3d Mendon) co. ; residence, Boston ; engaged for town of Men- 
don ; joined Capt. Allen s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; term to expire Oct. -, 1780 ; 
also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk 
Co., dated Boston, Dec. 12, 1777; Capt. Allen s co., Col. Alden s regt.; also, 
Sergeant, 6th co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from Sept. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Bennington; credited to 
town of Mendon ; also, Capt. Robert Allen s co., Col. Ichabod Alden s regt. ; 
return endorsed " 1778; " mustered by County Muster Master Barber and by 
a Continental Muster Master; also, Lieut. Jonas Parker s co., (late) Col. 
Ichabod Alden s regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1778, dated Cherry Valley; 
appointed May 16 [year not given] ; term, 3 years; reported furloughed Dec. 
26, 1778, for 16 days; also, (late) Colonel s co. commanded by Capt. Lieut. 
Jonas Parker, 6th Mass. regt. formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; 
muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Fort "Harkemer; " appointed 
March 16 [year not given]; also, Capt. Parker s co., Col. Brooks s regt.; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Sept. 1, 1780.

home.

NUTTING, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Reuben Butterfield s co. ; enlisted Dec. 16, 1776 ;

NUTTING, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Asa Laurance s co. of volunteers, Col. Jonathan 
Reed s regt. ; entered service Sept. 26, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 9, 1777 ; service, 
1 mo. 15 days, at the Northward, including travel home ; company raised in 
Littleton and Westford and marched to assist army under Gen. Gates. 

NUTTING, THOMAS. Receipt dated Boston, April 11, 1782, for bounty paid said 
Nutting by Lieut. James King, Chairman of Class No. 1 of the town of Little 
ton, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years.

NUTTING, THOMAS, Jr. Private, Capt. Reuben Butterfield s co. ; enlisted Dec. 16,
