miles) travel home. 

NUTTING, WILLIAM, Groton. Corporal, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co. of Minute-men,

NUTTING, WILLIAM, Marblehead. Capt. Joel Smith s (4th) co., Col. John

than Reed s regt. ; entered service Sept. 27, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 9, 1777 ;

Gates.

reported delivered to Capt. Marshall. 

NUTTON, SAMUEL. List of officers and crew of the ship " Franklin," commanded 
by Capt. Allen Hallet, dated Boston, June 20, 1781. 

NUTTON, THOMAS, Westford. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army

co., Col. Marshall s (also given Col. Alden s) regt. ; term, 3 years, to expire 
in 1780. 

NUTTOPH, STEPHEN. Seaman, ship "General Mifflin," commanded by Capt. 
George Wait Babcock ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to at Bos 
ton, Sept. 9, 1780; age, 29 yrs.; complexion, dark; reported as belonging to 
Massachusetts.

NYE, BARTLETT. Private, in a company commanded by Capt. Job Crocker, of

NYE, BENJAMIN, Rutland District (also given Barre) . 2d Lieutenant, Capt. John

Northern army for 30 days ; engaged Sept. 26, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 18, 1777 ;

1779.

roll for Oct., 1778; reported joined.

NYE, JOHN. Private, Capt. Jesse Bradley s co., Col. John Brown s regt. ; entered

Northward; mileage home (100 miles) allowed ; also, Capt. William Francis s 
co., Col. John Ashley s detachment of militia ; entered service July 22, 1777; 
discharged Aug. 13, 1777 ; service, 23 days, in Northern department.

NYE, JONATHAN, New Braintree. Sergeant, Capt. John Grainger s co. of Minute-

NYE, JONATHAN, Plympton. Private, Capt. John Bridghain s co., which marched

Col. Cotton ; service, 3 days. 

NYE, JONATHAN, Sandwich. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Col. Nathaniel Freeman s (1st Barnstable Co.) regt. ; residence, 
Sandwich; enlisted for town of Sandwich; joined Capt. Wadsworth s co., 
Col. Bradford s regt.; enlistment, 3 years or during war; also, Sergeant, 
Capt. Joseph Wadsworth s co., Col. Gamaliel Bradford s regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from March 12, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, 
same co. and regt. ; subsistence allowed from date of enlistment, March 28, 
1777 ; credited with 42 days allowance ; roll dated Boston ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; return dated Valley Forge, Jan. 28, 1778 ; mustered by County and 
Continental Muster Masters; also, certificate dated Boston, Feb. 2, 1779, 
signed by Capt. Joseph Wadsworth, certifying that said Nye, a Sergeant in 
his company, Col. Gamaliel Bradford s regt., joined the regiment prior to 
Aug. 15, 1777, and had continued in service to date without absence except 
when on furlough ; also, Lieut. Colonel s co., Col. Bradford s regt. ; Continen 
tal Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 6, 1780.

raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as hav

er s regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order for bounty coat

Brewer s regt., asking for allowance for articles lost in battle at Bunker Hill

for 30 days.

received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 19, 1780; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; 
engaged for town of Falmouth ; marched to camp July 19, 1780, under com 
mand of Capt. Clark ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Falmouth, Barnstable Co., for service in the Continental Army during 1780; 
marched July 6, 1780; discharged Jan. 1, 1781; service, 6 mos. 11 days, in 
cluding travel (300 miles) home. 

NYE, THOMAS, 2d. Descriptive list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, returned as 
received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Capt. James Tisdale, at Spring 
field, Aug. 23, 1779; Capt. Fisk s (Fish s) co., Col. Freeman s regt.; age, 18 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, dark ; engaged for town of Sandwich ; 
also, company receipt for equipments, given to Capt. James Tisdale, dated 
Aug. 23, 1779. 

NYE, WILLIAM, Rochester (probably). Sergeant, Capt. Edward Hammond s co. 
of Minute-men, Col. Theophilus Cotton s regt., which marched in response 
to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service from April 20 to April 26, 1775, 7 days.

OAKMAN, . [This name also appears under the form of Oakmon.] 

OAKMAN, AMOS, Scituate. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the sloop " Race 
Horse," commanded by Capt. Clifford Byrne, sworn to June 17, 1780; age, 24 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 2 in. ; complexion, light; residence, Scituate. 

OAKMAN, CONSTANT (also given CONSTANT FOBES), Marshfield. Private, Capt. 
Thomas Turner s co. of militia, Col. John Baley s regt. ; pay abstract for mile 
age, dated Jan. 10, 1776 : mileage for 63 miles allowed said Oakman ; reported 
encamped with Brig. Gen. Thomas s brigade ; also, petition addressed to the 
Council, dated Marshfield, March 2, 1776, signed by said Oakman, stating that 
he had enlisted into Capt. Elijah Crocker s co., Gen. Thomas s regt., about 
the middle of May, 1775; that the company was ordered to guard the shores 
at Marshfield, and he served therein from May 25, 1775, to June 26, 1775 ; that 
it was then ordered to Roxbury, but said Oakman was ordered to remain at 
Marshfield to care for a sick man and for some baggage, in which duty he 
continued 14 days; that when Capt. Crocker s co. was mustered at Col. John 
Baily s, before Col. Robartson, Muster Master, the petitioner was not notified 
to appear, the Captain conceiving that he would not pass muster owing to his 
" Littleness of Stature ; " that the petitioner had later satisfactorily performed 
2 mos. service in Capt. Thomas Turner s co. at Roxbury ; and asking that he be 
recompensed for the time he served in Capt. Crocker s co. ; certificate signed 
by Capt. Crocker, certifying to the truth of the facts stated in petition, is 
appended thereto. 



602 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

OAKMAN, JOHN, Danvers. Descriptive list of men raised by the town of Danvers 
to serve in the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778; age, 
16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, black ; eyes, black ; resi 
dence, Danvers ; also, list of men raised in Essex Co. for the term of 9 months 
from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, returned as received of Jonathan 
Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; engaged for town 
of Danvers; arrived at Fishkill June 19, 1778; also, list of men returned as 
mustered by Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy Muster Master, dated Fishkill, 
Aug. 1, 1778; also, Private, Maj. William Lithgow s co., Col. Benjamin 
Tupper s regt. ; muster roll for March, 1779, dated West Point ; enlisted June 
19, 1778; discharged March 19, 1779; enlistment, 9 months. 

OAKMAN, MELZAB TURNER, Marshfield. List of officers chosen by the several com 
panies in 2d Plymouth Co. regt., as returned by John Gushing, Jr., and others, 
dated Hanover, May 8, 1776 ; said Oakman recommended as a suitable person 
for Adjutant ; ordered in Council May 10, 1776, that said officers be commis 
sioned ; also, Adjutant, Col. John Cushing s regt.; service, 15 days, on an 
alarm at Bristol, R. I., in Dec., 1776; roll dated Scituate.

manded by Capt. Gideon Henfield, sworn to May 23, 1780; said Oakman 
rated f share.

OAKMAN, SAMUEL. Order dated June 18, 1775, signed by said Oakman and others 
belonging to Capt. Abner Cranson s co., Col. Whitcomb s regt., for cartridge 
boxes for which Capt. Cranson promised to be accountable ; receipt for said 
cartridge boxes, signed by Henry Eayrs, Orderly Sergeant and Clerk ; also, 
Capt. Abner Cranson s co., Col. Asa Whitcomb s (23d) regt.; company 
receipts for wages for Aug. and Sept., 1775, dated Camp at Prospect Hill ; 
also, receipt for bounty coat dated Camp at Prospect Hill, Nov. 2, 1775. 

OAKMAN, SAMUEL. Communication addressed to the Council, dated Gardnerstown, 
July 28, 1777, signed by Joseph North, stating that Henry Smith, Captain of 
the 4th co. in his regiment, had resigned his commission, and that said Oak 
man had been chosen Captain in his stead ; ordered in Council Sept. 2, 1777, 
that a commission be issued; also, Captain, 4th co., 2d Lincoln Co. regt. of 
Mass, militia; list of officers [year not given], 

OAKMAN, TOBIAS, Marshfield. Private, Capt. Joseph Cliffs co. of militia, Col. 
Anthony Thomas s regt. ; service, 1 day, subsequent to the alarm of April 19, 
1775; part of said service with guards at North river who relieved Capt. 
Lothrop. 

OAKMAN, TOBIAS. Sergeant, Capt. John Turner s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. 
of guards ; engaged Nov. 6, 1777 ; service to April 3, 1778, 4 mos. 27 days, at 
Cambridge. 

OAKMON, TOBIAS. Private, Capt. Joseph Soper s co., Col. Theophilus Cotten s 
regt.; enlisted March 5, 1781: discharged March 20, 1781; service, 15 days;

in Plymouth Co.

coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Winter Hill, Oct. 27, 1775;

OAKS, DANIEL. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780; age, 19 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; engaged for town of Westborough ; 
arrived at Springfield July 4, 1780; marched to camp July 5, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Frothingham, of the artillery; also, pay roll for 6 months 
men raised by the town of Westborough for service in the Continental Army 
during 1780; marched to camp July 1, 1780; discharged 200 miles from home 
Dec. 19, 1780; service, 5 mos. 29 days. 

OAKS, GEORGE. Private, Capt. David Bent s co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk s regt. ; 
travel out and home, 226 miles; service at 20 miles per day, 11 days; com 
pany detached Aug. 20, 1777, and marched from Rutland to Bennington on 
an alarm. 

OAKS, GEORGE. List of prisoners to be received in exchange for British prisoners 
sent to Halifax in the cartel " Swift," as attested by Robert Pierpont, Com 
missary, dated Oct. 9, 1777; said Oaks, Seaman, to be exchanged for Gilbert 
Cannadey, Seaman ; also, list of prisoners sent from His Majesty s ship " Scar 
borough " on board a cartel Nov. 9, 1777, endorsed " Josiah Godfrey s Papers ; " 
also, list of prisoners sent in the cartel " Swift " from Halifax to Boston Nov. 
9, 1777, as returned by Josiah Godfrey and B. Fox, Commissaries; reported 
a Seaman. 

OAKS, JACOB, Charlton. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continen

sary [year not given].

pany return dated Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Camp Winter Hill, Oct. 26, 1775.

miles) home ; residence, New Braintree ; enlisted for town of New Braintree ; 
regiment raised for 3 months. Roll sworn to at Brookfield.

Smith s (6th) regt. ; return for wages for the year 1782 ; wages allowed said 
Obrine for Dec., 1782, 1 mo.

O DONNLL, RALPH. Receipt dated Boston, May 7, 1782, for bounty paid said 
O Donnll by Alexander Hodgdon, in behalf of a committee of the town o-f 
Boston, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years.

OGELVE, NICHOLAS. Petition dated Boston, April 29, 1777, signed by Josiah 
Batchelder, Jr., & Co., asking that said Ogelve be commissioned as com 
mander of the schooner " Warren " (privateer), fitted out for a 4 months cruise, 
in the room of Israel Thorndike, absent at sea ; said vessel reported as ready 
for sea and as intended to join the fleet under Capt. Manly ; ordered in Council 
April 30, 1777, that a commission be issued. 

OGER, BENJAMIN. 1st Lieutenant ; list of officers of Essex Co. militia appointed 
to command men raised for various purposes ; said Oger and others detached 
to guard troops of convention ; reported commissioned July 12, 1778. 

OGILBE, NICHOLAS. Capt. Francis Symonds s co., Col. John Glover s (21st) regt. ; 
receipt for advance pay, signed by said Ogilbe and others, dated Cambridge, 
June 27, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Camp at Cambridge, Jan. 1, 1776; also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 8, 1777, 
signed by said Ogilbe, commander of the brigantine " Washington," owned 
by Samuel Dyson and Samuel Thwing, stating that said vessel had been fitted 
out as a privateer, and asking that he be commissioned ; ordered in Council 
Nov. 8, 1777, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 
4, 1778, signed by Bartholomew Putnam, in behalf of himself and Jacob Ash 
ley, asking that said Ogilbe be commissioned as commander of the ship 
" Bunker Hill " (privateer) ; ordered in Council Nov. 4, 1778, that a com 
mission be issued. 

OGILBY, NICHOLAS. Petition dated Boston, June 13, 1781, signed by Samuel Pote, 
in behalf of himself and others, of Marblehead, asking that David Stevenson 
be commissioned as commander of the brigantine "Siren" (privateer) ; ad 
vised in Council June 13, 1781, that a commission be issued; the name of 
said Ogilby, reported as being 36 yrs. of age, appears on reverse of above petition 
probably because he was an officer on board said vessel.

for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, May 10, 1778; Col. Crane s regt.

OLDS, GEORGE. Return of sentences by a general court-martial, Brig. St. Clair, 
President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, 
Oct. 16, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Olds 
tried on charge of mutiny, found guilty, and sentenced to receive 20 lashes on 
the bare back and pick oakum for 1 week.

vice, 25 days, at Saratoga by order of Maj. Gen. Gates; also, Capt. Enoch 
Noble s co. ; enlisted Oct. 23, 1780; discharged Nov. 7, 1780; service, 16 days; 
company marched to Bennington to guard frontiers on an alarm.

in guarding stores at and about Boston under Maj. Gen. Heath, agreeable to

Symmes s detachment of guards ; enlisted Feb. 13, 1778 ; discharged May 13, 
1778; service, 3 mos., under Maj. Gen. Heath at and about Boston.

OLIVER, JAMES. List of prisoners to be received in exchange for British prisoners 
sent to Halifax in the cartel " Swift," as attested by Robert Pierpont, Com 
missary, dated Oct. 9, 1777 ; said Oliver, a Seaman, to be exchanged for John 
Swaney, Seaman. 

OLIVER, JAMES. Petition dated Boston, Dec. 20, 1777, signed by Susannah Oliver, 
mother of said Oliver, Midshipman, stating that he had been taken on board 
the ship " Hancock," commanded by Capt. John Manley, and was held a pris 
oner at Halifax, and requesting that James Malcolm, a Midshipman belonging 
to the frigate " Fox," a prisoner on one of the prison-ships in Boston harbor, 
might be exchanged for said Oliver ; ordered in Council Dec. 20, 1777, that the 
Commissary of Prisoners be directed to forward the aforesaid James Malcolm 
in the next cartel bound to Halifax in order to effect his exchange for said 
Oliver. 

OLIVER, JAMES. Seaman, brigantine "Freedom," commanded by Capt. John 
Cluston (Clouston) ; list of men [year not given, probably 1777].

Cathcart ; engaged May 4, 1779 ; discharged June 23, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 19 , 
days; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.; also, account of rations due Capt. John

OLNEY, . [This name also appears under the form of Onely, Oney, Only.] 

OLNEY, . Report of a committee of the Council appointed to investigate the 

conduct " in March Last " of Capt. John Fisk, of the brig " Massachusetts," 
while cruising with the State brig " Tyrannicide," commanded by Capt. Jona 
than Harraden, and the Continental brig " Cabot," commanded by said Olney, 
Captain, in connection with their failure to attack the British frigate "Mil- 
ford ; " report read and accepted in Council Aug. 6, 1777, and Capt. Fisk 
exonerated.

Supreme Judicial Court, recommending that the sentence of 6 months impris 
onment imposed upon said Orcut for setting fire to Boston jail be remitted 
upon proof of the readiness of any officer to take charge of him for the army ; 
advised in Council March 12, 1783, that the sentence be remitted.

ORDWAY, JAMES (also given JAMES, Jr.), Methuen. Private, Capt. John Davis s 
co. of Minute-men, Col. Fry s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19,

company return dated Cambridge, Oct. 5, 1775 ; enlisted May 14, 1775 ; also, 
petition dated Methuen, Jan. 27, 1777, signed by said Ordway, stating that he 
had been in the engagement at Bunker Hill June 17, 1775, and had there lost 
a blanket, knapsack, and bayonet, for which no allowance had been made him, 
and praying that the sum of 20s might be allowed him as a compensation for 
his losses ; petition attested by Capt. John Davis.

Washington.

co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. ; marched July 28, 1780 ; discharged July 
31, 1780; service, 5 days, on an alarm at Rhode Island; company detached 
for 6 days service and marched from Rehoboth to Tiverton and there served 
under Gen. Heath.

officers refusing to serve. Roll sworn to at Rehoboth.

ORNE, JOSHUA. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
Feb. 7, 1776; said Orne chosen 1st Major, Col. Jonathan Glover s (5th Essex 
Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 8, 1776 ; 
reported commissioned Feb. 8, 1776 ; also, resignation dated Marblehead, Dec. 
23, 1778, signed by said Orne, stating that he had been appointed 1st Major, 
5th regt., Essex Co. brigade, in 1776, which appointment he had accepted 
although conscious of his inadequacy for the office, but as the conditions for 
the ultimate success of the colonies " now " appeared more favorable, resign 
ing his commission, while expressing his willingness to serve in any other 
position for which he might be suited. 

ORNE, JOSHUA. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship "Thorn," com 
manded by Capt. Richard Cowell, sworn to at Marblehead, Sept. 14, 1780; 
stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light. 

ORNE, JOSIAH. Return showing number of prisoners, comprising officers and crews 
of five privateers belonging to Salem, Marblehead, and Cape Ann, taken by a 
British ship of war, accompanying a petition to the General Court asking that 
measures be taken to effect their release, endorsed " Aug t 11. 1780 ; " signature 
of said Orne appears with those of other owners and agents of the captured 
privateers affixed to said return.

5 days; company marched to Bennington on an alarm.

joined at Springfield May 1, 1781 ; discharged July 31, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. ; 
company raised for 3 months and stationed at Springfield.

militia and marched to Tiverton, R. I.

OSBURN, WILLIAM. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from 
Capt. Isaac Marsh s (1st Stockbridge) co. [year not given]; enlistment,

OSBURN, WILLIAM. Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from 
Jan. 1, 1782, 12 mos.; also, petition dated Boston, March 5, 1783, signed by 
Moses Goodenow, of Sudbury, stating that he had engaged said Osburn to 
serve for a class of the town of Sudbury for the term of 3 years or during the 
war and had paid him a bounty therefor ; that later said Osburn had engaged 
to serve for the town of Concord, and though claimed by both towns had 
been adjudged to Concord by reason of default on the part of those who should 
have represented Sudbury, and requesting that the case might be re-opened, 
or the bounty money paid returned to him, or relief granted in some other 
form.

8 days; detachment marched on the alarm at Saratoga of Oct. 29, 1781.

OSGOOD, CHRISTOPHER. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Jonathan Gardner, Jr. s (1st) co., 
1st Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia; return dated Salem, May 15, 1776, signed 
by Col. Timothy Pickering, Jr., and Joseph Sprague, of officers chosen by 
the several companies of militia in Salem and returned to be commissioned, 
said officers accepting the appointments, however, only upon the condition 
that the General Court would compel a more equal distribution as to the per 
sons required to undergo military training and to be subject to service calls, 
and also in order that the existing companies might be kept fully trained and 
equipped ; ordered in Council June 6, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; 
reported commissioned June 6, 1776.

except on furlough, etc., certified at Camp near Peekskill, Feb. 16, 1779; also, 
Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s co., Col. Nixon s (5th) regt. ; muster roll for May, 
1779, dated Highlands ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Aug. and Sept., 
1779; reported reduced to Private Sept. 24, 1779; also, Private, same co. and 
regt.; pay roll for Oct., 1779; also, Lieut. Col. Daniel Whiting s co., Col. 
Nixon s regt.; pay rolls for Nov. and Dec., 1779, dated Soldier s Fortune; 
also, Lieut. Colonel s co., 6th Mass. regt. ; return for clothing for the year 
1780 ; receipt for said clothing, dated Peekskill, Dec. 5, 1779 ; also, descriptive 
list of men belonging to Col. Thomas Nixon s regt. who enlisted for the war 
prior to Sept. 30, 1779, certified at Highlands ; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; 
complexion, light; engaged for town of Billerica; also, Capt. A. Holden s

1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; residence, Chelmsford; also, Lieut. Col. Daniel 
Whiting s co., Col. Nixon s regt. ; pay roll for Jan.-June, 1780; said Osgood

dated West Point, Jan. 29, 1781 ; Capt. Holden s co., Col. Nixon s (6th) regt.

complexion, light; hair, light; occupation, farmer; residence, Charlestown; 
enlisted April 7, 1777, by Capt. Danforth ; enlistment, during war ; also, Capt. 
Peter Clayes s (Light Infantry) co., commanded by Capt. John K. Smith 
prior to May 1, 1781, Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s (6th) regt. ; returns for wages 
for the years 1781 and 1782 ; wages allowed said Osgood for 24 mos. ; reported 
deserted in Feb., 1782, joined in March, 1782, and full amount of wages 
allowed.

Cushing s co., was wounded in the leg at Hull in 1775, and the resulting 
injury would render him in a great measure incapable of earning his living 
by labor.

appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 8, 1776; reported commissioned 
Feb. 8, 1776 ; also, communication addressed to the Council, dated Barnstable, 
Aug. 19, 1776, signed by said Otis, stating that he had formed a Matross com 
pany in Col. Nathaniel Freeman s regt., 6th brigade, and a Matross co. in 
Col. Joseph Doan s regt. ; that said companies had made choice of their 
officers, and requesting that they be commissioned ; ordered in Council Aug. 
30, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; also, official record of a ballot by 
the House of Representatives, dated Nov. 23, 1776; said Otis chosen Naval 
Officer for the port of Barnstable; appointment concurred in by Council Nov. 
27, 1776; also, return dated Barnstable, Jan. 7, 1777, signed by said Otis, 
Colonel, stating that in accordance with orders he had detached and caused 
to march one-quarter part of the militia belonging to his brigade and one- 
fifth of those belonging to Barnstable in addition to one-fourth part, and had 
placed the three companies thus formed under command of Maj. Winslow, 
of Col. Doan s regt., and giving the names of the company officers and the 
number of men raised from the various towns ; also, Muster Master for Barn- 
stable Co. ; returns concerning men enlisted and mustered into the Continen 
tal Army and their equipment, made by said Otis, dated between Feb. 18, 1777, 
and Sept. 12, 1777 ; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representa 
tives, dated Jan. 24, 1778 ; said Otis chosen Naval Officer for the port of Barn- 
stable for the term of 1 year; appointment concurred in by Council Jan. 27, 
1778; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives for 
Muster Masters for various counties, dated Nov. 27, 1780; said Otis chosen 
Muster Master for Barnstable Co. ; appointment concurred in by Senate Nov. 

29, 1780.

OTT, PETER. Sergeant, Capt. Nicholas Crosby s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s regt.;

fies that said company was raised for expedition against St. Johns river, N. S., 
for the term of 6 months, and was in readiness to enter on said service until 
date of discharge, Sept. 4, 1777. Roll sworn to at Penobscot.

for March and April, 1779, dated Providence ; enlisted March 5, 1777 ; enlist 
ment, 3 years ; reported on command at " Updike N town." 

OWEN, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. John King s co., Col. Hopkins s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt. ; entered service July 15, 1776 ; discharged Aug. 4, 1776 ; service, 
20 days; mileage out and home (190 miles) allowed; company marched by 
order of Brig. Gen. Fellows ; also, Capt. John Spoor s co., Col. John Ashley s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt.; enlisted Sept. 19, 1777; discharged Oct. 19, 1777; ser 
vice, 31 days, at Stillwater; also, same co. and regt. ; enlisted Oct. 15, 1780; 
discharged Oct. 17, 1780; service, 4 days; company marched to the North 
ward by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows at the time Forts Ann and George were 
taken by the enemy. 

OWEN, PHILIP, Chelsea. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continen 
tal Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, re 
turned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 16, 1780; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, 
dark; engaged for town of Chelsea; marched to camp July 16, 1780, under 
command of Lieut. Zebulon King; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a re 
turn dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, Sergeant ; pay roll for 6 months 
men raised by the town of Chelsea for service in the Continental Army during 
1780 ; passed muster at Springfield July 16, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 18, 1780 ; 
service, 5 mos. 20 days, including 8 days travel to Springfield and 10 days travel 
home from place of discharge, West Point.

PACKARD, NATHAN. Lieutenant, Capt. Calvin Patridge s co. ; list of officers ap 
pointed to command the several companies of a regiment raised from Brig. Gen. 
Joseph Cushing s brigade and Brig. Gen. Otis s (Barnstable Co.) brigade, to be 
commanded by Col. John Gushing, Jr., and ordered to march to Rhode Island, 
as returned by Joseph Gushing to Maj. Gen. Warren, dated Hanover, Oct. 30, 
1776; company raised in Duxbury and Bridgewater; also, Lieutenant, Capt. 
Calvin Partridge s co., Col. John Cushing s regt. ; drafted Sept. 18, 1776; ser 
vice, 2 mos. 2 days ; company marched to Rhode Island ; also, Lieutenant, 
Capt. Joseph Keith s co., Col. Cotton s regt. ; service from Sept. 25, 1777, to 
Oct. 30, 1777, on a secret expedition to Tiverton, R. I. 

PACKARD, NATHAN. Captain, Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. ; engaged July 25, 
1778; discharged Sept. 9,1778; service, 1 mo. 16 days, at Rhode Island; roll 
sworn to at Plymouth; also, Captain, Col. John Jacobs s (Light Infantry) 
regt.; engaged Sept. 10, 1779; discharged Dec. 1 (also given Nov. 24), 1779; 
service, 2 mos. 21 (also given 2 mos. 17) days, at, Rhode Island ; also, Col. 
Jacobs s regt. ; engaged July 10, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 31, 1780 ; service, 
3 mos. 22 days, at Rhode Island ; regiment detached from militia to reinforce 
Continental Army for 3 months. 

PACKARD, NATHAN. Captain, 10th co., 3d Plymouth Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list 
of officers [year not given]. 

PACKARD, NATHANIEL, Bridgewater. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Daniel Lothrop s 
(Artillery) co., Col. John Bailey s regt. ; service from April 10, 1775, to May 
2, 1775, 3 weeks 2 days ; company raised agreeable to vote of Provincial Con 
gress, as ordered by Committee of Safety. 

PACKARD, NATHANIEL, Easton. Private, Capt. Abiel Mitchell s co. which marched 
probably on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 11 days ; also, Capt. Frederick 
Pope s co., Col. Paul Dudley Sargent s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; 
enlisted June 24, 1775; service, 1 mo. 10 days; also, company return [prob 
ably Oct., 1775] ; reported died Sept. 10, 1775. 

PACKARD, NATHANIEL. Lieutenant, Capt. Elijah Baker s co., Col. William Tur 
ner s regt.; marched July 10, 1781; discharged Dec. 1, 1781; service, 4 mos. 
23 days, at Rhode Island. 

PACKARD, NEHEMIAH, Bridgewater. Return of men raised to serve in the Conti 
nental Army from Capt. Josiah Packard s co., Col. Edward Mitchel s (3d 
Plymouth Co.) regt.; residence, Bridgewater; engaged for town of Bridge- 
water ; joined Capt. John Porter s co., Col. Wiglesworth s regt. ; term, during 
war ; also, list of men mustered between March 22, and March 27, 1777, by 
James Hatch, Muster Master for Plymouth Co. ; Col. Michael Jackson s 
regt. ; age, 16 yrs. ; enlisted by Capt. John Porter ; also, Drummer, Capt. 
Pilsbury s co., Col. Calvin Smith s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for 
service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, descriptive list dated West 
Point, Jan. 29, 1781; Capt. Pillsbury s co., 6th Mass. regt. commanded by 
Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, dark ; 
hair, dark; eyes, dark; rank, drummer; residence, Bridgewater; enlisted 
March 1, 1777, by Maj. John Porter ; enlistment, during war ; also, Capt. Ben 
jamin Pike s co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s regt. ; return for wages for the 
year 1782; wages allowed said Packard for 12 mos. ; also, 8th co., 6th Mass. 
regt. ; return [year not given, probably 1783], of men entitled to $80 gratuity, 
agreeable to act of Congress of May 15, 1778, for serving during the war. 

PACKARD, NEHEMIAH. Private, Capt. Joel Green s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt.; 
enlisted June 1, 1778; discharged Jan. 31, 1779; service, 8 mos. 8 days, at 
Peekskill and White Plains, including 8 days (160 miles) travel home; regi 
ment raised for 8 months.

PACKARD, NOAH. Private, Lieut. Joseph Warner s co. of Minute-men, which 
marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
7 days; reported enlisted into the army April 27, 1775; also, Capt. Abel 
Thayer s co., Col. John Fellows s regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent 
in money dated Dorchester Camp, Nov. 7, 1775 ; also, Private, Capt. Benjamin 
Bonney s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, 
etc., dated Chesterfield, March 13, 1777 ; 93 miles travel allowed said Packard ; 
company marched to Ticonderoga to reinforce Northern army ; also, Corporal, 
Capt. William Ward s (Plantation No. 5) co., (late) Col. Ezra May s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 22, 1777 ; service, 5 days ; company 
marched to Bennington on an alarm ; also, Capt. Christopher Banister s co., 
Col. Ezra May s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 20, 1777; discharged Oct. 14, 1777; ser 
vice, 29 days, on a secret expedition to Stillwater and Saratoga, including 
travel (100 miles) home. 

PACKARD, OLIVER, Bridgewater. Private, Capt. Josiah Hayden s co., Col. Bailey s 
regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service,

roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 3 mos., 1 week, 1 day; 
also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, muster roll for Sept. and Oct., 
1775, dated Camp at Roxbury ; also, 10th co., Plymouth Co. regt. ; list of men 
who performed tours of duty ; said Packard credited with 8 mos. service at 
Roxbury in 1775; also with 12 mos. Continental service.

from Western (Warren) and Oakham Sept. 24, 1777, to join army under Gen.

PACKER, OLIVER. Private, Capt. Thomas Vinson s co., Col. Garrish s (Gerrish s)

Suffolk and Essex counties. 

PACKERD, ABIEZER. Sergeant, Capt. Simeon Leach s co., Col. Benjamin Gill s 
regt. ; service, 2 days ; company marched from Stoughton to Braintree March 
21, 1776, when British ships lay in Boston harbor. Roll dated Stoughton. 

PACKERD, DANIEL, Bridgewater (also given Easton) . Descriptive list dated West 
Point, Jan. 25, 1781 ; Capt. Hayward s co., 2d Mass. regt. ; rank, Private ; 
age, 28 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 11 in.; complexion, dark; hair, dark; residence, 
Easton ; enlisted Jan. -, 1779, by Capt. Hayward, at West Point ; enlistment, 
during war.

died in July " last " and had not received a bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money.

the resignation be accepted.

gaged for town of Lincoln ; marched to camp July 15, 1780, under command 
of Capt. James Cooper; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and 
returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated 
Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, payroll for 6 months men belonging to 
the town of Lincoln raised for service in the Continental Army during 1780; 
marched to camp July 11, 1780; discharged Dec. 16, 1780; service, 5 mos. 15 
days, including travel (200 miles) home ; also, receipt dated Lincoln, June 1, 
1781, for bounty paid said Page by a class of the town of Lincoln to serve in 
the Continental Army for the term of 3 years; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by 
Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said county; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 
in.; complexion, light ; hair, light; eyes, gray; occupation, farmer (also given 
laborer) ; engaged for town of Lincoln ; engaged May 19, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

PAGE, JONATHAN, Southampton. List of men raised by the town of Southampton 
to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Capt. Lemuel Pomeroy and 
the Selectmen ; residence, Southampton ; engaged for town of Southampton ; 
joined Capt. Keith s co., Col. Jackson s regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, 
Capt. James Kieth s co., Col. Michael Jackson s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from May 15, 1777, to June 10, 1777 ; reported died June- 
10, 1777.

ton ; credited with 130 days allowance ; the Captain and 1st Lieutenant to 
march April 1, 1777, and the rest to march March 12, 1777 ; also, petition 
addressed to the General Court, dated Van Schaick s Island, Aug. 31, 1777, 
signed by said Page and others, officers of (late) Col. Francis s regt., asking 
that Lieut. Col. Littlefield be appointed Colonel of said regiment; also, peti 
tion addressed to the General Court, dated Camp above Stillwater, Sept. 15, 
1777, signed by officers of Col. Marshall s regt. and other regiments, request 
ing that clothing be furnished them to replace that lost on retreat from 
Ticonderoga ; also, order on the Board of War, dated Camp near Valley Forge, 
April 8, 1778, signed by said Page and others belonging to Col. Benjamin 
Tupper s regt., Brig. Gen. John Paterson s brigade, for clothing to replace 
that lost on retreat from Ticonderoga ; also, order on the Board of War, in 
favor of said Page, dated Danbury, Oct. 12, 1778, signed by himself and other 
officers of Col. Tupper s regt., for clothing due them as a donation from the 
State; also., Captain, Maj. William Lithgow s (3d) co., Col. Tupper s regt.; 
muster roll of field, staff, and commissioned officers for March, 1779, dated 
West Point; reported transferred to light infantry co. April 1, 1779; also 
reported as Captain of 9th co. ; also, Captain, Light Infantry co., Col. Tupper s 
regt. ; muster roll dated West Point, April 5, 1779 ; engaged Nov. 6, 1776 ; 
also, Captain, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (llth) regt. ; return for clothing, dated 
West Point, Aug. 10, 1779; also, Captain, llth Mass. regt. ; list of settlements 
of rank of Continental officers, dated West Point, made by a board held for 
the purpose and confirmed by Congress Sept. 6, 1779 ; commissioned Jan. 1, 1777.

also, Captain, Col. John Rand s regt.; engaged June 27, 1780; discharged

pany raised to join Col. John Jacobs s regt. and serve until April 1, 1780, unless 
sooner discharged, but formed into a separate corps for above service.

PAIN, JOHN, Dorchester. Private, Capt. John Spurr s co., Col. Thomas Nixon s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 1, 1777, to March 
1, 1779 ; credited to town of Dorchester ; reported deserted March 1 (also given 
March 2) , 1779 ; the following note is affixed to account, " Reinlisted declared 
so by Capt Chambers; " also, same co. and regt. ; return of men who were in 
camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently 
except on furlough, etc., certified at Camp near Peekskill, Feb. 16, 1779; also, 
enlistment agreement signed by said Pain and Michael McDonnell, engaging 
themselves to serve in the Continental Army during the war, unless sooner 
discharged; said Pain engaged April 6, 1780; also, certificate dated Boston, 
April 6, 1780, signed by Capt. Benjamin Heywood, certifying that said Pain 
had enlisted to serve during the war, but had not received State bounty, which 
was to be paid him upon said Heywood s arrival at camp ; order on certificate, 
signed by said Pain, for balance of bounty, payable to Lemuel Colbrough ; also, 
descriptive list of men mustered to serve in the Continental Army, as returned 
by Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, April 26, 
1780; Col. Nixon s regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; complexion, light ; 
occupation, farmer ; residence, Dorchester ; enlistment, during war ; mustered 
by Capt. Haywood; also, enlistment agreement dated Boston, April 26, 1780, 
signed by Lemuel Colbrough, engaging himself to serve in the Continental 
Army during the war, in the room of said Pain, of the 6th Mass. regt. com 
manded by Col. Thomas Nixon.

detached from Bristol Co. militia to serve for 6 days. Roll dated Norton.

PAIN, STEPHEN, Dorchester. Private, Capt. George Gould s co., Col. Paul D. Ser 
geant s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 24, 1775 ; service, 
2 mos. 13 days; also, Private, Capt. John Spurr s co., Col. Thomas Nixon s 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 1, 1777, to Feb. 1, 
1780 ; credited to town of Dorchester ; term, 3 years ; reported discharged Feb. 
1, 1780 ; also, same co. and regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or before 
Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, 
etc., certified at Camp near Peekskill, Feb. 16, 1779; also, Capt. Thomas 
Barnes s (Light Infantry) co., 6th Mass. regt. ; pay roll for June and July 
1779; reported transferred to Capt. Spurr s co. July 1, 1779; also, Capt. John 
Spurr s co., 6th Mass. regt. ; pay roll for June and July 1779 ; reported joined 
from light infantry co. July 1, 1779; also reported sick in hospital; also,. 
Capt. Spurr s co., Col. Nixon s (6th) regt. ; pay rolls for Aug. -Nov., 1779; re 
ported sick in general hospital Aug.-Oct., 1779; joined from general hospital 
in Nov., 1779; also, Capt. Spurr s co., 6th Mass, regt.; return for clothing 
delivered for the year 1780 ; receipt for said clothing, dated Peekskill, Dec. -, 
1779. 

PAIN, STEPHEN (also given STEPHEN, Jr.), Maiden. Private, Capt. Benjamin 
Blaney s co. of militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to 
Watertown by order of Col. Gardner; service, 1 day; also, Capt. Nailer 
Hatch s co., 37th regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. William Bond ; company 
return dated Maiden, Oct. 6, 1775; also, Private, in a company commanded by 
Capt. Benjamin Blaney, of Maiden; service, 3 days; company marched to 
Point Shirley June 13, 1776, by order of Gen. Lincoln. 

PAIN, STEPHEN, Partridgefield. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Capt. "William Fletcher s (Partridgefield) co. ; residence, Part 
ridgefield; engaged for town of Partridgefield; joined Capt. Watkins s co., 
Col. Brewer s regt. ; term, 3 years ; reported engaged to serve at Rhode Island ; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. A: Williams s co., Col. Ebenezer Sprout s regt.; Conti 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Sept. 20, 1778; 
reported discharged Sept. 20, 1778; also, Capt. Nathan Watkins s co., Col. 
Brewer s regt. ; return made agreeable to order of Council of Dec. 26, 1777 ; 
residence, Partridgefield ; engaged for town of Northampton ; mustered by 
State Muster Master; reported on furlough. 

PAIN, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. William Fletcher s co., Col. Simonds s regt.; 
enlisted Oct. 13, 1780; service, 6 days; company marched to Pawlet. 

PAIN, STEPHEN. Pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Pelham for ser 
vice in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp Aug. 7, 1780 ; 
discharged Feb. 7, 1781; service, 6 mos. 8 days, including travel (160 miles) 
home. 

PAIN, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Joseph Peirce s co., Col. Asa Barns s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt.; enlisted Oct. 28, 1781; service, 10 days; company marched by 
order o Gen. Fellows on an alarm at the Northward. 

PAIN, STEPHEN. Private, Capt. Japhet Daniels s co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith s 
(6th) regt. ; return for wages for the year 1782 ; wages allowed said Pain from 
Feb. 14, 1782, to March 20, 1782, 35 days ; reported deserted March 20, 1782. 

PAIN, STEPHEN. List of men returned by a committee for settling disputes between 
towns as to soldiers credited to them [year not given] ; said Pain claimed by 
Granby and Richmond ; allowed to Richmond.

PAIN, STEPHEN, Jr. Corporal, Capt. Edward Cobb s co., Col. Edward Mitchel s

PAIN, SYLVANUS, Cape Cod. Seaman, brigantine " Lively," Benjamin Dunham, 
Master ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to Aug. 11, 1780 ; age, 20 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in.; complexion, light; residence, Cape Cod. 

PAIN, SYLVANUS. Account dated [Harwich, Nov. 7, 1778], rendered by Capt, 
Abijah Bangs, for amounts due men who guarded prisoners from the [British] 
ship " Somerset " at Harwich, and thence to Yarmouth ; service, 2 days. 

PAIN, THOMAS, Bellingham. List of men drafted from militia to march to Horse 
Neck under command of Col. Mclntosh [year not given], but who failed to 
join regiment ; reported drafted from town of Bellingham ; drafted into Capt. 
Boyden s co. 

PAIN, THOMAS, Falmouth (also given Royalstown) . Return of men raised to serve 
in the Continental Army from Col. Peter Noyes s (1st Cumberland Co.) regt. ; 
residence, Falmouth (also given Royalstown) ; engaged for town of Falmouth 
(also given Stoughtonham) ; joined Capt. Lane s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; term, 
3 years; also, Private, Capt. Daniel Lane s co., Col. Brooks s regt.; Conti 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 7, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; 
reported as serving 9 mos. 24 days as Private, 25 mos. as Sergeant ; also, Ser 
geant, Capt. Daniel Lain s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; return dated Albany, Jan. 
14, 1778; mustered by County Muster Master Winslow and by a Continental 
Muster Master ; also, Capt. Lane s co., (late) Col. Ichabod Alden s (6th) regt.; 
return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not 
been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified at Cherry Valley, 
Feb. 24, 1778 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, 
dated Cherry Valley; engaged Feb. 7, 1777; also, Capt. Holden s co., Col. 
Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, 
to Feb. 1, 1780. 

PAIN, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Benjamin Lemont s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s 
regt.; enlisted June 26, 1779; discharged Sept. 24, 1779; service, 2 mos. 28 
(also given 2 mos. 29) days, at Penobscot. 

PAIN, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Amos Ellis s co.,4th Suffolk Co. regt. commanded

county, dated Dorchester ; also, list of men raised by the town of Boston to 
reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, returned as received 
of Maj. Stephen Badlam by Capt. Lieut. Thomas Jackson, of the artillery, 
at Boston, June 15, 1778, to be delivered to Brig. Warner, at Peekskill ; also, 
descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army, agreeable 
to resolve of April 20, 1778; Col. Hatch s regt. ; age, 28 (also given 38) yrs. ;

Crane s (3d Artillery) regt. ; muster roll for April, 1781, dated West Point.

Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, June 22, 1777; Capt. Webb s co., Col. 
Shepard s regt. ; also, Private, Capt. George Webb s co., Col. William Shep- 
pard s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 15, 1777, 
to Aug. 1, 1777 ; reported deceased ; also, same co. and regt. ; return [year not 
given]; residence, Wellfleet; enlisted for town of Wellfleet; mustered by 
Col. Joseph Otis, State Muster Master. 

PAINE, MILLER. Private, Capt. Thomas Hamilton s co. ; enlisted July 6, 1775; 
service to Dec. 31, 1775, 6 mos. 11 days; company stationed in Barnstable Co. 
for defence of seacoast. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 789 

PAINE, NATHAN. Descriptive return dated Boston, Jan. 9, 1781, made by Edward 
Procter, Colonel of Boston regt., of men who had enlisted to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months from the time of their arrival at 
place of rendezvous, unless sooner discharged, and who had received bounty 
and mileage due them of said Col. Procter ; Capt. Parkman s co. ; age, 26 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, brown. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Joseph Franklin s co., Col. Thomas Carpenter s 
regt. ; service, 8 days ; company marched from Rehoboth to Bristol on the 
alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 1776. Roll sworn to at Rehoboth. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. Corporal, Capt. Joseph Franklin s co., Col. Thomas Car 
penter s regt. ; service, 16 days; company marched from Rehoboth to Bristol 
on the alarm at Rhode Island of Dec. 8, 1776. Roll sworn to at Rehoboth. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Solomon Higgins s (Eastham) co. ; enlisted 
July 15, 1775; discharged Dec. 31, 1775; service, 6 mos. 1 day, in defence of 
seacoast ; also, Capt. Benjamin Godfrey s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt.; 
arrived at destination May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 10, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 
12 days, at Rhode Island, travel (12 days) included ; 108 miles reported as dis 
tance from Eastham to place of destination ; enlistment, 2 months ; roll dated 
Boston Neck, South Kingston. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. Sergeant, (late) Capt. George King s co., Col. Benjamin 
Simonds s detachment of Berkshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated Ticonder- 
oga, Feb. 25, 1777 ; enlisted Dec. 16, 1776 ; enlistment to expire March 15, 1777 ; 
also, Capt. Elijah Deming s co., Col. Ashley s (Berkshire Co.) regt. ; engaged 
Sept. 19, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 16, 1777 ; service, 28 days; company called out 
by Maj. Gen. Gates and ordered to march to Stillwater; also, 2d Lieutenant, 
Capt. Eliphaz Deming s (10th) co., 1st Berkshire Co. regt. of Mass, militia; 
list of officers [year not given]. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. List of men raised in Middlesex Co. for the term of 9 months 
from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 
1778, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. 
Putnam, July 20, 1778; engaged for town of Medford ; arrived at Fishkill 
June 21, 1778. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. Volunteer; entered service Feb. 1, 1780; service to April 16, 
1780, 2 mos. 14 days, at Machias, under Col. John Allan, Commander-in-chief, 
Eastern Indian department. 

PAINE, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Lieut. William Burbeck s co. ; enlisted Jan. 
7, 1780 ; service to Dec. 31, 1780, 11 mos. 25 days ; company raised for defence 
of Castle and Governor s Islands and commanded by His Excellency John 
Hancock. 

PAINE, PELEG, Rehoboth. Corporal, Capt. Nathaniel Carpenter s co., Col. John 
Hathaway s regt.; service from April 21, 1777, 23 days; company stationed 
at Tiverton, R. I.; also, Capt. Nathaniel Carpenter s co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s regt. ; service from May 13, 1777, to July 5, 1777, 1 mo. 25 days, including 
travel (3 days) on march home from Point Judith in North (also given South) 
Kingston, R. I., to Rehoboth ; also, Private, Capt. Israel Hix s co., Col. Josiah 
Whitney s regt.; enlisted July 30, 1778; discharged Sept. 10, 1778; service, 
1 mo. 13 days, on expedition to Rhode Island ; company raised in Bristol Co. ; 
also, Sergeant, Capt. Jabez Bullock s co.,Col. Thomas Carpenter s regt. ; en 
tered service July 27, 1780; discharged July 31, 1780; service, 5 days, at 
Tiverton, R. I., on an alarm ; company raised for 6 days service; also, same 
co. and regt. ; entered service Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9,1780; service, 
9 days; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of Aug. 1, 1780, 
and there served under Gen. Heith.

Paine claimed by Northampton and Partridgefield ; allowed to Partridgefield.

pany marched to Rhode Island on an alarm.

of men in camp at Cambridge, dated May 17, 1775.

George Wait Babcock ; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to at

to Massachusetts. [See John Hall Alford.] 

PALLIA, FRANCIS, Boston. Matross, Capt. Sargent s co., Col. John Crane s regt.;

Ilanin.] 

PALLISEAR, JAMES. Surgeon, brigantine "Tyrannicide," commanded by Capt. 
Allen Hallet; engaged Jan. 26, 1779; discharged April 30, 1779; service, 

3 mos. 5 days; also, payroll for same service dated Boston; also, brigantine 
" Tyrannicide," commanded by Capt. John Cathcart; engaged May 4, 1779 ; 
discharged June 23, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 19 days ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. ; 
also, same vessel and commander; engaged June 24, 1779; discharged Sept. 
6, 1779; service, 2 mos. 14 days; roll sworn to at Boston. 

PALLISEOR, JAMES. Communication dated Boston, Nov. 20, 1780, signed by Allen 
Hallet, Commander of the ship " Tartar," recommending said Palliseor for 
the position of Surgeon on board the " Tartar," and requesting that a warrant 
might be issued to him ; advised in Council Nov. 20, 1780, that a warrant be 
issued. 

PALLISSEOR, JAMES. Surgeon, brigantine " Tyrannicide ;" petition dated Boston, 
Sept. -, 1779, signed by said Pallisseor and others, asking compensation for 
losses sustained while serving on Penobscot expedition. 

PALLISSER, . Lieutenant Colonel ; general order dated Headquarters, Ticonder- 

oga, Oct. 19, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said 
Pallisser, acting as 2d Engineer, ordered to take direction of the defensive 
works to be established upon Mt. Independence.

Col. Moseley s regt. ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; hair, light ; engaged for

PALMER, ABNER. 1st Lieutenant, 3d co., 3d Worcester Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; 
list of officers; commissioned Sept. 29, 1778; also, petition dated Upton, Aug. 
24, 1779, signed by said Palmer and Daniel Boyden, stating that they had 
served as Lieutenants for some years past in 3d co., 3d Worcester Co. regt. 
"now Commanded by Col. Nathan Tyler," and asking that their resigna 
tions be accepted because new field officers had been appointed ; ordered in 
Council Aug. 27, 1779, that said resignations be accepted.

in Cap t. Samuel Briggs s co., Col. Cotten s regt., payable to Lieut. Solomon 
Young. 

PALMER, ASA. Private, Capt. David Whittier s co., in a regiment commanded by 
Maj. Benjamin Gage; service, 40 days; company marched Oct. 2, 1777, to 
join Northern army. 

PALMER, ASA. Private, Capt. James Mallon s co., Lieut. Col. Putnam s regt. ; en 
listed Aug. 24, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 4, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 22 days, including 
12 days (240 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Essex and Plymouth 
counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

PALMER, BENJAMIN, Upton. Receipt dated Worcester, June 4, 1782, for bounty 
paid said Palmer by Capt. Joseph Whipple, Chairman of Class No. 4 of the 
town of Grafton, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; 
also, descriptive list made up for the year 1782; Capt. Benjamin Heywood s 
co., 6th Mass. regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4.\ in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, 
dark ; occupation, yeoman ; birthplace, Upton ; residence, Upton ; engaged for 
town of Grafton; engaged May 27, 1782; term, 3 years; also, Private, Col. 
Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from May 27, 1782, 7 mos. 3 days ; 
also, Capt. Benjamin Heywood s (4th) co., Col. Benjamin Tupper s (6th) 
regt.; muster roll for Dec., 1782; reported joined from 10th Mass, regiment 
Dec. 17, 1782; also, Capt. Heywood s (4th) co., Col. Tupper s (6th) regt.;

24 mos. 27 days.

PALMER, DANIEL. Return of 3 and 6 months men raised in Hampshire Co. from

dated Hampshire Co., Oct. 26, 1780; Capt. Nathan Rowley s co. ; engaged for 
town of West Springfield ; term, 6 months ; also, descriptive list of men raised 
to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to re 
solve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by 
Maj. Peter Harwood, of 6th Mass, regt., at Springfield, July 2, 1780; age, 17 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of West Spring 
field ; arrived at Springfield June 28, 1780; marched to camp July 2, 1780, 
under command of Capt. Phineas Parker; also, payroll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of West Springfield for service in the Continental Army 
during 1780; marched June 28, 1780; discharged Dec. 3, 1780; service, 5 mos. 
11 days, including 5^ days (110 miles) travel home.

discharged Nov. 9, 1781; service, 2 mos. 29 days, under Col. Marinus Willet

raised for 3 months. 

PALMER, DAVID, Norwich. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, 
as returned by Capt. John Kirkland ; residence, Norwich ; engaged for town 
of Norwich ; engaged prior to May 17, 1777 ; joined Capt. Wheeler s co., Col. 
Nixon s regt. ; term, 3 years ; also, Private, Colonel s co., Col. Thomas Nixon s 
(6th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 15, 1777, to 
Oct. 5, 1777 ; reported deceased ; also, Capt. Adam Wheeler s co., Col. Nixon s

Soldier s Fortune, Feb. 15, 1779, and certified at Camp near Peekskill ; enlisted 
May 15, 1777 ; reported died Oct. 5, 1777.

19, 1775, from West Parish in Rowley to Cambridge ; returned home April 23,

PALMER, EDMUND, Springfield. Corporal, Capt. Nathan Rowlee s co., Lieut. Col. 
Timothy Robinson s detachment of Hampshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated 
Garrison at Ticonderoga, Feb. 25, 1777 ; enlistment to expire March 25, 1777 ; 
also, same co. and detachment ; entered service Dec. 25, 1776 ; service to April 
3, 1777, 99 days, at Ticonderoga; also, Sergeant, Capt. John Carpenter s co., 
Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ; arrived at camp July 5, 1778; discharged Jan. 
27, 1779; service, 7 mos. 10 days, at North river, N. Y., including 3 days to 
prepare for camp and 14 days (280 miles) travel out and home ; regiment 
raised for 8 months; also, order on Paymaster of Col. Wood s regt., payable

Palmer, Sergeant, for wages due for service in Capt. Carpenter s co., Col. 
Wood s regt. ; also, petition dated Boston, Sept. 18, 1782, signed by said 
Palmer, in behalf of himself and others, of Springfield, asking that he be 
commissioned as commander of the boat " Speedwell " (privateer) ; advised 
in Council Sept. 18, 1782, that a commission be issued.

of His Excellency John Hancock to serve for 40 days, unless sooner discharged.

at West Point, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; company raised in 
Plymouth Co. ; regiment raided to reinforce army under Gen. Washington for 
3 months.

to march to Horse Neck under command of Col. Benjamin Simonds [year 
not given], but who failed to join regiment; reported drafted from town of 
Pittsfield ; drafted into Capt. Selling s (Belding s) co. 

PALMER, JENKINS, Pembroke (also given Hanover and Springfield) . Private, 
Capt. Freedom Chamberlain s co., Gen. John Thomas s regt. ; muster roll 
dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 3, 1775; service, 3 mos. 6 days; also, com 
pany return dated Roxbury Camp, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or 
its equivalent in money dated Roxbury Camp, Nov. 9, 1775; also, list of men 
raised to serve in the Continental Army from 1st, 2d, 3d, and 8th cos., 1st 
Hampshire Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Walter Pynchon and Capt. David 
Burt; residence, Springfield; engaged for town of Springfield; joined Capt. 
Satterlee s co., Col. Moses Hazen s regt. ; term, during war; reported as be 
longing to 1st co. ; also, Private, Capt. Munson s co., Col. Hazen s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from April 12, 1779, to Dec. 31, 
1779; also, Capt. Noah Nichols s co. of Artillery artificers, Gen. Knox s 
(Artillery) brigade ; return of men who were in camp before Aug. -, 1777, and 
who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, and who were 
thereby entitled to gratuities; also, return certified at Camp Peekskill, Nov.

Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; residence, Hanover.

3 years.

turned by Noah Goodman, Superintendent for Hampshire Co. [year not given] ; 
Capt. Webber s co., Col. Chapen s regt.; residence, Worthington; engaged

term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve 
of April 20, 1778, returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, 
by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; arrived at Fishkill June 16, 1778. 

PALMER, JOHN. Private, Capt. Isaac Sherman s co., Col. Loammi Baldwin s (26th) 
regt.; return for advance pay for Jan., 1776, etc.; also, same co. and regt.; 
pay abstracts for Feb. and March, 1776; also, (late) Capt. Sherman s co., Col.

Camp at New York ; also, list of men belonging to (late) Capt. Sherman s co., 
26th regt., who were enlisted by the several officers of said company, as 
returned by Lieut. Caleb Robinson, dated New York, July 5, 1776. 

PALMER, JOHN. Petition dated Boston, June 21, 1777, signed by Isaac Sears, owner 
of the sloop " Betsey," bound on voyage to South Carolina and Holland, ask 
ing that said Palmer be commissioned as commander of said sloop; ordered 
in Council June 21, 1777, that a commission be issued.

PALMER, JOHN. Copy of a company receipt, given to Capt. Caleb Kimball, for wages- 
for 4 mos. 20 days service in his company at Winter Hill [year not given, 
probably 1777 and 1778]. 

PALMER, JOHN. Private, Capt. Joseph Fuller s (2d Newton) co., Col. Thatcher s, 
regt. ; entered camp Sept. 2, 1778; discharged Sept. 4, 1778; service, 3 days; 
company marched to Cambridge to guard British troops. 

PALMER, JOHN. Capt. Abram Washburn s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 24, 1778; discharged Dec. 21, 1778; service, 1 mo. 28 days, at and 
about Boston ; term, 6 months, to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

PALMER, JOHN. Petition dated Boston, June 26, 1779, signed by William Erskine, 
in behalf of himself and others, of Boston, asking that said Palmer be com 
missioned as commander of the sloop " Charming Polly " (privateer) ; ordered 
in Council June 26, 1779, that a commission be issued. 

PALMER, JOHN. Descriptive list of men raised in Plymouth Co. in 1779 to serve 
in the Continental Army ; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; 
engaged for town of Halifax; delivered to Ensign J. Hubble; also, Private, 
Col. Wesson s (9th) regt.; entered service July 24, 1779; discharged April 
24, 1780; term, 9 months; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5,, 
1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 11, 1780 ; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complex 
ion, light ; engaged for town of Halifax ; arrived at Springfield July 10, 1780 ; 
marched to camp July 11, 1780, under command of Ensign Bancroft. 

PALMER, JOHN. Seaman, ship " Alfred," commanded by Capt. John Paul Jones ; 
list of officers and men entitled to prize shares in the ship " Hellish " and 
brig " Active " [year not given]. 

PALMER, JOHN. List of prisoners to be returned in exchange for British prisoners 
sent to New York in the cartel " Favorite," as returned by Robert Pierpont, 
Commissary of Prisoners [year not given]; said Palmer, Captain, to be 
exchanged for Ralph Monkhouse, Captain.

Cambridge, June 10, 1775 ; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated 
Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 27, 1775; service, 3 mos. 11 days; also, company 
return dated Winter Hill, Sept. 30, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or its

dipt. James Rusel s (Russell s) co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. ; service, 5 
days ; company marched to Dorchester March 4, 1776, to reinforce the army. 

PALMER, JOS A. List of prisoners sent from New York in the cartel " Rising 
Empire," as returned by Commissary Godfrey [year not given] ; reported as 
belonging to Connecticut and as employed in the " Oliver Cromwell," of 
Connecticut. 

PALMER, JOSEPH, Boston. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Col. John Cushing s (2d Plymouth Co.) regt., as returned agreeable to 
order of Council of Nov. 7, 1777 ; residence, Boston ; engaged for town of 
Scituate ; joined Capt. Allen s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; term, 3 years. 

PALMER, JOSEPH, Cambridge. Private, Capt. Samuel Thatcher s co. of militia, 
Col. Gardner s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
3 days; also, Capt. Abner Crafts s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (37th) 
regt.; company return dated Cambridge, Oct. 7, 1775; also, order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge Camp, Nov. 13, 1775. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 803 

PALMER, JOSEPH (also given JOSEPH, Jr.), Falmouth, Barnstable Co. Captain of 
a company of militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 
3 days ; also, Captain of a Falmouth co., Col. Joseph Otis s (1st Barnstable 
Co.) regt. ; list of officers of militia returned as sworn by officers appointed 
for that purpose, dated Sept. 29, 1775; also, Captain, 5th (1st Falmouth) co., 
1st Barnstable Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen by said com 
pany, dated Falmouth, March 25, 1776; ordered in Council April 5, 1776, that 
said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned April 5, 1776 ; also, 
Captain of a company raised in Sandwich, Yarmouth, and Falmouth ; list 
dated Barnstable, of officers and men raised from Barnstable Co. brigade to 
serve at Rhode Island, as returned by Brig. Joseph Otis to Maj. Gen. Warren ; 
also, Captain, Col. John Cushing s regt. ; marched Sept. 26, 1776 ; service, 1 mo. 
27 days, at Rhode Island ; roll dated Newport ; also, return dated Barnstable, 
May 19, 1777, signed by Joseph Otis, stating that 105 men had been detached 
from his brigade and had marched with the exception of 18, the proportion 
of the town of Barnstable ; said Palmer appears as Captain of a company 
made up of 37 of said men ; also, Captain, Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; arrived 
at camp May 13, 1777; discharged July 11, 1777; service, 2 mos. 7 days, at 
Rhode Island, including 9 days (180 miles) travel to and from camp ; company 
raised for 2 months; roll dated Camp at South Kingston ; also, Captain, Col. 
Freeman s regt. ; service, 8 days, on alarms at Dartmouth and Falmouth in 
Sept., 1778; also, same regt.; service, 8 days; company marched on alarms 
at Falmouth Feb. 4, April 2, and May 16, 1779; also, Captain of a company 
stationed at Falmouth ; engaged April 2, 1779; discharged Nov. 16, 1779; ser 
vice, 7 mos. 15 days. 

PALMER, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Fortunatus Eager s co., Lieut. Col. Ephraim 
Sawyer s regt.; marched Oct. 2, 1777; discharged Oct. 18, 1777; service, 25 
days, including 8 days (160 miles) travel home; company marched to rein 
force Northern army. 

PALMER, JOSEPH. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Feb. 2, 1776, said Palmer chosen Colonel, 5th Suffolk Co. regt. of Mass, 
militia ; appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 7, 1776 ; reported commis 
sioned Feb. 7, 1776; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Repre 
sentatives, dated May 9, 1776, said Palmer chosen Brigadier for the county of 
Suffolk in the room of Benjamin Lincoln; appointment concurred in by 
Council May 9, 1776; reported commissioned May 9, 1776; also, Council war 
rant dated Aug. 21, 1777, for 100 drawn in favor of said Palmer and John 
Taylor, Esq., " a Committee to repair to Bennington in the Grants to obtain 
the most authentic Intelligence of the Cercumstan[ces] of the American 
Forces;" also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Sept. 19, 1777 ; said Palmer chosen Brigadier in the room of Brig. Dan- 
ielson, resigned, to command the forces on the secret expedition for which 
provision was made by resolve of Sept. 17, 1777 ; appointment concurred in by 
Council Sept. 19, 1777; also, copy of a letter of instructions, dated Council 
Chamber, Sept. 22, 1777, directing said Palmer to proceed to Tiverton, R. I., 
arriving there by Oct. 1, 1777, and take com mand of the brigade composed of 
the two regiments made up of men detached from militia of Plymouth and 
Bristol counties, and act under orders from Maj. Gen. Spencer or other superior 
officers; also, Council order notifying said Palmer, Brigadier General, with 
Brig. Gen. Lovell, to attend a Court of Inquiry appointed by Massachusetts, 
Connecticut, and Rhode Island, at Providence, Nov. 12, 1777, in order to give 
such information as they might posse.ss respecting the failure of the late 
intended expedition against Rhode Island.

ceived of Noah Goodman, Superintendent for Hampshire Co., by Justin Ely,

PALMER, ZADOK. Private, Capt. John Carpenter s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt.; 
arrived at camp Aug. 17, 1778 ; discharged Feb. 2, 1779 ; service, 6 mos. 3 days,

Lieut. Potter, payable to Lieut. Winchil, dated Westfield, March 22, 1779, 
signed by said Palmer, for wages due subsequent to Oct. 1 [1778]. 

PALMER, ZURISHADDAI, Middleborough. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Wood s (1st 
Middleborough) co. of militia, which marched in response to the alarm of 
April 19, 1775, to Marshfield ; service, 2 days ; also, Capt. Joshua White s co., 
Col. John Cushing s regt. ; drafted Sept. 20, 1776; service, 60 days, at Rhode 
Island ; roll dated Newport ; also, Capt. Nehemiah Allen s co., Col. Theophilus 
Cotten s regt. ; service, 31 days, on a secret expedition to Rhode Island in 
Sept. and Oct., 1777 ; also, Capt. Nathaniel Wood s co., Col. Ebenezer Sprout s 
regt.; enlisted Sept. 6, 1778; discharged Sept. 12, 1778; service, 6 days; com 
pany marched on two alarms at Dartmouth, one in May and one in Sept., 1778. 



810 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

PALMERTEB, DANIEL. Private, Capt. John Spoor s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berk 
shire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Oct. 15, 1780; discharged Oct. 17, 1780; service, 
4 days ; company marched to the Northward by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows 
on an alarm at the time Forts George and Ann were taken by the enemy. 

PALMERTBOT, JOHN. Descriptive list of deserters from 13th Mass. regt. commanded 
by Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith, endorsed "July 13th 1780;" Capt. Pilsbury s 
co.; age, 28 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; complexion, light; hair, light; occu 
pation, yeoman ; deserted April -, 1777. 

PALMES, FRANCIS. Boy, Continental frigate "Deane," commanded by Capt. 
Samuel Nicholson ; engaged Nov. 7, 1781 ; service to May 31, 1782, 6 mos. 24 
days; term, 12 months. 

PALMES, RICHARD. Petition dated July 5, 1780, signed by said Palmes, Captain 
of Marines, frigate "Boston," of the Continental navy, stating that he had 
been taken prisoner by the enemy at the time of the capture of Charleston, 
S. C., May 12, 1780, and had been placed upon parole not to engage in the war 
until exchanged for a British prisoner of equal rank, and as Hector McNeil, 
Captain of Marines of the British ship " Somerset," cast away near Cape Cod, 
was under a similar parole, requesting that he might be certified to be ex 
changed for said McNeil ; ordered in Council July 5, 1780, that Joseph 
Henderson, late Commissary of Prisoners, be directed to carry out the ex 
change as requested; also, Captain of Marines, Continental frigate " Deane," 
commanded by Capt. Samuel Nicholson ; engaged May 1, 1781 ; service to May 
31, 1782, 13 mos. 

PALMES, SAMUEL. Midshipman, Continental frigate "Deane," commanded by 
Capt. Samuel Nicholson ; engaged May 12, 1781; service to May 31, 1782, 12 
mos. 19 days ; term, 12 months. 

PALMETER, EBENEZER, Sheffield. Capt. William Bacon s co., Col. Fellows s regt. ; 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dorchester, Dec. 19, 
1775; also, list of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, by 
Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. Ginkins s co. ; 
term, 3 years or during war; reported received State bounty; also, Private, 
Capt. Sewall s co., Col. Sprout s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for 
service from Jan. 1, 1777, to April 1, 1779; reported deserted April 1, 1779; 
also, Capt. Josiah Jenkins s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; return certified 
at Camp near Valley Forge, Jan. 23, 1778; residence, Sheffield; enlisted for 
town of Sheffield ; mustered by Capt. Wheelar ; reported sick and absent. 

PALMETER, URIAH. Private, Capt. John King s co., Col. Hopkins s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt.; entered service July 15, 1776; discharged Aug. 4, 1776; service, 
20 days ; travel (95 miles) out and home allowed ; company marched by order 
of Brig. Gen. Fellows; also, list of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and 
June 1, 1778, by Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. 
Stone s co.; term, 3 years or during war; reported received State bounty; 
also, Capt. John Pray s co., Col. Joseph Vose s (1st) regt.; muster roll for 
Aug., 1781; enlistment, during war; also, list dated Boston, Jan. 28, 1803, 
returned by John Avery, Secretary, and J. Jackson, Treasurer, of men who 
had enlisted into the Continental Army and actually served 3 years and were 
accordingly entitled to gratuities under resolves of March 4, 1801, and June 
19, 1801 ; 1st Mass. regt. ; reported as belonging to state of New York. 

PALMITER, EBENEZER, Sheffield. Private, Capt. John Holms s co. of Minute-men, 
Col. John Fellows s regt., which marched April 21, 1775, in response to the 
alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 17 days ; also, return of men raised for Conti 
nental service probably from Capt. Spoor s co., Col. Ashley s regt. [year not 
given]; residence, Sheffield; engaged for town of Sheffield; joined Capt. 
Warren s co., Col. Bailey s regt. ; term, 3 years.

PALPHREY, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Archibald McAllster s co., Col. Prime s

PALPHRY, WILLIAM. Private, Capt. Nicholas Crosby s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s

certificate on roll certifies that said company was raised for expedition against 
St. John s River, N. S., for the term of 6 months and was in readiness to enter 
on said service until date of discharge, Sept. 4, 1777 ; said Palphry actually 
served at Machias until Sept. 26, 1777. Roll sworn to at Penobscot.

per s regt.; return dated Jan. 25, 1778; engaged for town of Newburyport;

of Gen. Stark and Col. Warner, and was dismissed by Gen. Lincoln after pro 
ceeding 90 miles ; roll sworn to in Worcester Co. ; also, Capt. William Thurlo s 
co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; service from July 30, 1778, to Sept. 13, 1778, 
1 mo. 15 days, at Rhode Island.

PARDEE, AARON. Recommendation dated West Point, Oct. 17, 1781, signed by 
Col. John Crane, stating that said Pardee had a desire to join the army in a 
more active station than that in which he had been employed since the com 
mencement of the war, and being of good character, and there being a num 
ber of vacancies in said Crane s (Artillery) regt., recommending him for the 
position of 2d Lieutenant ; advised in Council Nov. 27, 1781, that a warrant be 
made out agreeable to above recommendation.

men, of bounties paid said Pardise and others raised by the town of Pembroke 
to serve in the Continental Army for 3 years or during the war, agreeable to 
resolve of Dec. 2, 1780.

in Capt. Nutting s co., Col. Prescott s regt., " the Last Summer."

PARK, AARON, Sutton. Private, Capt. Abijah Burbank s co., Col. Jonathan Hol- 
mari s regt. ; service, 41 days; company marched from Sutton to Providence, 
R. I., Dec. 10, 1776, on an alarm ; also, Capt. John Blanchard s co., Col. James 
Wesson s regt. ; return [year not given] ; residence, Sutton ; enlistment, 
8 months; reported died Aug. 29 [year not given]. 

PARK, ANDREW, Harvard. Private, Capt. James Burt sco., Col. Asa Whitcomb s 
regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 26, 1775; service, 2 mos. 
16 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]; reported died July 6, 
1775 ; also, certificate dated Harvard, March 24, 1776, signed by the Selectmen, 
certifying that said Park, a minor, late of Harvard, deceased July 6, 1775, son 
of Jane Park, a widow, was a soldier in Capt. James Burt s co., Col. Asa 
Whitcomb s regt., and had never received a bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money; also, order on Committee of Clothing at Watertown, dated Harvard, 
March 24, 1776, signed by Jane Park, for money in lieu of a bounty coat due 
her son, said Andrew Park, deceased, a soldier in Capt. James Burt s co. 

PARK, CALEB. Private, Capt. Abijah Burbank s co., Col. Jonathan Holman s regt. ; 
service, 41 days ; company marched from Sutton to Providence, R. I., Dec. 10, 
1776, on an alarm; also, Capt. Bartholomew Woodbury s co., Col. Job Cush- 
ing s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 13, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 
27 days, including 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; company marched from 
Worcester Co. Aug. 16, 1777, to reinforce Northern army; also, Capt. Abijah 
Burbank s co., Col. Jacob Davis s regt. ; marched to camp July 30, 1780; dis 
charged Aug. 7, 1780; service, 12 days, on an alarm at Rhode Island, includ 
ing 3i days (75 miles) travel home.

wages, etc., for service in " the last campaign." 

PARK, CORNELIUS, Watertown. Private, Capt. Abner Crafts s co., Lieut. Col.

Nov. 13, 1775. 

PARK, DAVID, Groton. Private, Capt. Nathan Peters s co., Col. Timothy Daniel-

account of losses sustained April 19, 1775. 

PARK, GIDEON, Newton. Private, Capt. Amariah Fuller s co., which marched on

PARK, JACOB. Sergeant, Capt. Jeremiah Hickok s co., Lieut. Col. Sears s regt.;

including 4 days (84 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Berkshire Co. to 
serve for 3 months. Roll endorsed " Col Elisha Porter s Reg t." 

PARK, JAMES. Corporal, Capt. Thomas Mellen s co., Col. Abner Perry s regt.;

PARK, JEREMIAH. Private, Capt. Daniel Winchester s co., Col. Ruggles Wood- 
bridge s regt.; enlisted Aug. 17, 1777; discharged Nov. 29, 1777; service, 3 
mos. 13 days, with Northern army. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 825 

PARK, JOHN, Fitchburg. Private, Capt. "William Thurlo s co. ; travel out and 
home 180 miles; service at 20 miles per day, 9 days; company marched on an 
alarm at Bennington Aug. 22, 1777, under command of Maj. Ebenezer Bridge, 
by order of Gen. Stark and Col. Warner, and was dismissed by Gen. Lincoln 
after proceeding 90 miles; also, list of men mustered; said Park appears 
among men raised from Col. Sterns s regt. for the term of 9 months; Capt. 
Thurlo s co. ; engaged for town of Fitchburg ; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Worcester Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival 
at Fishkill ; Capt. Thurlow s co., Col. Sterns s regt. ; age, 36 yrs. ; stature, 5 
ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark ; residence, Fitchburg ; arrived at Fishkill June 
20, 1778 ; also, list of men returned as mustered by Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy 
Muster Master, dated Fishkill, Aug. 1, 1778. 

PARK, JOHN, Groton. Private, Capt. John Minot s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt. ; arrived at destination May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 9, 1777 ; service, 
2 mos. 9 days, at Rhode Island, including travel (8 days) to and from place of 
destination. Roll dated Warwick Neck. 

PARK, JOHN, Newton. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co. to rein

Putnam, July 20, 1778; arrived at Fishkill June 21, 1778; also, Private, Capt. 
Christopher Marshall s co., Col. Thomas Marshall s regt. ; muster rolls for 
Jan. and March, 1779, dated West Point; enlisted June 21, 1778; discharged 
March 21, 1779; enlistment, 9 months; also, list of 6 months men raised 
agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph 
Hosmer, Superintendent for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner,

nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 21, 1780; age, 21 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 10 in.; complexion, 
light; engaged for town of Newton; marched to camp July 21, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Isaac Pope; also, Private; pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Newton for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched to camp July 17, 1780; discharged Jan. 20, 1781; service, 6 
mos. 15 days, including travel (220 miles) home. 

PARK, JOHN. Private, in a detachment from Col. Ezekiel Hearick s co., Col. John

PARK, JOHN. Private, Capt. Abraham Peirce s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. of

years, to expire Feb. -, 1780. 

PARK, JOHN. Corporal, Capt. Walter McFarland s co., Col. Cyprian Howe s regt. ;

to Jan. 6 [year not given]; also, communication addressed to Capt. Ford,

he had sent forward said Parker and others to serve for the town of Stoneham. 

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. Joseph Parker s co., Col. Ebenezer Sproat s 
(Sprout s) regt.; enlisted Jan. 9, 1778; company stationed at Rhode Island 
for 3 months from Jan. 1, 1778. 

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. John Putnam s co. ; company detached from Col. 
Holman s regt. for 21 days service at Providence, R. I. ; roll dated June 22, 
1778; also, Capt. John Putnam s co., Col. Wade s regt.; enlisted June 20, 
1778 ; service, 26 days ; company marched from Worcester Co. June 20, 1778, 
to join army under Gen. Sullivan at Providence for 21 days service ; roll dated 
Sutton. 

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. Amos Perry s co., Col. Haws s regt.; entered 
service July 28, 1778; discharged Sept. 12, 1778; service, 1 mo. 17 days, at 
Rhode Island. 

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. Edward Richardson s co., Col. Thomas Poor s 
regt. ; enlisted July 11, 1778, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Feb. 24, 
1779; service, 7 mos. 25 days, at North river, N. Y., including 12 days (240 
miles) travel home ; roll dated Watertown ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll 
for Sept., 1778, dated West Point ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Nov.,

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. Nathan Sergant s co. of guards ; enlisted March

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. Caleb Champney s co., Maj. Nathaniel Heath s 
detachment of guards; enlisted June 14, 1779; discharged June 17, 1779; ser 
vice, 4 days, at and about Boston. 

PARKER, AARON. Private, Capt. Samuel Hamant s co., Col. Samuel Denny s (2d) 
regt. ; enlisted Oct. 22. 1779 ; discharged Nov. 23, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 11 days, 
at Claverack, including 9 days (180 miles) travel home; regiment raised to 
reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

3 months.

York Hutts; reported on commissary guard in Oct. and Nov., 1781.

PARKER, BENJAMIN, Andover. Lieutenant, Col. James "Wesson s regt. ; Conti 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1780;

Capt. Joseph PettingilFs co., Col. Wesson s regt. ; company return [year not 
given] ; residence, Andover; also, Col. Wesson s (9th) regt. ; return of officers, 
dated West Point, Sept. 12, 1779; also, Lieutenant, same regt. ; return of offi 
cers for clothing, dated Boston, Sept. 25, 1779; also, recommendation dated 
Brookline, April 19, 1780, signed by Col. J. Wesson, recommending certain 
officers to fill vacancies in 9th Mass, regt., and requesting that warrants he 
granted them ; said Parker recommended for a Lieutenancy to date from Oct. 
27, 1777; reported as having previously received a commission, but it having 
been wrongly dated, a warrant is requested as above ; ordered in Council May 
3, 1780, that warrants be granted said officers ; also, Lieutenant, Col. Wesson s 
regt. ; return of commissioned officers, dated Orangetown, Oct. 7, 1780. 

PARKER, BENJAMIN, Chelmsford. Private, Capt. Oliver Barren s co. of militia, 
Col. David Green s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 3 days.

nental Army pay accounts for service from March 25, 1777, to Sept. 26, 1778 ;
