Colonel Commandant, certifies that said Parker returned from desertion Feb. 
4, 1782 [ ?], and was in service in 5th Mass. regt. ; also, muster roll for Jan.- 
Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island and sworn to in Camp at Stillwater; 
enlisted March 25, 1777 ; reported on command with Col. Morgan ; also, muster 
roll for Nov., 1777, sworn to at Camp near the Gulf ; also, return dated Feb. 2, 
1778; mustered by Middlesex Co. Muster Master; also, muster rolls for Dec.. 
1777-May, 1778, dated Camp Valley Forge ; reported on command in Clothier 
General s guard in April, 1778; also, muster roll for June, 1778, dated Camp 
Greenwich ; reported on quarter guard ; also, muster rolls for July-Sept., 1778, 
dated Camp Providence ; reported deserted Sept. 26, 1778.

regt. ; return dated Oct. 31, 1776 ; said Parker reported as in camp fit for duty ; 
also, same co. and regt.; enlisted Sept. 27, 1776; discharged Nov. 11, 1776; 
service, 1 mo. 26 days, including 11 days (225 miles) travel home.

ner, Treasurer, payable to John Hayes, dated North Yarmouth, Oct. 16, 1775,

that a warrant was drawn for full amount of wages due him ; said memoran 
dum having originally been attached to a certificate which now appears to be 
missing; also, Council warrant for 41 13s 3d drawn in favor of said Parker, 
Captain, Col. Crane s regt., in full of the benefits under resolve of Feb. 6, 
1780 [79]. 

PARKER, DANIEL. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to 
resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said 
county; age, 29 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 11| in.; complexion, dark; hair, dark; 
eyes, dark ; occupation, saddletree maker ; engaged for town of Maiden ; 
engaged April 11, 1781 ; term, 3 years. 

PARKER, DANIEL. Private, Capt. Levi Brown s co., of Adams, Col. Asa Barnes s 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Oct. 30, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 7, 1781 ; 
service, 9 days ; company detached on the alarm of Oct. 30, 1781 j and joined 
army under Gen. Stark at Saratoga.

PARKER, DAVID, Harvard (also given Westford). Private, Capt. Samuel Hill s 
co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 19, 1777; service to Aug. 26,

days, under Lieut. Col. Ephraim Sawyer with Northern army; company 
marched from Harvard on a 30 days expedition ; also, return of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Samuel Hill s co. ; residence, Har 
vard; engaged for town of Harvard; joined Capt. Munroe s co., Col. Bige-

PARKER, DAVID, Lynn. Captain, 1st Lynn co., which marched probably on the

PARKER, DAVID, Menotomy. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Con 
tinental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, Aug. 16, 1780; age, 20 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, 
ruddy; engaged for town of Weston ; arrived at Springfield Aug. 14, 1780; 
marched to camp Aug. 16, 1780, under command of Capt. Burbank ; also, list 
of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson 
as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, 
pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Weston for service in the 
Continental Army during 1780; marched Aug. 9, 1780; discharged Feb. 19, 
1781 ; service, 6 mos. 10 days, travel (200 miles) included. 

PARKER, DAVID, Methuen. Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., Col. Titcomb s 
regt. ; arrived at place of rendezvous April 27, 1777 ; discharged June 27, 1777 ; 
service, 2 mos. 10 days, including travel (171 miles) to place of rendezvous and 
from place of discharge home; company raised to serve for 2 months from 
time of arrival at Providence, R. I. Roll dated Bristol. [See David Barker.]

PARKER, ELIHU, Lanesborough. Private, Capt. David Wheeler s co., Col. John 
Brown s detachment of militia; entered service June 30, 1777; discharged 
July 21, 1777 ; service, 22 days ; detachment stationed at Fort Ann ; also, 
Capt. Daniel Brown s co. ; service, 6 days ; company marched from Lanes- 
borough to Meloomscuyck Aug. 14, 1777, on an alarm ; certificate on reverse 
of roll certifies that Capt. Brown and company were in service 27 days and 
were then dismissed by Col. Benjamin Simonds; also, Capt. Daniel Brown s 
co. ; service, 27 days ; company marched from Lanesborough to Pawlet Sept. 
5, 1777, on an alarm ; also, list of men raised in Berkshire Co. to serve in the 
Continental Army for the term of 9 months, as returned by Truman Wheler, 
Muster Master, dated Great Barrington, June 5, 1778; also, descriptive list of 
men raised in Berkshire Co. for the term of 9 months from the time of their 
arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778; Capt. Brown s co., 
Col. Diamond s regt.; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, dark; 
residence, Lanesborough ; arrived at Fishkill June 7, 1778 ; also, list of men 
returned as received of Jonathan Warner. Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, 
July 20, 1778; engaged for town of Lanesborough ; also, list of men returned 
as mustered by Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy Muster Master, dated Fishkill, 
Aug. 1, 1778. 

PARKER, ELIJAH, Belchertown. Private, Capt. Joshua Parker s co., Col. Nathaniel 
Wade s regt.; enlisted June 22, 1778; service at Rhode Island; also, Capt. 
Samuel Lamb s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s regt. ; enlisted June 22, 1778; ser 
vice to Jan. 1, 1779, 6 mos. 13 days, at Rhode Island, including travel from 
camp home ; enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 1779 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster 
roll dated Warwick, Nov. 7, 1778 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls dated 
East Greenwich, Sept. 17, Sept. 22, Nov. 14, and Dec. 30, 1778.

of Belchertown; arrived at Springfield July 4, 1780; marched to camp July 
5, 1780, under command of Capt. Frothingham, of the artillery; also, list of

PARKER, ELIJAH, continued. 

men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson 
as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; 
also, pay roll for 6 months men detached from militia of the town of Belcher- 
town for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched from home 
July 4, 1780; discharged Oct. 26, 1780; service, 3 mos. 30 days, including 
8 days (150 miles) travel home; also, certificate dated Belchertown, Oct. 
5, 1781, signed by Elijah Parker, certifying that his son, said Elijah Parker, 
had been hired by Calvin Kinsley, on behalf of a class of the town of Belcher- 
town, to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years, and had 
received bounty ; engaged April 6, 1781 ; also, descriptive list of men raised

Goodman, Superintendent; age, 18 (also given 19) yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.;

shire Co.) regt. ; discharged Aug. 19, 1777 ; service, 5 days ; company ordered 
out on an alarm at Bennington Aug. 17, 1777. 

PARKER, ELIJAH. Private, Capt. Jonathan Bard well s co., Col. Elisha Porter s

PARKER, ELIJAH. Corporal, Capt. Joseph Norton s (Freetown) co., Col. John 
Hathaway s regt. ; entered service Aug. 2, 1780 ; discharged Aug. 7, 1780 ;

and Aug. 2, 1780. 

PARKER, " ELINES." Private, Capt. William Wells s detachment of militia, 3d 
Berkshire Co. regt.; entered service Oct. 30, 1781; discharged Nov. 7, 1781; 
service, 8 days, on the alarm at Saratoga of Oct. 29, 1781. [See Linus Parker.] 

PARKER, ELIPHALET. Private, Capt. John Evans s co. ; enlisted Sept. 16, 1781 ; 
discharged Dec. 3, 1781 ; service, 2 mos. 20 days ; company raised for 3 months 
and stationed at Androscoggin river to guard frontiers. 

PARKER, ELISHA, Dartmouth. Private, Capt. Daniel Egery s co. of Minute-men, 
which marched April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 5 days; also, list of men who marched from Dartmouth to camp under 
command of Capt. Benjamin Dillingham and arrived there Feb. 15, 1776. 

PARKER, ELISHA, Methuen. Pay roll of certain men belonging to Methuen that 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, but did not serve under any particular 
commanding officer, as returned by Capt. James Mallon ; service, 3 days ; 
also, Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., Col. Titcomb s regt.; arrived at 
place of rendezvous April 27, 1777 ; discharged June 27, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 
10 days, including travel (171 miles) to place of rendezvous and from place of 
discharge home ; company raised to serve for 2 months from time of arrival at 
Providence, R. I. ; roll dated Bristol. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 853 

PARKER, ELISHA, Newton. Private, Capt. Phineas Cook s co., which marched on 
the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge, under command 
of Capt. Lieut. John Marean ; service, 4 days ; also, list of men detached from 
Newton militia to serve as guards, as returned by Capt. Edward Fuller [year 
not given] ; also, Private ; pay roll of a company which marched Dec. 9, 1776, 
under command of 1st Lieut. Joseph Crafts to join Col. Crafts s regt. at Boston ; 
service, 5 days; also, Capt. Stephen Dana s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; 
arrived at destination May 9, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 7 days, including travel (6 
days) to camp and from place of discharge home ; company raised to serve 
for 2 months at Rhode Island ; roll dated South Kingston ; also, Capt. Joseph 
Fuller s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 20, 1777; discharged 
Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 10 days, at Stillwater, including travel (200 
miles) home [see Elijah Packard] ; also, Capt. Joseph Fuller s (2d Newton) 
co., Col. Thatcher s regt.; entered camp Sept. 2, 1778; discharged Sept. 3, 
1778 ; service, 2 days ; company marched to Cambridge Sept. 2, 1778, to guard 
British troops. 

PARKER, ELISHA, Shrewsbury. Private, Capt. Job Cushing s co. of Minute-men 
and militia, Col. Artemas Ward s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 18 days; reported returned home. 

PARKER, ELISHA, Township No. 4. Private, Capt. Francis Shaw, Jr. s co. ; en 
listed Sept. 7, 1775; service, 4 mos. 3 days; company stationed at Goulds- 
borough, No. 4, Narraguagus, and Pleasant River, for defence of seacoast; 
also, Capt. Henry Dyer s detachment from Col. Benjamin Foster s (Lincoln 
Co.) regt. ; entered service Oct. 1, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 8, 1777 ; service, 8 
days ; company marched to Machias at sundry times when British ships lay 
in that harbor; also, Capt. John Hall s co., Col. Benjamin Foster s (Lincoln 
Co.) regt.; service from Aug. 7, 1779, to Sept. 7, 1779, 1 mo., at Penobscot ; 
company marched on expedition to Majorbagaduce Aug. 7, 1779, by order of 
Gen. Lovel; also, Capt. Henry Dyer s co. of rangers; enlisted March 8, 1780; 
discharged May 1, 1780; service, 1 mo. 23 days; company raised for defence 
of eastern Massachusetts by order of Col. John Allan, commanding officer at 
Machias and Superintendent of Eastern Indian department; also, same co.; 
roll made up for rations and sworn to at Boston ; said Parker credited with 
53 rations; company raised in No. 4, Gouldsborough, Frenchman s Bay, 
Pleasant River, and Narraguagus; also, Capt. Daniel Sulivan s co., Col. Ben 
jamin Forster s (6th Lincoln Co.) regt.; enlisted Nov. 8, 1780; discharged 
Nov. 23, 1780 ; service, 14 days ; company ordered out by Col. John Allan to 
protect inhabitants of Frenchman s Bay. 

PARKER, ELISHA. Private, Capt. David Whittier s co., in a regiment commanded 
by Maj. Benjamin Gage; service, 40 days; company marched Oct. 2, 1777, 
to join Northern army. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

PARKER, ELISHA. Private, Capt. Zebulon Norton s co., Col. John Ashley s (Berk 
shire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 14, 1777 ; ser 
vice, 23 days, at the Northward ; roll dated Equivalent ; also, Lieut. Ephraim 
Jenings s co., Col. David Field s (Hampshire Co.) regt. ; enlisted Aug. 17,

Northward. [See Elisha Perkins.]

engaged for town of Bridgewater ; marched to camp July 14, 1780, under com

PARKER, GEORGE, Boston (also given Shrewsbury). List of men mustered by 
Nathaniel Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Jan. 8, 1777; 
Capt. Christopher Marshall s co., Col. Thomas Marshall s regt. ; term, 3 years ; 
also, Private, 4th co., Col. Thomas Marshall s (10th) regt. ; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. Chris 
topher Marshall s (7th) co., Col. Marshall s regt. ; subsistence allowed from 
date of enlistment, Dec. 24, 1776, to Feb. 1, 1777 ; credited with 41 days allow 
ance ; subsistence also allowed for 11 days (220 miles) travel on march from 
Boston to Bennington ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls for Jan., March, 
and April, 1779, dated West Point ; reported on command at Hartford in March, 
1779; also, Capt. Marshall s co., Col. Marshall s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; residence, Boston; 
also, descriptive list of men belonging to 4th co., 10th Mass, regt., who had 
enlisted to serve during the war and had received State bounty, as returned 
by Capt. Christopher Marshall ; age, 41 (also given 42) yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 
5 in.; complexion, dark ; hair, black; occupation, mariner ; birthplace, Wells, 
England ; residence, Boston ; enlisted Dec. 21, 1779, by Capt. Marshall ; also, 
Private, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt. ; service from Jan. 1, 1781, 
18 mos. ; reported transferred to corps of invalids July 1, 1782 ; also, list dated 
Jan. 18, 1802, returned by John A very, Secretary, and P. Coffin, Treasurer, 
of men who had enlisted into the Continental Army and actually served 
3 years, and were accordingly entitled to gratuities under resolves of March 
4, 1801, and June 19, 1801; 10th Mass. regt. ; residence, Shrewsbury. 

PARKER, GEORGE, Falmouth (probably) . Capt. Barachiah Basset s co. ; pay abstract 
for mileage to and from camp at Cambridge, dated Jan. 13, 1776; mileage for 
168 miles allowed said Parker ; also, Capt. Elisha Nye s co. ; service from Jan. 
25, 1777, to April 20, 1777, 86 days ; company stationed at Elizabeth Islands ; 
also, Private, Capt. Joseph Palmer s co., Col. Freeman s regt. ; service, 8 days,

regt. ; service, 6 days ; company marched on alarms at Falmouth Feb. 4, April 
2, and May 16, 1779 ; roll sworn to in Barnstable Co.

ment detached from Berkshire Co. militia to reinforce Continental Army at

Brown s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; enlisted July 13, 1780; discharged Oct. 22,

Barnabas Sears s regt.; enlisted July 18, 1781; service, 1 mo. 21 days, "up

months ; roll sworn to in Berkshire Co.

mos. ; reported " now in the Continental Service for 3 years."

who had been discharged from the roll prior to above arrangement ; reported

Garrison West Point; reported on furlough in Jan., Feb., and March, 1781.

received orders to return ; service, 3 days.

PARKER, JEREMIAH, Jr. Private ; return of men drafted from companies com 
manded by Capts. Gore, Mayo, White, and May, who served at Nantasket in 
June, 1776, under Lieut. James Morton, driving ships from Boston harbor; 
service, 3 days.

Capt. Heywood s (5th) co., Col. Nixon s (6th) regt. ; Continental Army pay

said Parker, a soldier in Capt. Heywood s co., 6th Mass, regt., he having com 
pleted his 3 years term of enlistment ; also, receipt dated Brimfield, April 1, 
1781, for bounties paid said Parker and others by the town of Brimfield to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; also, descriptive list 
of men raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the Continental Army, as returned 
by Noah Goodman, Superintendent ; age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; com 
plexion, dark; hair, dark; occupation, farmer; engaged for town of Brim- 
field; engaged March 29, 1781; term, 3 years. 

PARKER, JESSE, Brookfield. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental

dence, Brookfield; engaged for town of Brookfield; joined Capt. Coben s co., 
Col. Olding s (Alden s) regt. ; also, list of men mustered between Jan. 27,

Capt. Coburn s co., Col. Alden s regt.; term, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. 
Asa Coburn s co., Col. John Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from Feb. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, Capt. Coburn s co.,Col.

Brooks s regt. ; muster rolls for Feb., 1781-Feb., 1782, dated York Hutts ; also, 
Light Infantry co., Lieut. Col. Brooks s regt. ; list of men who died or were 
discharged subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781; said Parker discharged June 8, 1783, 
by Gen. Washington, term of enlistment having expired; also, list of men 
who received honorary badges for faithful service ; said Parker served from 
Feb. 1, 1777 ; entitled to 1 and 2 stripes. 

PARKER, JESSE, Falmouth. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, re 
turned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 19, 1780; age, 16 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, 
light ; engaged for town of Falmouth ; marched to camp July 19, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Clark ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service 
and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return 
dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, Private, Colonel s co., Col. Gamaliel 
Bradford s (14th) regt. ; muster roll for Oct.-Dec., 1780, dated Huts near West 
Point; enlisted July 19, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 11, 1780; enlistment, 6 months ; 
also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Falmouth, Barnstable 
Co., for service in the Continental Army during 1780; marched July 6, 1780; 
discharged Dec. 12, 1780; service, 5 mos. 21 days, including travel (300 miles) 
home.

officers of Capt. Abijah Bangs s co. were appointed, agreeable to an order 
from Maj. Gen. "Warren, to command men raised from Col. Doan s and Col. 
Freeman s regts. in said Otis s brigade, to reinforce the Lines at and about 
Boston; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Bangs s co., Col. Dike s regt.; pay roll for 
travel allowance from home and return, etc., dated Boston, Nov. 26, 1776; 
said Parker credited with 4 days allowance ; mileage (160 miles) to and from 
camp also allowed.

3 years or during war ; reported a transient.

PARKER, JOHN, Andover. Corporal, Capt. Thomas Poor s co. of Minute-men, Col.

regt. ; receipts for advance pay, signed by said Parker and others, dated Cam 
bridge, June 21, and July 12, 1775; also, company return dated Camp at 
Cambridge, Oct. 6, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money 
dated Cambridge, Nov. 13, 1775. 

PARKER, JOHN (also given JOHN, Jr.), Andover. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. David 
Whittier s 15th (Methuen) co., 4th Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of 
officers chosen by the several companies in said regiment, as returned by 
Samuel Johnson and others, field officers, dated Andover, March 26, 1776; 
ordered in Council April 3, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported 
commissioned April 3, 1776; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Johnson s co., 
Col. Wigglesworth s regt.; pay abstract for travel allowance from Albany 
home, sworn to March 7, 1777; 210 miles travel allowed said Parker; also, 
petition addressed to the Council, signed by Samuel Johnson, Colonel, 4th 
Essex Co. regt. of Mass, militia, stating that officers for two companies in his 
regiment had been chosen, and requesting that they be commissioned; said 
Parker chosen 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Johnson, Jr. s (late Capt. John 
Peabody s) 1st Andover co. ; ordered in Council Aug. 7, 1777, that said officers 
be commissioned ; reported commissioned Aug. 7, 1777.

discharged Dec. 5, 1780; service, 5 mos. 21 days, including travel (220 miles) 
home.

said Parker was in service " the whole of the time Specified in the orders and

mouth ; engaged for town of Falmouth; joined Capt. Skillings s co., Col. 
Francis s regt. ; term, 3 years ; also, Private, Capt. Clark s co., Col. Benjamin

to Dec. 31, 1779; also, Capt. John Skillin s co.. Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ;

at Bennington ; credited with 84 days allowance ; also, Capt. Samuel Thomes s 
co., Col. Tupper s regt. ; return dated Jan. 26, 1778 ; mustered by County Mus 
ter Master Ilsley and by Col. Varrick, Continental Muster Master; reported

the return] ; also, Colonel s co., Col. Tupper s regt. ; muster roll for March, 
1779, dated West Point ; enlisted Jan. 25, 1777.

PARKER, JOHN, Gorham (also given Boston and Rowley) . List of men mustered

Rowley) ; credited to town of Rowley ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll 
for Jan. -Aug., 1777, dated Van Schaick s Island; enlisted April 8, 1777; 
enlistment, 3 years; reported on command at Charlestown ; also, same co. 
and regt. ; return dated Feb. 3, 1778 ; mustered by Suffolk Co. Muster Master ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Feb., 1779, sworn to at Providence ; also, 
(late) Capt. Brown s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; muster roll for March and 
April, 1779, sworn to at Providence; also, Colonel s co., Col. Bigelow s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 1, 
1780; residence, Boston.

vice, 6 days ; also, Corporal, Lieut. Nathaniel SartelPs co., Col. William Pres 
cott s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 25, 1775; service, 
68 days; also, Capt. Ephraim Corey s co., Col. Prescott s regt.; company 
return dated Cambridge, Oct. 7, 1775, and endorsed " The late Capt Parkers" 
co. ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at 
Cambridge, Oct. 31, 1775. 

PARKER, JOHN, Harvard. (Late) Capt. James Mirick s co., Col. Nathan Spar- 
hawk s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 30, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 12, 1778 ; service, 2

PARKER, JOHN, continued. 

returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 13, 1780; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; complexion,

raised by the town of Sterling for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched to camp July 10, 1780; discharged Dec. 26, 1780; service, 5 
mos. 26 days, including travel (200 miles) home. 

PARKER, JOHN, Lexington. Captain, in command of a detachment from Lexing 
ton militia co. ; service, 5 days; detachment reported on command at Cam 
bridge from May 6 to May 10, 1775, by order of Committee of Safety; also, 
Captain, same detachment; service, 2 days; detachment reported on com 
mand at Cambridge from June 17 to June 18, 1775, by order of Committee of

favor of said Parker, Captain, for wages in full of officers and men under his 
command.

ton s regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775;

PARKER, JOHN, Shirley. Private, Capt. Robert Longley s co., Col. Asa Whit- 
comb s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted July 13, 1775; service, 
19 days; also, company receipts for wages for Aug. and Sept., 1775, dated

Minot s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; arrived at destination May 10, 1777 ; 
discharged July 9, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 9 days, at Rhode Island, including 
travel (8 days) to and from place of destination ; roll dated Warwick Neck. 

PARKER, JOHN, Shrewsbury. Private, Capt. Robert Andrews s co. of Minute- 
men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from 2d Parish in

dated Dorchester, Oct. 7, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Dorchester, Nov. 13, 1775. 

PARKER, JOHN, Southborough. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Wright s co., Col. Luke 
Drury s regt.; marched Aug. 9, 1781; arrived at camp Aug. 18, 1781; dis 
charged Oct. 11, 1781 ; service, 2 mos. 13 days, at West Point, including travel 
(400 miles) to and from camp ; residence, Southborough ; enlisted for town 
of Southborough.

PARKER, JOHN. Account showing sums of money to be paid from the public

Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed in Council June 13, 1776.

Sept. 17, 1776.

Woods, asking for additional wages ; petition endorsed " Leave to withdraw."

manded by Lieut. Col. Barnabas Sears; enlisted Aug. 12, 1781; discharged 
Nov. 8, 1781 ; service, 3 mos. 2 days, including 5 days (100 miles) travel home ; 
regiment raised from Hampshire Co. militia to serve for 3 months. Roll 
dated Deerfield.

among wagon-masters stationed at Boston.

PARKER, JOSEPH, Chelmsford. Private, Capt. Zaccheus Wright s co., Col.

said Parker reported as in camp at White Plains fit for duty.

PARKER, JOSEPH, Hutchinson (Barre). Corporal, Capt. John Black s co., Col.

at Bennington.

PARKER, JOSEPH, Rochester. Ensign, Capt. Seth Briggs s co. of militia, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 4 days ; also, Captain; list 
of officers of the Mass, militia which reinforced the army who joined Col. 
J. Ward s regt. ; commissioned Jan. 29, 1776; also, Captain, 2d co., 4th 
Plymouth Co. regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen in said regiment, 
as returned hy Ebenezer Sproutt and Ebenezer White, field officers ; ordered 
in Council May 9, 1776, that said officers be commissioned; reported com 
missioned May 9, 1776 ; also, Captain ; list of officers appointed to command 
the several companies of a regiment raised from Brig. Gen. Joseph Cushing s 
brigade and Brig. Gen. Otis s (Barnstable Co.) brigade, to be commanded by 
Col. John Gushing, Jr., and ordered to march to Rhode Island, as returned by 
Joseph Cushingto Maj. Gen. Warren, dated Hanover; company drafted from 
Rochester, Wareham, and Middleborough ; also, Captain, Col. John Cushing s 
regt. ; engaged Sept. 20, 1776 ; service, 60 days ; company stationed at Rhode 
Island ; also, Captain, Col. Ebenezer Sprout s regt. ; company marched from 
Rochester to " foglon ferry," R. I., under command of 2d Lieut. John Doty 
on the alarm of Dec. 8,1776; also, same regt.; commissioned Jan. 6,1778; 
company stationed at Rhode Island for 3 months from Jan. 1, 1778. 

PARKER, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Benjamin Hooper s co. ; marched Feb. 20, 1776 ; 
service to May 31, 1776, 3 mos. 10 days ; company stationed at Falrnouth, Cum 
berland Co., for defence of seacoast ; also, same co. ; service from Aug. 30, 
1776, to date of discharge, Oct. 12, 1776, 1 mo. 11 days; company stationed at 
Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast. [See Joseph Barker.] 

PARKER, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Thomas Lord s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 1, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 29 days, in Northern department, at the 
time of taking Gen. Burgoyne ; reported furloughed ; travel allowed company 
from Tarrytown, N. Y., to Athol, but none allowed said Parker. 

PARKER, JOSEPH. Treasury pay roll of officers and crew of the brigantine " Pallas," 
commanded by Capt. James Johnson, for service from July 3, 1779, to Aug. 
20, 1779, on Penobscot expedition. 

PARKER, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Stephen Webster s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s

at Claverack, including travel (220 miles) home ; regiment raised in Suffolk 
and Essex counties to reinforce army under Gen. Washington.

months in the Continental Army, agreeable to resolves passed in April, 1778;

paid 10 toward his hire.

(also given April 1), 1778; also, Capt. Joseph Boynton s co., Col. Nathaniel 
Wade s regt. ; enlisted July 6, 1778; service to Jan. 1, 1779, 6 mos., at Rhode 
Island, including travel (100 miles) home ; also, Drum Major, Col. Nathaniel 
Wade s regt. ; muster rolls of field and staff officers, dated East Greenwich, 
Sept. 17, Oct. 14, and Nov. 6, 1778; appointed July 3, 1778; term to expire 
Jan. 1, 1779 ; also, Drum Major, Capt. Daniel Bowker s co., Col. Webb s regt. ; 
engaged Aug. 18, 1781; discharged Nov. 30, 1781; service, 3 mos. 22 days, 
including 10 days (208 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to reinforce Conti 
nental Army for 3 months. 

PARKER, LEMUEL. Sergeant, Capt. Reuben Munn s co., (late) Col. David Leonard s 
regt.; entered service March 1, 1777; discharged April 11,1777; service, 42 
days; company detached to reinforce army at Ticonderoga. 

PARKER, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Joseph Sibley s co., Col. Danforth Reyes s 
regt.; enlisted July 16, 1777; enlistment, 6 months from July 1, 1777; roll 
dated Providence; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated North Kings 
ton, Dec. 3, 1777 ; also, same co. and regt. ; return of men stationed at North 
Kingston Dec. 8, 1777, dated Sturbridge ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for 
Dec., 1777, dated Providence, allowing 1 mo. 4 days service at Rhode Island, 
including travel home. 

PARKER, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Lakin s co., Col. John Robinson s 
regt. ; enlisted Aug. 1, 1777; service, 2 mos., at Rhode Island ; roll sworn to 
at Groton ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated North Kingston, Dec. 
18, 1777; enlistment, 6 months, to expire Jan. 1, 1778. 

PARKER, LEMUEL. Private, Capt. Joseph Boynton s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s

Suffolk and Middlesex counties to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 
Roll dated Woburn.

892 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. Corporal, Capt. David Cowden s co., Col. Ruggles Wood- 
bridge s regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Pros 
pect Hill, Nov. 13, 1775. 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. Sergeant, Capt. Samuel Taylor s co., Col. Porter s regt.; 
engaged July 10, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 12, 1777 ; service, 38 days, including 
travel (100 miles) home ; company marched from Charlemont July 10, 1777, 
to reinforce Northern army after the evacuation of Ticonderoga; also, Capt. 
Nahum Ward s co., Col. David Wells s regt.; engaged Sept. 22, 1777; dis 
charged Oct. 18, 1777 ; service, 1 mo., with Northern army at the time of 
taking Gen. Burgoyne, including travel (80 miles) home; company marched 
from Charlemont Sept. 22, 1777. 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Solomon Pollard s (3d) co., Col. 
Simeon Spaulding s (7th Middlesex Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of offi 
cers ; commissioned April 2, 1778. 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Thomas Mayo s co., Col. Brooks s regt. of 
guards; joined Nov. 3, 1777; service to April 3, 1778, 5 mos., at Cambridge. 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Lemuel May s co., Col. Mclntosh s regt. ;, 
joined March 23, 1778 ; discharged April 5, 1778 ; service, 14 days, at Roxbury 
Lines. 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. Private, Sergt. Joshua Gore s detachment; enlisted Jan.. 
6, 1779; discharged Feb. 16, 1779; service, 1 mo. 11 days; detachment raised 
to guard Continental stores at Roxbury. 

PARKER, NATHANIEL. Private, Capt. Thomas Newcomb s co., Lieut. Col. Joseph 
Webb s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 1, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 5, 1781 ; service, 3 mos.. 
15 days, at Peekskill, N. Y., including 11 days (220 miles) travel home. 

PARKER, NEHEMIAH, Groton. Private, Capt. John Sawtell s co., Col. James Pres- 
cott s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from Groton and 
Pepperell; service, 12^ days; also, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co., Col. William 
Prescott s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 30, 1775; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 3 days; also, company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, Oct. 30, 1775 ; also, 
account showing sums of money to be paid from the public treasury to sundry 
persons for losses sustained at battles of Lexington and Bunker Hill ; amounts 
allowed in Council June 13, 1776 ; also, order on the Province treasurer, payable 
to Capt. Asa Lawrence, dated Groton, July 4, 1776, signed by said Parker, for 
amount due for losses sustained in battle at Charlestown ; also, Private, Capt. 
Job Shattuck s co., Col. John Robinson s regt. ; service, 8 days; roll made up 
from time of enlistment to time of marching to camp and dated Cambridge, 
March -, 1776. 

PARKER, NEHEMIAH, Oakham. Private, Capt. Edmund Hodges s co., Col. Job 
Cushing s regt. ; enlisted July 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 29, 1777 ; service, 
1 mo. 8 days, at the Northward, including 5 days (95 miles) travel home. 

PARKER, NKHEMIAH. Capt. Haynes s co., Col. Edward Wigglesworth s re^t. ; en 
listed May 15, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 16 days ; roll certified at Boston and made 
up for wages to July 1, 1777, payment of which had been refused by Jonathan 
Trumbull, P. M. G., at Albany, on account of said Parker and others not 
having joined regiment before said date. 

PARKER, NEHEMIAH. Private, Capt. Reuben Sibley s co., Col. Josiah Whitney s 
regt.; marched July 30, 1778; discharged Sept. 12, 1778; service, 1 mo. !& 
days, at Rhode Island. Roll dated Sutton. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 893 

PARKER, NEHEMIAH. Private, Capt. Isaac Harrington s co., Col. Samuel Deanney s 
(Denny s) regt. ; enlisted Oct. 18, 1779; discharged Dec. 2, 1779; service, 1 
mo. 15 days, including travel (160 miles) home ; company detached to join 
Continental Army for 3 months and ordered to march to Claverack. 

PARKER, NOAH, Lynn. Return of men raised in Essex Co. for Continental service, 
agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780 ; engaged for town of Lynn ; engaged March 
2, 1781 ; term, 3 years ; also, descriptive list dated Hutts New Boston, May 15, 
1782; Capt. James Tisdale s (4th) co., 3d Mass. regt. ; age, 33 yrs. ; stature, 5 
ft. 6 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark ; eyes, blue ; occupation, yeoman ; resi 
dence, Lynn; enlisted June 5, 1782; enlistment, 3 years; also, Private, Capt. 
Tisdale s (3d) co., Col. John Greaton s (3d) regt.; muster rolls for Sept. and 
Oct., 1782 ; also, Capt. Tisdale s co., Col. Greaton s regt. commanded by Lieut. 
Col. James Mellin ; muster rolls for Jan. and Feb., 1783 ; also, Capt. Tisdale s 
(4th) co., 3d Mass. regt. commanded by Col. Michael Jackson; muster roll 
for Aug. and Sept., 1783 ; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 19 months 
29 days; reported on Major General s barge; also, accounts current showing 
clothing charged to men belonging to Capt. Tisdale s co. ; clothing charged 
said Parker on various dates between Nov. 20, 1782, and Dec. 16, 1783. 

PARKER, NOAH, Roxbury. Corporal, Capt. Moses Whiting s co., Col. John 
Greaton s regt. of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; 
service, 13 days; also, Private, Capt. Edward Payson Williams s co., 36th 
regt. ; company return dated Fort No. 2, Oct. 5, 1775; also, Capt. "Williams s 
co., Col. John Greaton s regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Cambridge Camp, Dec. 22, 1775. 

PARKER, NOAH, Salem. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continen 
tal Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, Aug. 2, 1780; age, 29 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, 
ruddy ; engaged for town of Salem ; marched to camp Aug. 2, 1780, under 
command of Lieut. Benjamin Pike ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months 
service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a 
return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Salem for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; 
marched July 8, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 4, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 9 days, includ 
ing travel (240 miles) home. 

PARKER, OLIVER, Chelmsford. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Mus 
ter Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Sept. 14, 1777; Capt. Varnum s co., 
Col. Michael Jackson s regt. ; also, Private, Capt. Varnum s co., Col. 
Michael Jackson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
May 15, 1777, to June 1, 1778; residence, Chelmsford; credited to town of 
Chelmsford ; term, 3 years ; reported discharged. 

PARKER, OLIVER, Groton. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge ; 
service, 11 days; reported enlisted into the army; also, Captain; return of 
officers belonging to Col. William Prescott s regt., dated May 25, 1775 ; ordered 
in Provincial Congress May 26, 1775, that said officers be commissioned; re 
ported recruiting; also, order dated Cambridge, June 18, 1775, signed by said 
Parker, Captain, for cartridge boxes of which several men in his company 
were in need and for which he promised to be accountable ; order endorsed 
" Prescot." 

PARKER, OLIVER, Groton. Private, Lieut. Nathaniel Sartell s co., Col. William 
Prescott s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 24, 1775; ser 
vice, 98 days ; also, certificate dated March 4, 1776, signed by Lieut. Nathaniel

PARKER, OLIVER, continued. 

Sartell, certifying that said Parker, a soldier in (late) Capt. Ephraim Corey s 
co., Col. William Prescott s regt., had never received a bounty coat or the 
value thereof. 

PARKER, OLIVER, Natick. Private, Capt. Samuel Kilton s co., Col. John Pater- 
son s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 24, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 14 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]; also, order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp No. 3, Charlestown, Oct. 
27, 1775. 

PARKER, OLIVER. Account showing sums of money to be paid from the public 
treasury to sundry persons for losses sustained at battles of Lexington and 
Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed in Council June 13, 1776 ; entry credits amount 
received for the use of Samuel Taylor. 

PARKER, OLIVER. Private, Capt. Aaron Jewett s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 15, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 15 days, with 
Northern army ; company marched to Saratoga. Roll dated Littleton. 

PARKER, PARK, Natick. Private, Capt. Joseph Morse s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s 
regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 6 days. 

PARKER, PETER, Dracut. Returns, etc., of 2d Dracut co. ; list dated Sept. 17, 1776, 
of men returned as having been engaged for 2 months service near New York ; 
also, Private, Capt. Zaccheus Wright s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; company re 
turn dated Camp at White Plains, Oct. 31, 1776 ; reported as having been sent 
with the wounded and as having lost articles in battle ; also, Capt. Joseph 
Bradley Varnum s co., Col. Simeon Spaulding s regt. ; abstract for equipments 
for train band and alarm lists, endorsed " 1777 ; " reported as belonging to train 
band ; also, returns, etc., of 2d Dracut co. ; list of men belonging to said com 
pany, returned by the Selectmen as having done more than their ratable pro 
portion of service in the war, based upon an average made in 1777 ; also, returns, 
etc., of 2d Dracut co. ; list of persons who paid money to hire men to serve in 
the Continental Army, agreeable to resolves passed in April, 1778; said Par 
ker hired by Moses Davis and others to serve for 8 months ; 20 to be allowed 
him if paid by the town ; also, Private, Lieut. John Flint s co., Col. Thomas 
Poor s regt. ; enlisted June 16, 1778, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Feb. 
11, 1779; service, 8 mos. 9 days, at and about White Plains, including 12 days 
(240 miles) travel home ; regiment raised to fortify passes of North river, 
N. Y. ; also, Capt. Asa Lawrance s co., Col. Thomas Poor s regt. ; pay rolls 
for June-Aug., 1778, dated Fort Clinton ; also, (late) Capt. Asa Lawrance s 
co. commanded by Lieut. John Flint, Col. Poor s regt. ; pay roll for Sept., 
177S, dated West Point; also, Lieut. John Flint s co., Col. Poor s regt.; 
pay roll for Nov., 1778, dated West Point. 

PARKER, PETER, Methuen. List of men raised for the 6 months service and re 
turned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp 
Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. [See Peter Barker.] 

PARKER, PETER, Newton. Private, Capt. Edward Fuller s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; 
company return endorsed " Octo 1776; " said Parker reported as sick and as 
having lost articles in battle. 

PARKER, PETER, Shirley. Private, Capt, Henry Haskell s co., Col. James Pres 
cott s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 4 days; 
reported returned home April 21, 1775. 

PARKER, PETER. Private ; return of men drafted from companies commanded by 
Capts. Gore, Mayo, White, and May, who served at Nantasket in June, 1776, 
under Lieut. James Morton, driving ships from Boston harbor ; service, 3 days.

PARKER, PETER. Private, Capt. Enos Parker s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s regt. ; 
enlisted July 9, 1777; discharged July 31, 1777; service, 23 days; regiment 
detached from Berkshire Co. militia to reinforce Continental Army at Ticon- 
deroga ; also, Capt. Samuel Low s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt. ; entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 19, 1777 ; service, 
6 days, at Bennington. 

PARKER, PETER. Corporal, Capt. Robert Davis s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s regt. ; 
muster roll dated Boston, Aug. 14, 1778 ; company drafted to serve for 6 weeks 
from July 29, 1778; also, Capt. Davis s co., Maj. Goodwin s detachment, Col. 
Gerrish s regt. of guards ; detached July 29, 1778, discharged Sept. 10, 1778 ; 
service, 1 mo. 11 days, at Boston. 

PARKER, PHILEMON. Private, Capt. Benjamin Ward, Jr. s co. ; enlisted Jan. 22 V 
1776; discharged Nov. 18, 1776; service, 9 mos. 28 days; company raised in 
Salem and stationed there for defence of seacoast. Roll sworn to in Essex Co. 

PARKER, PHILEMON. Pay abstract of men who enlisted in Dec., 1775, into Capt. 
John Wood s co., Col. Loammi Baldwin s regt., for the ensuing campaign, 
who were not in the service at the time of their enlistment; enlisted Dec. 4, 
1775; service, 28 days; also, Private, Capt. John Wood s co., Col. Baldwin s 
(26th) regt. ; pay abstracts for Feb. and March, 1776; also, same co. and regt. ; 
pay abstract for April, 1776, dated New York ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay 
abstract for May, 1776 ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay abstract for June, 1776, 
dated New York ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance 
for the year 1776, etc., sworn to in Middlesex Co., April 21, 1777; reported 
discharged 230 miles from home. 

PARKER, PHILEMON. Return dated Lexington, Aug. 14, 1777, made to Col. Brooks, 
of men raised from Capt. Francis Brown s co., being every sixth man from 
" Each list " [probably train band and alarm lists] ; also, Private, Capt. 
George Minot s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 16, 1777 ; dis 
charged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 25 days, in Northern department, in 
cluding 11 days (220 miles) travel home. 

PARKER, PHILIP. Private, Capt. Enos Parker s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
regt. ; enlisted July 1, 1777 ; discharged July 31, 1777 ; service, 31 days ; regi 
ment detached from Berkshire Co. militia to reinforce Continental Army at 
Ticonderoga; also, Capt. William White s co., (late) Col. Brown s (Berkshire 
Co.) regt.; enlisted July 12, 1780; discharged Oct. 22, 1780; service, 3 mos. 
16 days, at Stone Arabia, N. Y., including 6 days (120 miles) travel home. 

PARKER, PHINEAS, Andover. Private, Capt. Benjamin Farnum s co., Col. James 
Frye s regt.; company return dated Camp at Cambridge, Oct. 6, 1775; also, 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, Nov. 13, 
1775. 

PARKER, PHINEAS, Andover. Captain, Col. Jeduthan Baldwin s regt. of artificers ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1780 ; 
reported as serving 15 mos. as Ensign, 9 mos. as Lieutenant, 24 mos. as Cap 
tain ; also, same regt. ; return of officers for clothing, dated Brookfield, May 
11, 1780; also, Captain of a co. of artificers; return made by Jeduthan Bald 
win, Colonel of Engineers and Lieut. Colonel Commandant of artificers, of 
officers and men belonging to Massachusetts in his regiment who had engaged 
for 3 years or during the war, dated Morristown, July 26, 1780; engaged Jan. 
1, 1779 ; also, return of officers in Lieut. Col. Baldwin s regt. for clothing, dated 
Steenrapie, N. J., Sept. 18, 1780; also, list of officers belonging to Col. Bald 
win s regt. accompanying a petition addressed to the General Court, dated 
Boston, Sept. -, 1780, signed by said Parker, in behalf of himself and other 
officers of said regiment, requesting that they might be supplied with clothing.

PARKER, PHINEAS, Concord. Private, Capt. Simon Hunt s co., Col. Brooks s 
regt. ; company return [year not given]; said Parker reported as having 
been sent with the wounded ; also, lists of men appearing under the heading 
" Hart well Brook the first Everidge ; " said Parker appears among men who 
went at the time of taking [Gen.] Burgoyne, among men who went with 
Capt. Minot [dates not given], and also among men forming the second guard 
at Cambridge in 1778 ; John Vose reported as serving in room of said Parker 
at Cambridge, in 1778, being his apprentice ; also, Private, in a detachment 
commanded by Sergt. William Kendall ; enlisted July 17, 1778 ; discharged 
Oct. 24, 1778 ; service, 3 mos. 8 days, guarding Continental stores at Concord ; 
also, receipt given to Joseph Hosmer, dated Concord, June 7, 1779, signed by 
said Parker and others, for wages due for service as guards in the town of 
Concord under Sergt. Kendall. 

PARKER, PHINEAS, Groton. Private, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge ; 
service, 9 days ; reported returned home ; also, Capt. Henry Haskell s co., Col. 
Prescott s regt. ; pay abstract for mileage to and from headquarters, dated 
Camp at Cambridge, Jan. 13, 1776; mileage for 70 miles allowed said Parker; 
also, return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Blood s 
co., Col. Jonathan Reed s (6th Middlesex Co.) regt., as returned to Brig. Gen. 
Prescott, dated Littleton, Sept. 17, 1777 ; residence, Groton ; engaged for town 
of Groton ; term, 8 months; reported drafted ; also reported not mustered. 

PARKER, PHINEAS, Wilton. Private, Capt. John Wood s co., Col. Paul Dudley 
Sargent s regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; reported " In carpen 
ters Works." 

PARKER, PHINEAS. Corporal, Capt. Asa Laurance s co. of volunteers, Col. Jona 
than Reed s regt.; entered service Sept. 27, 1777; discharged Oct. 31, 1777; 
service, 1 rno. 9 days, at the Northward, including travel home; company 
raised in Littleton and Westford and marched to assist army under Gen. 
Gates. 

PARKER, PRINCE. Capt. Lot Crowell s co., Col. Nathaniel Freeman s regt.; ser 
vice, 3 days, on an alarm at Dartmouth and Falmouth in Sept., 1778. 

PARKER, RETIRE H., Bradford. Corporal, Capt. John Savory s (2d Bradford) co., 
Col. Samuel Johnson s regt., which marched in response to the alarm of 
April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; said Parker marched April 19, 1775 ; left place 
of rendezvous April 21, 1775 ; service, 3| days. 

PARKER, REUBEN, Chelrnsford. Private, Capt. Oliver Barren s co. of militia, Col. 
David Green s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
13 days. 

PARKER, REUBEN, Stockbridge. Drummer, Capt. Thomas Williams s co. of Min 
ute-men, Col. John Paterson s regt., which marched April 22, 1775, in response 
to the alarm of April 19, 1775, from Stockbridge and West Stockbridge to 
Cambridge; service, 13 days; also, Capt. Thomas Williams s co., Col. John 
Paterson s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 5, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 4 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp No. 3, Charlestown, 
Dec. 23, 1775; also, Drummer, Capt. William Francis s co., Col. John Ash- 
ly s detachment of militia ; entered service July 22, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 
13, 1777; service, 23 days, in Northern department; also, Capt. Ebenezer 
Cook s co., Col. John Brown s (Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Sept. 
22, 1777; discharged Oct. 14, 1777; service, 22 days, at the Northward. 

PARKER, REUBEN. Capt. Abner Cranson s co., Col. Asa Whitcomb s regt. ; com 
pany return dated Prospect Hill, Oct. 6, 1775 ; reported in the train ; also re 
ported as belonging to Ireland.

PARKER, ROBERT, Groton. Private, Lieut. Nathaniel Sartell s co., Col. William 
Prescott s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 25, 1775 ; service, 
68 days ; also, Capt. Ephraim Corey s co., Col. Prescott s regt. ; company return 
dated Cambridge, Oct. 7, 1775, and endorsed " The late Capt Parkers " co. 

PARKER, ROBERT, Groton. Private, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge ; 
service, 6 days ; reported enlisted into the army ; also, Capt. Asa Lawrence s 
co., Col. William Prescott s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
April 25, 1775 ; service, 2 mos. 3 days ; also, order for bounty coat or its equiva 
lent in money dated Cambridge, Oct. 30, 1775 ; reported as among those returned 
as killed or taken. 

PARKER, ROBERT, Groton. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Capt. Holden s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s (6th Middlesex Co.) regt., 
dated Littleton ; residence, Groton ; engaged for town of Groton ; term, 8 
months, to expire Jan. 10, 1778; also, Private, Capt. Sylvanus Smith s co., 
Col. Timothy Bigelow s regt. ; muster roll for Jan.-Aug., 1777, dated Van 
Schaick s Island and sworn to in Camp at Stillwater; enlisted May 15, 1777; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Nov., 1777, sworn to at Camp near 
" the Gulf; " also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls for Dec., 1777, and Feb., 
1778, sworn to at Camp Valley Forge ; reported discharged Jan. 10, 1778. 

PARKER, ROBERT, South Brimfield. Private, Capt. Ames Walbridge s co., Col. 
David Brewer s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 12, 1775 ; 
service, 2 mos. 24 days. [See Robert Parks.] 

PARKER, ROBERT. Private ; list of men returned as serving on picket guard under 
Maj. Loammi Baldwin, dated May 11, 1775. 

PARKER, ROBERT. Capt. Ephraim Corey s co., Col. William Prescott s regt. ; 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Camp at Cambridge, 
Oct. 31, 1775. 

PARKER, ROBERT. Memorandum of firelocks received of sundry officers and 
soldiers; date of delivery, Jan. 4, 1776. 

PARKER, ROBERT. 2d Lieutenant, schooner " True Blue " (privateer) ; petition 
dated Boston, Dec. 16, 1777, signed by Gushing & White, asking that Law 
rence Forlong be commissioned as commander of said vessel ; ordered in 
Council Dec. 16, 1777, that a commission be issued. 

PARKER, ROBERT. Private, Capt. Isaac Woods s co., Col. Jonathan Reed s regt. 
of guards ; muster rolls dated Cambridge, May 9, and June 1, 1778 ; enlisted 
March 31, 1778 ; enlistment, 3 months from April 2 (also given April 1) , 1778 ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; joined April 1, 1778 ; service, 3 mos. 4 days, at 
Cambridge. 

PARKER, ROBERT. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Everet s co., Col. Mclntosh s regt., 
Gen. Lovell s brigade ; enlisted Aug. 1, 1778; discharged Sept. 14, 1778; ser 
vice, 1 mo. 15 days, on expedition to Rhode Island.

age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, light; engaged for town of

co., Col. Timothy Bigelow s (15th) regt. ; muster roll for Jan.-June, 1780,

PARKER, RUFUS. Private, Capt. Erastus Sergeant s co., Col. Benjamin Simonds s 
detachment of Berkshire Co. militia ; muster roll dated Ticonderoga, Feb. 25, 
1777; enlistment to expire March 15, 1777; also, same co. and detachment; 
entered service Dec. 16, 1776 ; discharged March 22, 1777 ; service, 97 days, at 
Ticonderoga, including 7 days (140 miles) travel home ; also, Capt. Oliver 
Belding s co., Col. John Brown s regt.; entered service Sept. 21, 1777; dis 
charged Oct. 14, 1777 ; service, 24 days, at the Northward ; also, Capt. Peter 
Porter s detachment, Gen. Fellows s (Berkshire Co.) brigade ; entered ser 
vice July 1, 1778; discharged Oct. 31, 1778, by order of Brig. Gen. Stark ; ser 
vice, 4 mos., under Brig. Gen. Stark at Albany; detachment raised for 

6 months ; also, Capt. Samuel Goodrich s co., Lieut. Col. Miles Powell s (Berk 
shire Co.) regt. ; enlisted July 18, 1779 ; discharged Aug. 22, 1779 ; service, 
1 mo. 10 days, at New Haven, Conn., including 5 days (110 miles) travel home ; 
also, Capt. Charles Dibble s co., Col. Rosseter s (3d Berkshire Co.) regt.; 
entered service Oct. 14, 1780; discharged Oct. 17, 1780; service, 3 days, on the 
alarm at the Northward of Oct. 14, 1780 ; also, same co. and regt. ; entered 
service Oct. 18, 1780; discharged Oct. 21, 1780; service, 4 days, on the alarm 
at the Northward of Oct. 18, 1780; also, Capt. Josiah Yale s co. ; entered ser 
vice Oct. 12, 1781 ; discharged Oct. 20, 1781 ; service, 12 days, travel included ; 
company marched Oct. 12, 1781, from Lee and Lenox to Stillwater by order of 
Brig. Gen. Rosseter on an alarm.

PARKER, SAMUEL, Douglas. List of men drafted from Worcester Co. militia to 
march to Horse Neck under command of Col. Denny [year not given], but 
who failed to join regiment; said Parker drafted from town of Douglas; 
drafted into Capt. Samuel Cragin s co.

Hosmer, Superintendent for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner,

Thomas s regt. ; entered service Sept. 4, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1781 ; ser

Camp at Battes Hill.

PARKER, SAMUEL, Newburyport. Private, Capt. Joshua French s co., Lieut. Col. 
Enoch Putnam s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 20, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 8, 1781 ; ser

and home ; regiment raised in Essex and Plymouth counties to reinforce 
Continental Army for 3 months. 

PARKER, SAMUEL, Newton. Private, Capt. Amariah Fuller s co., which marched

ment, 8 months; regiment raised in York Co. for defence of eastern Massa 
chusetts ; roll sworn to at Arundel and certified at Falmouth.

guard the shore ; enlisted June 10 [1783] ; discharged Nov. 15 [1783] ; service, 
5 mos. 5 days ; warrant drawn in favor of Selectmen of Falmouth.

dence; also, return certified at Camp near Morristown, April 30, 1780, of 
officers and men belonging to Col. Lee s, Col. Henley s, and Col. Jackson s 
regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s regt., 
who were incorporated into a regiment under the command of Col. Henry 
Jackson, agreeable to the arrangement of April 9, 1779; rank, Paymaster; 
residence, Boston ; appointed May 1, 1777 ; said Parker returned among officers 
belonging to Col. Henry Jackson s regt. who were not included in above 
arrangement ; reported a supernumerary officer April 9, 1779.

PARKER, THOMAS, Yarmouth. Private, Capt. Abijah Bangs s co., Col. Dike s 
regt. ; pay abstract for gun and blanket money, dated Boston, Feb. 24, 1777; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777; enlisted Dec. 
13, 1776; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 1777; also, Capt. Elisha 
Hedge s co., Col. Nathaniel Freeman s regt. ; marched from home Sept. 27, 
1777; service, 1 mo., on a secret expedition to Rhode Island ; said Parker re 
ported as having gone home without leave 2 days before the rest of the regi 
ment was discharged because of failure to draw allowance. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private ; list of men returned as serving on main guard under 
Maj. Loammi Baldwin, at Cambridge, dated May 15, 1775. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. John Bridge s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt.; 
service between March 4, and March 8, 1776, 2 days; company stationed at 
Roxbury. 

PARKER, THOMAS. 1st Lieutenant, brigantine " Hawke," commanded by Capt. 
Jonathan Oakes; engaged May 3, 1777 ; service, 1 mo., with the fleet under 
Commodore John Manley ; roll sworn to in Middlesex Co.; also, petition 
dated Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed by William Shattuck and Daniel Parker,

PARKER, THOMAS, continued. 

of Boston, stating that they had fitted out the brigantine " Hawk," and re 
questing that said Thomas Parker be commissioned as Commander; ordered 
in Council Sept. 25, 1777, that a commission be issued. 

PARKER, THOMAS, List dated Boston, Sept. 29, 1777, of men detached from Col. 
Jabez Hatch s (Boston) regt. who refused to march on a secret expedition ; 
also, resolve dated Sept. 30, 1777, directing Jabez Hatch, Colonel of Boston 
regt., to arrest and confine said Parker and others who had refused to march 
as ordered, and have them later conveyed under guard to Rhode Island and 
there deliver them to the commanding officer of the detachment raised in 
Massachusetts for a secret expedition. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Corporal, Capt. David Prouty s co., Maj. Asa Baldwin s 
division, Col. Samuel Denny s (Worcester Co.) regt. ; marched Sept. 27, 1777 ; 
discharged Oct. 18, 1777; service, 1 mo., including 8 days (157 miles) travel 
home ; company marched to reinforce Northern army. Roll dated Spencer. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Benjamin Blaney s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s 
regt. of guards; joined Jan. 12, 1778; service to April 3, 1778, 83 days, at 
Cambridge. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Allen McLane s co., in a regiment commanded 
by Lieut. Col. John Parke ; pay roll for Aug., 1778. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. John Walton s co. ; joined Sept. 4, 1778; dis 
charged Sept. 11, 1778. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Capt. Lot Crowell s co., Col. Nathaniel Freeman s regt.; ser 
vice, 3 days, on an alarm at Dartmouth and Falmouth in Sept., 1778. 

PARKER, THOMAS. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. William Watson s (5th) co., Col. Denny s 
(1st Worcester Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers; commissioned 
March 5, 1779. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Timothy Heald s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s 
regt. ; enlisted July 25, 1779; discharged Sept. 25, 1779; service, 2 mos. 1 day, 
on Penobscot expedition. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Humphrey s co., Col. Jacob Davis s 
(Worcester Co.) regt. ; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 7, 1780; ser 
vice, 10 days, including 4 days (80 miles) travel home; company marched to 
Rhode Island July 30, 1780, on an alarm. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Jonathan Woodbury s co., Col. Jacob Davis s 
regt.; marched July 30, 1780; discharged Aug. 7, 1780; service, 12 days, at 
Rhode Island on an alarm, including 4 days (72 miles) travel home. Roll 
dated Sutton. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Lieutenant, in command of a detachment from Capt. Daniel 
Grout s co., Col. John Rand s regt.; appointed July 3, 1780; discharged Oct. 
9, 1780 ; service, 3 mos. 15 days, including 8 days (160 miles) travel home ; 
regiment raised for 3 months, marched to Claverack, and was discharged at 
West Point. 

PARKER, THOMAS. Petition dated Boston, Nov. 18, 1780, signed by James Swan, 
in behalf of himself and others, of Boston, asking that said Parker be com 
missioned as commander of the brigantine "Nancy" (privateer) ; advised 
in Council Nov. 18, 1780, that a commission be issued. 

PARKER, THOMAS. List of prisoners brought to Marblehead in the cartel " Pacific " 
to be exchanged for British prisoners, as returned by Thomas Stone, Commis 
sary [year not given] ; said Parker, Lieutenant, reported as having been taken 
in the schooner " General Gates " (privateer) by the British brig " Hope."

regt. ; muster roll for March, 1779, dated West Point ; enlistment, 3 years.

PARKHURST, JOEL. Letter addressed to Hon. James Bowdain, President of the 
Council, dated Dunstable, June 19, 1780, signed by said Parkhurst, stating 
that he had performed a tour of duty which, with his other services, had been 
so arduous as to interfere with his private affairs, and asking that his resigna 
tion as 2d Lieutenant of a Dunstable co., Col. Jonathan Brown s (7th Middle 
sex Co.) regt., be accepted; ordered in Council Aug. 30, 1780, that the 
resignation be accepted. 

PARKHURST, JOHN, Lexington. Private, in a detachment from Lexington militia 
co. commanded by Capt. John Bridge ; service, 5 days ; detachment reported 
on command at Cambridge from May 11 to May 15, 1775, by order of Committee 
of Safety.

April 2, 1778; also, same co. and regt. ; entered service April 1, 1778; service 
to July 4, 1778, 3 mos. 3 days, at Cambridge.

26, 1777, to Sept. 31 [30], 1777; reported died Sept. 31 [30], 1777; also, same 
co. and regt. ; return dated Albany, Feb. -, 1778 ; residence, Wareham ; en 
gaged for town of Wareham ; mustered by Capt. Hatch. 

PARKIS, EPHRAIM, Princeton. List of 9 months men mustered by Thomas New- 
hall, Muster Master for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Sergeant s co., Col. Whitney s 
regt.; engaged for town of Princeton; mustered July 21, 1779; also, list of 
men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as 
having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780.

on an alarm at the Northward. 

PARKIS, SAMUEL, Townsend. Private, Capt. Simeon Hazeltine s (5th) co., Col. 
John Fellows s (8th) regt. ; company return dated Oct. 7, 1775 ; reported on 
command at Quebec.

as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at 
Springfield, July 11, 1780; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 in.; complexion, 
light ; engaged for town of Petersham ; marched to camp July 11, 1780, under 
command of Capt. George Webb. 

PARKISTS, JOSIAH. Private, Capt. Amos Foster s co., Col. Cyprian How s regt. ; 
entered service July 28, 1780, 3 days preceding march ; discharged Oct. 30,

miles) travel home ; company detached from 7th Middlesex Co. regt. and 
ordered part to Rhode Island and part to Fishkill ; regiment raised to rein 
force Continental Army for 3 months.

regt. ; return of men who enlisted for 1 year from Dec. 31, 1775.

dated Cambridge, May 9, and June -, 1778 ; enlisted March 31, 1778. 

PARKS, JOHN. List of men raised in Worcester Co. for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778, re 
turned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, 
July 20, 1778 ; engaged for town of Fitchburg ; arrived at Fishkill June 20, 
1778. 

PARKS, JOHN. 3d Mate, ship " Charming Sally," commanded by Capt. Alexander 
Holmes ; list of officers dated Boston ; vessel reported to have been in service 
from July 13, 1779, to Aug. 28, 1779 ; 18 officers and 70 men reported taken on 
board at Penobscot Aug. 12, 1779, and continued on board until Aug. 28, 1779. 

PARKS, JOHN. Account dated Ipswich, Jan. 18, 1782, rendered by the Selectmen, 
of bounties paid said Parks and others to serve in the Continental Army for 
the term of 3 years, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 927 

PARKS, JONAS, Lincoln. Private, Capt. William Smith s co. of Minute-men, Col. 
Abijah Pierce s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
10 days ; also, communication dated Cambridge, June 14, 1775, signed by Capt. 
Nathan Fuller, requesting the armorer to receive guns belonging to said Parks 
and others in Capt. Fuller s co., Col. Gardner s regt., and fit them for service; 
also, Fifer, Capt. Nathan Fuller s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (late Col. 
Thomas Gardner s) 37th regt. ; company return dated Camp at Prospect Hill, 
Oct. 6, 1775. 

PARKS, JONATHAN. Private ; list of men returned as serving on picket guard under 
Maj. Loammi Baldwin, dated May 11, 1775. 

PARKS, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Asa Rice s Co., Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; 
marched July 27, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 29, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 9 days, 
including 6 days (130 miles) travel home ; company ordered to march to 
Manchester on an alarm and was discharged at Bennington. Roll dated 
Shrewsbury. 

PARKS, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Lemuel Pomeroy s co., Col. Dickinson s regt. 
commanded by Maj. Clap; pay abstract for wages and mileage home, dated 
July 10, 1777 ; service, 38 days ; mileage for 100 miles allowed said Parks. 

PARKS, JOSEPH. Private, in a company commanded by Lieut. Amos Fairbank, 
Col. Job Cushing s regt. ; entered service Sept. 6, 1777 ; marched Sept. 8, 1777 ; 
service, 2 mos. 24 days, under Brig. Warner; reported furloughed Nov. 29, 
1777 ; company drafted from militia and marched to join Continental Army 
at the Northward. 

PARKS, JOSEPH (also given JOSHUA). Private, Capt. Joseph Fuller s co., Col. 
Samuel Bullard s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 20, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 22 days, at Stillwater, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; 
also, Matross, Capt. Lieut. James Furnivall s detachment drafted from Gen. 
Warner s brigade ; engaged Sept. 10, 1777; discharged Nov. 29, 1777; service, 
2 mos. 20 days, at the Northward ; roll made up for difference in pay between 
line and artillery. 

PARKS, JOSIAH, Weston. Private, Capt. Jesse Wyman s co., Col. Josiah Whit 
ney s regt. ; arrived at destination May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 10, 1777, at 
Point Judith ; service, 2 mos. 9 days, at Rhode Island, including 3 days (50 
miles) travel to place of destination and 5 days travel from place of discharge 
home. 

PARKS, JOSIAH. Private, Capt. John Hartwell s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. ; 
service, 5 days ; mileage (40 miles) allowed from Lincoln to camp and return ; 
company called out at the time of fortifying Dorchester Heights March 4, 
1776; also, receipt dated Lincoln, Sept. 21, 1776, signed by said Parks and 
others belonging to Capt. John Hartwell s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt., 
for wages for service in March, 1776, at the time of taking Dorchester Heights ; 
also, Capt. Moses Harrington s co., Col. Dike s regt. ; muster roll for Dec., 1776- 
Feb.,1777; credited to town of Lincoln ; enlisted Dec. 20, 1776 ; regiment raised 
to serve until March 1, 1777; also, list dated Lincoln, Aug. 14, 1777, of men 
enlisted or drafted to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Capt. 
Samuel Farrar, Jr., to Col. Brooks. 

PARKS, JOSIAH. Private, Capt. George Minot s co., Col. Samuel Bullard s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 16, 1777; discharged Nov. 30, 1777; service, 3 mos. 25 days, in 
Northern department, including 11 days (220 miles) travel home.

Reed s regt. ; engaged Sept. 29, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 7, 1777 ; service, 1 mo.

on an alarm at the Northward.

PARKS, NATHAN. Private, Capt. Joseph Raymond s co., Col. Israel Chapin s regt. ;

turned with empty teams ; said Parlin travelled 19 miles to Cambridge.

home. 

PARLING, AMOS. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to 
resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said 
county; age, 21 yrs. ; stature, 5ft. 9 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, light ; eyes, 
blue; occupation, farmer; engaged for town of Westford; engaged April 25, 
1781; term, 3 years. 

PARLING, ASA. Capt. Abishai Brown s co., Col. John Robinson s regt. ; enlisted 
July 7, 1777 ; service, 5 mos. 28 days, at Rhode Island. 

PARLING, DANIEL. Private, Capt. Thomas Lord s co., Col. Job Cushing s regt.; 
enlisted Sept. 1, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 20, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 27 days, in 
Northern department at the time of taking Gen. Burgoyne, including 7 days 
(135 miles) travel home; travel allowed company from Tarrytown, N. Y., to 
Athol. 

PARLING, ELEAZBR, Concord. Petition dated Camp at Hull, Sept. 17, 1776, signed 
by said Parling and others belonging to battalion stationed at Hull, asking 
for increase and payment of wages; also, Private, Capt. Abishai Brown s co., 
Col. Josiah Whitney s regt. ; service from June 6, 1776, 4 days preceding 
march, to Dec. 1, 1776, 5 mos. 27 days; rolls dated Camp at Hull. 

PARLING, JOHN, Jr. Private, Capt. Joseph Hosmer s (Light Infantry) co. ; com 
pany return endorsed " 1776." 

PARLING, JONAS. Private, Capt. James RusePs co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt.; 
service, 5 days ; company marched to Dorchester March 4, 1776, to reinforce 
the army. 

PARLING, OLIVER, Concord. Private, Capt. Simon Hunt s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; 
company return [year not given] ; said Parling reported as at White Plains; 
also reported as having been sent with the wounded. 

PARLING, SILAS. Private, Capt. Joseph Hosmer s (Light Infantry) co. ; company 
return endorsed " 1776." 

PARLING, SILAS. Capt. Abishai Brown s co., Col. John Robinson s regt. ; enlisted 
July 7, 1777 ; service, 5 mos. 28 days, at Rhode Island. 

PARLING, THADDEUS. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable 
to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for 
said county ; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 4 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, dark ; hair, dark ; 
eyes, dark ; occupation, farmer (also given laborer) ; engaged for town of 
Carlisle; engaged June 10, 1781; term, 3 years; reported rejected. 

PARLIS, SILAS. Private, Capt. David Goodwin s co., Col. Cogswell s regt. ; entered 
service Sept. 23, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1778 ; service, 3 mos. 10 days ; com 
pany detached to guard and fortify posts at and about Boston. 

PARLMER, JOHN. List of men mustered between Jan. 20, 1777, and June 1, 1778, 
by Truman Wheler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co. ; Capt. Watkins s co. ; 
term, 3 years or during war; reported received State bounty. 

PARLMER, PRINCE. Capt. James Perry s co., Col. Sargent s regt. ; order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, Nov. 21, 1775. 

PARLOR, AMOS, Carlisle. List of men raised for the 6 months service and returned 
by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780.

ing to Capt. Thomas Turner s co., for advance pay for 1 month, etc. 

PARLOW, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Ignatius Loring, Jr. s co., Lieut. Col. Put 
nam s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 4, 1781; discharged Dec. 8, 1781; service, 3 mos. 
17 days, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; company raised in Plym 
outh Co. ; regiment raised to reinforce army under Gen. Washington for 3 
months. 

PARLOW, THOMAS, Rochester. Private, Capt. Thomas Turner s co., Col. Thomas

days, at and about Boston; also, Corporal, Capt. William Tupper s co., Col. 
Nathan Sparhawk s regt.; entered service Oct. 25, 1778; discharged Dec. 14, 
1778; service, 1 mo. 19 days, at Boston.

tachment of militia ; entered service July 8, 1777 ; discharged July 20, 1777 ;

missed 97 miles from home. Roll sworn to in Berkshire Co.

Gen. Stark at Still water on the alarm of Oct. 14, 1780. 

PARMELE, AMOS. Corporal, Capt. Aaron Rowley s co., Col. John Brown s detach 
ment of militia ; enlisted June 30, 1777 ; discharged July 21, 1777, near Fort

PABMENTER, CALEB. Corporal, Capt. Enoch Robinson s co. ; engaged Aug. 12, 
1779; discharged Sept. 11 (also given Sept. 12), 1779; service, 1 mo. 1 day 
(also given 1 mo. 2 days) ; company detached from militia to serve at Rhode 
Island for 4 weeks in a regiment under Capt. Samuel Fisher, Commandant. 
Roll sworn to at Attleborough. 

PARMENTER, CALEB. Private, Capt. Moses Willmarth s co., Col. Isaac Dean s 
regt. ; marched July 31, 1780; discharged Aug. 7, 1780; service, 10 days, at 
Rhode Island on the alarm of July 31, 1780. Roll sworn to at Attleborough.

of Attleborough, dated July 5, 1776, for wages due said Parmenter and others 
for service on the alarm caused by the battle of Bunker Hill. 

PARMENTER, DANIEL. Private, Capt. Enoch Noble s co., Col. John Brown s regt. ; 
enlisted June 29, 1777 ; discharged July 28, 1777 ; service, 30 days, in Northern 
department ; mileage from camp home (120 miles) allowed ; company ordered 
out by Brig. Gen. Fellows and Committee of Safety at request of Maj. Gen. 
Schuyler. Roll certified at Sheffield. 

PARMENTER, DANIEL. Private, Capt. John Crawford s co., Col. Job Cushing s 
regt. ; enlisted Sept. 7, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 3 days, 
including 10 days (200 miles) travel home. Roll sworn to in Worcester Co.

Jacobs s regt. ; enlisted July 1, 1778 ; service, 6 mos. 4 days, at Rhode Island,

Tiverton ; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Sudbury for 
service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp July 5, 1780 ; 
discharged Dec. 16, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 21 days, including travel (180 miles) 
home.

detached from militia by order of Gen. Hancock to man forts at and about 
Boston until Nov. 10, 1779, and stationed at Boston under Maj. Nathaniel

returned by E. How to Brig. Gen. Prescott ; said Parmenter drafted from Capt. 
Maynerd s co., of Sudbury, but reported as not having marched.

3, 1779.

Gen. Eleazer Brooks to Maj. Hosmer, dated Lincoln, July 21, 1779; said Par 
menter and others reported as returned for Marlborough by Col. How ; also, 
list of men raised agreeable to resolve of June 9, 1779, as returned by Joseph 
Hosmer, Superintendent for Middlesex Co., Nov. 24, 1779.

of Minute-men, Col. Ephraim Doolittle s regt., which marched April 20, 1775,

agreed to tarry at Dorchester Heights until March 1, 1777.

Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; 
left place of rendezvous April 27, 1775 ; service, 12 days.

regt.; company return endorsed " Octo 1776;" said Parmenter reported as 
sick and as having lost articles in battle. 

PARMENTER, JONAS. Private, Capt. Benjamin Pike s co., Lieut. Col. Calvin 
Smith s (6th) regt.; return for wages for the year 1781; wages allowed said 
Parmenter from Jan. 29, 1781, to Oct. 17, 1781, 8 mos. 17 days; reported died 
Oct. 17, 1781. 

PARMENTER, JONATHAN. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated June 19, 1776; said Parmenter chosen 2d Major, Col. Cyprian How s 
(4th Middlesex Co.) regt. of Mass, militia, in place of Maj. Joseph Smith 
who declined to serve; appointment concurred in by Council June 19, 1776; 
reported commissioned June 19, 1776; also, official record of a ballot by the 
House of Representatives, dated Feb. 25, 1779; said Parmenter chosen 1st 
Major, Col. Cyprian How s (4th Middlesex Co.) regt. of Mass, militia; 
appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 26, 1779 ; reported commissioned 
Feb. 26, 1779. 

PARMENTER, JOSEPH, Hubbardston. Capt. Jonathan Holman s co., Col. Ephraim 
Doolittle s regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Parmenter and 
others, dated Cambridge, June 10, 1775; also, Private, same co. and regt.; 
company return dated Camp Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Charlestown Camp, Winter Hill, Dec. 

21, 1775.

ton ; joined Capt. Adam Wheeler s co., Col. Nixon s regt. ; term, during war.

PARMENTOR, JASON, Bernardston. Private, Capt. Agrippa Wells s co., Col. Asa 
Whitcomb s regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Corporal, Capt.

and travel allowance from place of discharge home, sworn to at Deerfield, 
Dec. 10, 1777 ; mileage for 104 miles allowed said Parmentor ; company served 
at Ticonderoga for 3 mos. from Sept. 1, 1776. 

PARMENTOR, JONATHAN, Jr., Sudbury. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Cudworth s 
co. of Minute-men, Col. Abijah Peirce s regt., which marched on the alarm 
of April 19, 1775 ; service, 1 mo. 7 days. 

PARMENTOR, NATHANIEL, Sudbury. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Cudworth s co. of 
Minute-men, Col. Abijah Peirce s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775 ; service, 8 days. 

PARMENTR, EDMUND, Sudbury. Private, Capt. Aaron Haynes s co. of militia, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge, via Concord ;

PARMENTR, JAMES, Sudbury. Private, Capt. Aaron Haynes s co. of militia, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge, via Concord ; service, 
4 days. 

PARMENTR, RUFUS, Sudbury. Private, Capt. Aaron Haynes s co. of militia, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge, via Concord ; service, 
4 days. 

PARMER, CALEB. Corporal, Lieut. Jabez Colt s co., Col. Rosseter s detachment of 
Berkshire Co. militia; entered service July 17, 1777; discharged July 27, 
1777 ; service, 11 days, at the Northward. Roll dated Richmond. 

FARMER, GERSHOM, Monson. Private, Capt. Freeborn Moulton s co. of Minute- 
men, Col. Danielson s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, 
to Cambridge ; left Cambridge May 5, 1775 ; service, 20 days. 

PARMER, HUMPHREY, Rehoboth (probably). List of men who were drafted to 
serve at Rhode Island for 1 month, dated March 13, 1779. 

PARMER, JAMES, Middleborough. Descriptive list of men raised in Plymouth Co. 
for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable 
to resolve of April 20, 1778; Capt. Wood s co., Col. Sprout s regt.; age, 17 
yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; complexion, light; residence, Middleborough; en 
gaged for town of Middleborough ; arrived at Fishkill July 8, 1778; also, list 
of men returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Brig. 
Gen. John Glover, at Fort Arnold, July 10, 1778. 

PARMER, JOHN, Salem. Descriptive list of officers and crew of the ship " Thomas," 
commanded by Capt. Samuel Ingersoll, dated Salem, Aug. 7, 1780; age, 30 
yrs.; complexion, dark; residence, Salem. 

PARMER, SCIPIO, Bridgewater. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Capt. Nathan Alden s (9th) co., Col. Mitchel s regt., sworn to 
Feb. 20, 1778; residence, Bridgewater; engaged for town of Bridgewater; 
joined Capt. Danforth s co., Col. Whitcomb s regt. ; term, 3 years or during 
war.

charged July 1, 1778 ; service, 5 mos. 15 days ; company detached from militia 
of Hampshire and Worcester counties to guard stores and magazines at Brook- 
field and Springfield. , 

PARMERTER, ABRAHAM, Weston. Private, Capt. Edward Fuller s co., Col. Brooks s 
regt. ; company return endorsed " Octo 1776 ; " said Parmerter reported as sick 
and as having lost articles in battle.

icers, etc., serving in his department [year not given]; said Parmerter ap 
pears among " Blacksmiths inlisted " stationed at Boston.

hawk s regt.; entered service Aug. 21, 1777; discharged Aug. 26,1777; ser 
vice, 11 days, at Bennington on an alarm, including 5 days (102 miles) travel 
home.

1780, as returned by Seth Washburn, Superintendent for Worcester Co.; age, 
19 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, light ; occupation, farmer ; 
engaged for town of Hubbardston ; engaged Feb. 1, 1782; term, 3 years.

Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from Fort

for travel allowance, etc., dated Brookfield, Feb. 17, 1777; 150 miles travel 
allowed said Parmeter. 

PARMETER, ABEL, Sudbury. Private, Capt. Andrew Haskell s co., Col. Thomas 
Marshall s regt. ; service from Aug. 1, 1776, to Nov. 1, 1776, 3 mos. ; also,

of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of

Esq.

21, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; term, 3 years ; also, Capt. Adam Wheeler s co., Col.

Soldier s Fortune, Feb. 15, 1779, and certified at Camp near Peekskill ; enlisted 
March 21, 1777 ; also, Capt. Thomas Barns s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Nixon s

Infantry) co., Col. Nixon s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 18, 1780 ; residence, Hubbardston ; reported dis 
charged March 18, 1780. 

PARMETER, CALEB, Attleborough. Private, Capt. Joseph Cole s co., Col. John 
Jacobs s regt. ; enlisted July 6, 1778 ; service, 5 mos. 27 days, at Rhode Island ; 
enlistment to expire Jan. 1, 1779. 

PARMETER, CALEB. Private, Capt. Stephen Richardson s co. ; marched Sept. 25, 
1777 ; discharged Oct. 29, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 6 days ; company marched from 
Attleborough under command of Col. George Williams on a secret expedition.

son s regts., and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Henry Sherburne s

withdraw."
