PARMOBTB, JOSEPH. Capt. Isaac Sherman s co., Col. Gerrish s regt.; company 
receipt for wages, dated Cambridge, June 24, 1775. 

PARMTER, ABEL. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for Middlesex 
Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield, Aug. 6, 1780; engaged 
for town of Sudbury. 

PARMTER, JACOB. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as re 
ceived of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring 
field, July 14, 1780; age, 18 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 2 in.; complexion, light; 
engaged for town of Framingham ; marched to camp July 14, 1780, under 
command of Capt. Hancock. 

PARNAH, JOHN. Private, Capt. James Prentiss s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; 
pay abstract for travel allowance home, etc., from place of discharge, Saratoga, 
endorsed " Travel from Fort Edward ; " 240 miles travel allowed said Parnah ; 
warrant allowed in Council Feb. 3, 1777. 

PARNAL, BENJAMIN, Medway. Private, Capt. Amos Ellis s co., Col. Benjamin 
Hawse s regt. ; entered service Sept. 25, 1777 ; service to Oct. 31, 1777, 1 mo. 
7 days, at Little Crompton, R. I. ; roll dated Bellingham ; also, list of men 
returned by a committee of the town of Medway April 13, 1778, as having 
rendered service at various times subsequent to April 19, 1775; residence, 
Medway. 

PARNAL, JONAS. Private, Capt. Benjamin Ward, Jr. s co. ; enlisted Jan. 22, 1776 ; 
discharged Nov. 18, 1776; service, 9 mos. 28 days; extra wages allowed said 
Parnal and others for 25 days service at Boston during above term ; company 
raised in Salem and stationed there for defence of seacoast. 

PARNAL, WILLIAM. Private ; list of men returned as serving on main guard under 
Lieut. Col. L. Baldwin at Prospect Hill, dated July 16, 1775.

regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Israel Hutchinson ; company return dated 
Oct. 6, 1775.

PARRAN, . [This name also appears under the form of Panam, Parrin.] 

PARRAN, ALEXANDER, Gloucester. Sergeant, Capt. Nathaniel Warner s co., Col. 
Moses Little s regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 3, 1775; 
service, 3 mos. 6 days; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money 
dated Prospect Hill, Nov. 25, 1775 ; also, petition dated Oct. 12, 1776, signed 
by said Parran, stating that in June, 1775, he was Orderly Sergeant in Capt. 
Nathaniel Warner s co., Col. Little s regt., and was wounded at Bunker Hill 
by a ball going through his collar bone and lodging in his right shoulder, by 
reason of which he was unable to do anything towards supporting himself or 
family, consisting of a wife and four small children, and requesting that relief 
might be granted him ; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Repre 
sentatives, dated Aug. 11, 1777 ; said Parran chosen 3d Lieutenant of a com 
pany of matrosses stationed at Gloucester in the place of Mark Davis who 
declined to serve; appointment concurred in by Council Aug. 11, 1777; re 
ported commissioned Aug. 11, 1777. 

PARRAN, " FRANSWAY." List of men raised in Bristol Co. to serve in the Continen 
tal Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, as attested by James Williams, 
Superintendent for said county, dated Taunton, June 20, 1781 ; engaged for 
town of Dartmouth ; also, list of men raised agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2. 
1780, returned as received by John Burt, at Taunton, April 18, 1781, to be con 
ducted to Springfield and delivered to Col. Shepard ; age, 19 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 6^ in.; complexion, light; occupation, laborer; engaged for town of 
Dartmouth ; term, 3 years. 

PARRANA, JOHN. Boatswain, U. S. brig "General Gates," commanded by Capt. 
John Skimmer; list of men entitled to prize shares [year not given].

Marshall s regt. ; abstract for advance pay for 1 month, etc., due certain men 
who had joined said company subsequent to last previous return ; order for

by Capt. Higgins.

as among crew taken in the ship "La Soye Planter," a prize of the brig 
" Freedom," and thereby prevented from arriving at Boston until Feb. 16, 
1777 ; also reported received pay to Jan. 1, 1777.

town ; enlisted in 1778 from Col. McCobb s (1st Lincoln Co.) regt. ; also, Pri 
vate, Capt. Benjamin Lemont s co., Col. Nathaniel Wade s regt. ; enlisted 
July 4, 1778; service, 3 mos. 5 days, at Rhode Island; enlistment to expire 
Jan. 1, 1779; reported deserted Oct. 10, 1778; also, same co. and regt. ; muster 
roll dated East Greenwich, Sept. 17, 1778; reported sick and absent; also, 
same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated East Greenwich, Sept. 23, 1778.

(27th) regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, list of men raised 
to serve in the Continental Army [year not given]; residence, Gloucester; 
engaged for town of Gloucester.

field, July 13, 1780; age, 43 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; complexion, ruddy; 
engaged for town of Lynn ; marched to camp July 13, 1780, under command

town of Lynn for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched June 
27, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 13, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 28 days, including travel 
(220 miles) home.

(1st) regt., stating that said Parry and other officers had performed duty in camp 
from about July 14, 1775, but had not received Continental commissions and 
asking that said officers be recommended for commissions ; ordered in Coun 
cil Nov. 8, 1775, that said officers be recommended to His Excellency Gen. 
Washington for commissions ; also, communication addressed to His Excel 
lency Gen. Washington, dated Nov. 8, 1775, signed by James Otis, President 
of the Council, recommending said Parry, 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Richardson s 
co., Col. James Frye s regt., and other officers, for commissions in the Conti 
nental Army.

mand of Maj. Andrew Colton ; service, 1 week 3 days; reported enlisted into 
the army April 29, 1775; also, Capt. Gideon Burt s co., Col. Timothy Daniel- 
son s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 28, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 11 days; also, company return dated Roxbury Camp, Oct. 6, 1775; re 
ported " Detacht Quebeck ; " also, Capt. John Morgan s co. ; enlisted Jan. 9, 
1778 ; discharged July 1, 1778 ; service, 5 mos. 22 days ; company detached 
from militia of Hampshire and Worcester counties to guard stores and mag 
azines at Brookfield and Springfield. 

PARSONS, BENJAMIN. List of men taken from the Orderly Book of Col. Israel 
Hutchinson, of the 27th regt., dated Fort Lee; Capt. Low s co. ; reported 
taken prisoner at Fort Washington Nov. 16, 1776. 

PARSONS, BENJAMIN. Seaman, brigantine " Massachusetts," commanded by Capt. 
John Lambert; engaged Dec. 21, 1777. Roll made up for advance wages for 
1 month and sworn to in Suffolk Co.

cruise ; ordered in Council Sept. 2, 1776, that a commission be issued.

said Parsons be commissioned as commander of the schooner "Gloriosa" 
(privateer) , fitted out for a 3 months cruise ; ordered in Council Sept. 17, 1777, 
that a commission be issued. 

PARSONS, DANIEL. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Walter Pyncheon s (1st) co., 1st Hamp

1777 ; service, 3 mos. 9 days, at Ticonderoga ; roll dated Springfield ; also, 1st 
Lieutenant, Capt. John Carpenter s co. of guards; engaged March 11, 1779; 
discharged June 11, 1779 ; service, 3 mos. ; company detached for 3 months 
from time of joining and stationed at Springfield. 

PARSONS, DANIEL. Petition dated Boston, March 21, 1781, signed by William Gee,

commissioned as commander of the schooner "Union " (privateer) ; advised 
in Council March 21, 1781, that a commission be issued.

PARSONS, DAVID, continued. 

recommending said Parsons and two others for any vacancies that might occur 
in the Continental Army as they had served continuously with the forces of 
the Province of Mass. Bay from 1755 to the time of the reduction of Canada, 
attaining the rank of Captains, and being desirous of entering the service of 
the United Colonies.

her from Dec. 4, 1776, to March 4, 1777, said vessel having been taken.

by the residents of Cape Fourchu, N. S., and particularly by Waitstill Lewis, 
who had conveyed them to Massachusetts without charge, and requesting 
that this service be properly recognized.

PARSONS, JOEL. Private, Capt. Abel Dinsmore s co., Col. David Field s regt. ; 
enlisted Aug. 17, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 19, 1777 ; service, 4 days ; company 
marched to the Northward at request of Gen. Gates and was dismissed by 
order of Gen. Lincoln. 

PARSONS, JOEL. Sergeant, Capt. Jonathan Wales s co., Col. Dickinson s (Hamp 
shire Co.) regt.; marched Aug. 17, 1777; service, 8 days, at the Northward; 
company marched to East Hoosuck on the alarm of Aug. 17, 1777, thence to 
Pittsfield, thence guarded Hessian prisoners to Springfield by order of Brig. 
Gen. Fellows; also, Capt. Jonathan Wailes s (Wales s) co., Col. Ezra May s 
regt. ; engaged Sept. 22, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 15, 1777 ; service, 28 days, on 
expedition to Stillwater and Saratoga, including travel (121 miles) home ; 
also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Joseph Clapp s (15th) co., Col. Israel Chapin s (2d 
Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers ; commissioned July 6, 
1778. 

PARSONS, JOHN. Receipt dated Gloucester, Sept. 28, 1775, for 4 weeks billeting 
received of Michael Farley, Muster Master and Paymaster of men raised in 
Essex Co. for defence of seacoast ; said Parsons and others stationed at 
Gloucester; also, Private, Capt. Daniel Warner s (1st) co. ; enlisted July 19, 
1775 ; service to Dec. 31, 1775, 5 mos. 26 days ; reported as serving in the room 
of Ebenezer Wollon who was killed " in the action with Linzey ; " company 
stationed at Gloucester for defence of seacoast. 

PARSONS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Isaac Martin s co., Col. Ezra Wood s regt. ; ser 
vice, 22 days ; company marched to Rhode Island April 17, 1777, and served 
until May 7, 1777, under Maj. Gen. Spencer. Roll sworn to at Boston. 

PARSONS, JOHN. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Wolcott s (10th) co. (South co. in 
Sandisfield), 1st Berkshire Co. regt. of Mass, militia; list of officers chosen 
by the several companies in said regiment, as returned by Mark Hopkins and 
others, field officers, dated Great Barrington, March 26, 1776 ; ordered in Coun 
cil May 6, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned 
May 6, 1776 ; also, Lieutenant, Capt. Elijah Deming s co., Col. Ashley s (Berk 
shire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 8, 1777 ; discharged July 28, 1777 ; ser 
vice, 20 days ; company called out by Maj . Gen. Schuylar and ordered to march 
to Fort Edward. 

PARSONS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Simeon Clap s co., in a regiment commanded by 
Col. David Wells; enlisted May 10, 1777; discharged July 10, 1777; service, 2 
mos. 9 days, including travel home ; company marched on a 2 months expedi 
tion to Ticonderoga; also, Capt. Jonathan Wales s co., Col. Dickinson s 
(Hampshire Co.) regt. ; marched Aug. 17, 1777 ; service, 8 days, at the North 
ward ; company marched to East Hoosuck on the alarm of Aug. 17, 1777, 
thence to Pittsfield, thence guarded Hessian prisoners to Springfield by order 
of Brig. Gen. Fellows. 

PARSONS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Benjamin Read s co., Col. John Rand s regt. ; 
enlisted July 25, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 2 mos. 26 days, in 
cluding 10 days (200 miles) travel home ; company stationed at West Point ; 
regiment raised in Worcester Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months. 

PARSONS, JOHN. Private, Capt. Jordan Parker s co., Col. Samuel McCobb s regt. ; 
enlisted May 26, 1781; discharged Dec. 1, 1781; service, 6 mos. 4 days, at the 
Eastward. Roll sworn to at Georgetown. 

PARSONS, JONATHAN, Cape Ann. Private, Capt. John Row s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Bridge s (27th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted June 10, 1775; 
service, 1 mo. 24 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order

* establishment in Col. Baldwin s regt., approved by Brig. Gen. W. Heath in

mander of the brigantine " Defiance " (privateer) ; ordered in Council Jan. 4, 
1779, that a commission be issued.

for town of Granville; joined Capt. Keep s co., Col. Shepherd s regt. ; term, 
3 years (also given during war) ; also, Private, Capt. Caleb Keep s co., Col. 
"William Shepard s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
March 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; also, same co. and regt. ; return dated Jan. 31, 
1778; mustered by State and Continental Muster Masters; also, (late) Capt. 
Keep s co. commanded by Lieut. John "Wright, Col. Shepard s (3d) regt. ; 
muster roll for July and Aug., 1778 ; also, same co. and regt. ; muster rolls for 
Oct. and Nov., 1778, dated Providence; also, Lieut. Col. Ebenezer Sprout s 
co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Provi 
dence; enlisted March 1, 1777 ; reported transferred to light infantry co. ; also, 
Capt. John Wright s (Light Infantry) co., Col. Shepard s regt. ; muster roll 
for March and April, 1779, dated Providence; also, Capt. Webb s co., Col. 
Shepard s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to March 1, 1780; also, Capt. George Webb s (Light Infantry) co., Col. 
Shepard s (4th) regt. ; return made up for the year 1780, dated West Point ; 
reported discharged March 1, 1780.

army into three grand divisions to consist of two brigades each ; said Parsons s

in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Roxbury ; service, 5 days.

rnos. 29 days as Corporal, 3 mos. 2 days as Sergeant ; also, Corporal, same co.

Camp near Peekskill, Feb. 16, 1779; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for

PARTRIDGE, NATHAN, Falmouth, Cumberland Co. Private, Capt. John Brackett s 
co., Col. Edmund Phinney s (31st) regt. ; billeting allowed from date of en 
listment, May 12, 1775, to date of marching from Falmouth to headquarters, 
July 3, 1775 ; credited with 52 days allowance ; also, company return dated 
Sept. 29, 1775; also, Capt. James Johnson s co., Col. Phinney s regt.; order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Fort No. 2, Cambridge, Oct. 
25, 1775 ; also, list of men returned by a committee for settling disputes between 
towns as to soldiers credited to them ; said Partridge claimed by Falmouth 
and Hingham ; allowed to Hingham ; also, copy of a letter from Capt. Sabin 
Mann to Col. Benjamin Hawes, dated Medfield, Sept. 8, 1777, taken from 
Medfield militia records, transmitting a return of men belonging to Falmouth, 
Cumberland Co., engaged to serve in the Continental Army for the town of 
Medfield in Capt. Lain s co., Col. Alden s regt., and asking that the names of 
said Partridge and others who had been returned to the credit of Medfield on 
a return dated May 23, 1777, be erased from said return, they having been 
adjudged to the town of Hingham ; also, Private, Capt. Daniel Lane s co., 
Col. Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 10, 
1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Falmouth; credited to town of Hingham; 
also, Capt. Daniel Lain s co., Col. Alden s regt. ; return dated Albany, Jan. 
14, 1778 ; mustered by County Muster Master Winslow and by a Continental 
Muster Master; also, Capt. Daniel Lane s co., (late) Col. Ichabod Alden s 
(6th) regt. ; return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and 
who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified at 
Cherry Valley, Feb. 24, 1778; also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for March 
and April, 1779, dated Cherry Valley; enlisted May 10, 1777; enlistment, 
3 years; also, Capt. Holden s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 10, 1780. 

PARTRIDGE, NATHAN, Medfield. Private, Capt. Ephraim Chenery s (Medfield) 
co., Col. John Smith s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 4 days ; also, Capt. Sabin Mann s co. of Medfield militia ; return of 
train band with equipments, dated June 10, 1776 ; age, 37 yrs. ; also, list of 
men credited with turns of service "Dune in the Last Wars in the Days

by Capt. Sabin Mann and Philip Blake, Clerk; also, Private; list of men 
belonging to Capt. Sabin Mann s co. who marched to Providence, R. I., and

Metcalf Dec. 8, and Dec. 9, 1776 ; service, 14 days; also, Private, Capt. Sabin 
Mann s co. ; marched Dec. 8, 1776 ; discharged Dec. 21, 1776 ; service, 14 days, 
under Maj. James Metcalf ; company marched to Rhode Island on the alarm 
of Dec. 8, 1776 ; also, list of men belonging to Capt. Sabin Mann s co. drafted 
to march to Rhode Island and there serve for one calendar month at or near

dated Wrentham, July 14, 1777, and by order from Brig. Lovell ; said Par 
tridge drafted but paid fine of 3 in lieu of service ; also, list dated Sept. 16, 
1777, of men belonging to Capt. Mann s co. drafted to complete quota for the 
Continental Army, but who paid money in lieu of service ; said Partridge 
reported as having paid 15.

Glover, at Springfield, July 13, 1780; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in.; com 
plexion, ruddy ; engaged for town of Shrewsbury ; marched to camp July 13,

months men raised by the town of Shrewsbury for service in the Continental 
Army during 1780; marched to camp July 10, 1780; discharged Dec. 4, 1780; 
service, 5 mos. 3 days, including travel (180 miles) home.

PATCH, DAVID, Hadley (also given Charlestown, N. H.). Private, Capt. Eliakim

Col. Ward s regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; reported " On 
Command to Quebec; " also, certificate dated Hadley, June 14, 1776, signed 
by Capt. Moses Kellogg, certifying that said Patch, a soldier in his company 
in " the Last Years Campaign," had received a gun belonging to Enos Smith, 
of Hadley, and had carried the same with him to Canada in Col. Arnold s 
detachment, where said Patch was killed or taken prisoner, and that the 
owner of the gun had not received any pay therefor ; also, petition of Enos 
Smith, of Hadley, for compensation for loss of a gun, stating that said Patch 
was in Capt. Eliakim Smith s co., Col. Jonathan Ward s regt., at the time 
the gun was delivered to him.

PATCH, NATHAN, Damariscotta. Order dated Cambridge, June 30, 1775, signed by 
Lieut. Col. William Bond, for accoutrements for the use of said Patch and 
others belonging to Capt. Benjamin Bowne s co., Col. Thomas Gardner s 
regt. ; also, Private; list of men returned as serving on main guard under 
Lieut. Col. L. Baldwin at Prospect Hill, dated July 16, 1775; also, Capt. 
Benjamin Bowne s co., Lieut. Col. William Bond s (late Col. Thomas Gard 
ner s) 37th regt. ; company return dated Prospect Hill, Oct. 7, 1775. 

PATCH, NATHAN, Worcester. List of men drafted from Worcester Co. militia to 
march to Horse Neck under command of Col. Denny [year not given], but 
who failed to join regiment ; reported drafted from town of Worcester ; drafted 
into Capt. Ebenezer Level s co. . 

PATCH, NATHAN. Private, Capt. David Chadwick s co. ; service, 5 days; company 
marched to Bennington on an alarm ; State pay allowed by resolve of Sept. 
23, 1777. 

PATCH, NEHEMIAH, Ipswich. Private, Capt. Moses Jewett s troop of horse, Col. 
John Baker s (3d Essex Co.) regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 
1775, to Medford ; service, 3 days. 

PATCH, NEHEMIAH, Wenham. Private, Capt. Robert Perkins s co. of Light Horse 
Volunteers, 3d Essex Co. regt. ; enlisted Sept. 27, 1777 ; marched Sept. 30, 1777 ; 
discharged Nov. 7, 1777 ; service, 43 days, in a regiment commanded by Maj. 
Charles Smith in Northern department and in guarding Lieut. Gen. Bur- 
goyne s troops to Prospect Hill ; company discharged at Cambridge. 

PATCH, NICHOLAS. Private, Capt. Asa Prince s co., Col. Danforth Reyes s regt.; 
enlisted Aug. 15, 1777 ; discharged Jan. 3, 1778 ; service, 4 months 18 days, at 
Rhode Island, including travel home ; roll dated Danvers ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay roll dated Providence, Dec. 31, 1777. 

PATCH, OLIVER, Groton. Corporal, Capt. Asa Lawrence s co. of Minute-men, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge ; ser 
vice, 6 days ; reported enlisted into the army ; also, Sergeant, Capt. Asa Law 
rence s co., Col. William Prescott s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; 
enlisted April 25, 1775; service, 98 days; also, company return dated Oct. 6, 
1775 ; also, order for- bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, 
Oct. 30, 1775; also, memorandum of firelocks received of sundry officers and 
soldiers; date of delivery, Jan. 2, 1776; also, account showing sums of money 
to be paid from the public treasury to sundry persons for losses sustained at 
battles of Lexington and Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed in Council June 13, 
1776. 

PATCH, REUBEN, Wenham. Private, Capt. Richard Dodge s (3d) co., Lieut. Col. 
Loammi Baldwin s (late Col. Gerrish s) 38th regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 
1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 13 weeks 1 day; also, pay abstract dated 
Camp at Chelsea, Sept. 1, 1775; also, company return dated Chelsea Camp, 
Oct. 2, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Chelsea, Dec. 27, 1775 ; also, Capt. Dodge s co. ; list of recruits for the new 
establishment in Col. Baldwin s regt., approved by Brig. Gen. W. Heath in 
Camp at Cambridge, Dec. 30, 1775; also, Capt. Richard Dodge s co., Col. 
Baldwin s (26th) regt. ; abstract for advance pay for Jan. 1776, etc.; also, 
same co. and regt. ; pay abstracts for Feb.-June, 1776 ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., on return home at close of 
campaign in 1776, sworn to in Suffolk Co., May 6, 1777; also, Private, Capt. 
Porter s co., Col. Tupper s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Wenham ; credited to town of 
Wenham; also, Capt. Billy Porter s co., Col. Ebenezer Francis s regt. ; sub 
sistence allowed from date of enlistment, Jan. ![?"], 1777, to time of arrival

PATCH, REUBEN, continued. 

at Bennington ; credited with 83 days allowance ; 240 miles travel allowed 
said Patch; company to march March 12, 1777; also, Capt. Porter s co., Col. 
Benjamin Tupper s regt. ; muster roll for Jan., 1779, dated West Point; re 
ported on command at the Lines; also, Corporal, same co. and regt. ; Conti 
nental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; 
reported as serving 6 mos. as Private, 6 mos. as Corporal; also, descriptive 
list dated Jan. 10, 1780 [81] ; Capt. Nehemiah Emerson s co., 10th Mass. regt. ; 
rank, Corporal; age, 23 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; hair, 
brown; residence, Wenham ; engaged Jan. 1, 1777, by Capt. Porter; term, 
during war; also, Corporal, Col. Benjamin Tupper s (10th) regt.; service 
from Jan. 1, 1781, 24 mos. 

PATCH, RICHARD, Beverly. Private, Capt. Samuel Flint s co., Col. Samuel John 
son s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 25, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 
19 days, at the Northward, including 13 days (260 miles) travel home ; also, 
same co. and regt.; pay abstract for mileage from Scarsdale, N. Y., home; 
mileage for 260 miles allowed said Patch ; warrant allowed in Council July 
27, 1778. 

PATCH, ROBERT, Kittery. Private, Capt. Samuel Leighton s co., Col. James Scam- 
mon s (30th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 3, 1775; ser 
vice, 3 mos. 6 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775], including 
abstract of pay to last of July, 1775 ; also, order for bounty coat or its equiva 
lent in money dated Cambridge, Oct. 28, 1775. 

PATCH, ROBERT, Kittery. List of men mustered subsequent to Feb. 8, 1777, by 
Joseph Bragdon, Jr., Muster Master for York Co., dated York, Feb. 20, 1777 ; 
Capt. Burbank s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; reported received State 
bounty ; also, Private, Capt. Silas Burbank s co., Col. Ebenezer Sprout s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Feb. 4, 1778; 
reported deserted Feb. 4, 1778 ; also, Capt. Burbank s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s 
regt. ; return dated Camp near Valley Forge, Jan. 23, 1778 ; residence, Kit 
tery ; credited to town of Kittery ; mustered by Esq. Wells. 

PATCH, ROBERT. Private, Capt. Joseph Rea s co. ; entered service Aug. 5, 1776 ; 
service, 2 mos. 23 days, in defence of seacoast ; company ordered to serve at 
the Lines at Beverly and was discharged Oct. 28, 1776. 

PATCH, ROBERT. Private, Capt. Silas Wild s co., Col. Edmund Phinney s regt. ; 
muster roll dated Garrison at Fort George, Dec. 8, 1776 ; enlisted Jan. 1, 1776 ; 
reported re-engaged Nov. 29, 1776. 

PATCH, SAMUEL, Chesterfield (also given Worthington) . Return of men raised to 
serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Benjamin Bonney s (4th Chester 
field) co. ; residence, Chesterfield ; engaged for town of Chesterfield ; joined 
Capt. Bartlett s co. ; term, 3 years; also, Private, Lieut. Col. Millen s co., 
Col. James Wesson s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
April 28, .1777, to June 5, 1778 ; residence, Worthington ; credited to town of 
Chesterfield; also, Capt. Samuel Bartlett s co., Col. Wesson s regt.; return 
of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777 ; reported died June 5, 1778. 

PATCH, SAMUEL, Ipswich. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, 
at Springfield, July 7, 1780; age, 28 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, 
dark; engaged for town of Ipswich; arrived at Springfield July 6, 1780; 
marched to camp July 7, 1780, under command of Capt. Dix ; also, list of men 
raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as hav 
ing passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay 
roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Ipswich for service in the Conti-

PATCH, SAMUEL, continued. 

nental Army during 1780; inarched June 22, 1780; discharged Dec. 11, 1780;

PATCH, SAMUEL, Kittery (also given Shapleigh) . List of men mustered by Joseph 
Bragdon, Jr., Muster Master for York Co., dated York, March 31, 1777 ; Capt. 
Silas Burbenk s co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; reported received State and 
Continental bounties; also, Private, Capt. Silas Burbank s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Sprout s regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, 
to March 22, 1780; reported deserted March 22, 1780; also, Capt. Burbank s 
co., Col. Samuel Brewer s regt. ; return dated Camp near Valley Forge, Jan. 
23, 1778 ; residence, Kittery ; enlisted for town of Kittery ; mustered by Capt. 
Bragdon ; also, list of men entitled to $20 or 200 acres of land, agreeable to 
resolve of March 5, 1801 ; residence, Shapleigh. 

PATCH, SAMUEL, Stow. Captain, Col. Prescott s regt. ; return of officers, dated 
May 25, 1775 ; ordered in Provincial Congress May 26, 1775, that said officers 
be commissioned; also, certificate dated Cambridge, June 18, 1775, signed by 
said Patch, Captain, Col. Prescott s regt., certifying that certain men in his 
company had received pouches for which he promised to be accountable ; 
also, Captain, Col. Prescott s regt.; company return dated Oct. 7, 1775; also, 
certificate dated Nov. 30, 1775, signed by said Patch, Captain, and Joshua 
Brown, Lieutenant, both of Col. William Prescott s regt., certifying that 
they had lost clothing at Bunker Hill June 17, 1775; certificate annexed, 
signed by Col. William Prescott, certifies that said officers were in the en 
gagement at Bunker Hill June 17, 1775; amounts allowed in House of Repre 
sentatives April -, 1776. 

PATCH, SAMUEL. 1st Lieutenant, Capt. John Farley s (2d) co., 3d Essex Co. regt. 
of Mass, militia ; list of officers chosen by the several companies in said regi 
ment, as returned by Jonathan Cogswell, Jr., and others, field officers, dated 
Ipswich, May 6, 1776; ordered in Council May 7, 1776, that said officers be 
commissioned; reported commissioned May 7, 1776; also, 1st Lieutenant, 
Capt. Stephen Perkins s co., Col. Jonathan Cogswell, Jr. s regt. ; general 
return dated Ipswich, Sept. 30, 1776, made by Brig. Michael Farley to Maj. 
Gen. James Warren, of officers of a regiment drafted from said Farley s bri 
gade and ordered to march to Horse Neck, agreeable to resolve of Sept. 12, 
1776 ; company drafted from 3d Essex Co. regt. ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. 
Stephen Perkins s co., Col. Cogswell s regt.; engaged Sept. 22, 1776; dis 
charged Nov. 16, 1776 ; service, 2 mos. 7 days, including 12 days (250 miles) 
travel home ; roll dated North Castle. 

PATCH, SIMON, Ash by. Copy of a list of men who voluntarily enlisted in Sept., 
1776, to serve for 2 months at New York and served accordingly ; also, Private, 
Capt. Thomas Warrin s co., Col. Brooks s regt. ; company return dated Oct. 
31, 1776, and endorsed " White Plains " ; reported wounded. 

PATCH, STEPHEN, Ashby. Private, Capt. Samuel Stone s co. of Minute-men, Col. 
William Prescott s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; ser 
vice, 18i days; also, copy of a list of men who enlisted Jan. 29, 1776, for the 
term of 2 months or who procured others to serve in their stead ; also, copy of 
a list of men drafted Aug. 19, 1777, to serve for 3 months. 

PATCH, STEPHEN, Ipswich. Private, Capt. John Robinson s co., Col. William 
Turner s regt. of 5 months levies raised in Essex Co. for service at Rhode 
Island ; enlisted July 15, 1781 ; discharged Nov. 27, 1781 ; service, 4 mos. 17 
days, including travel (5 days) home. 

PATCH, STEPHEN. Sailor, ship "Eagle," commanded by Capt. William Groves; 
descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to June 17, 1780 ; stature, 5 ft. 2 in. ; 
complexion, light.

PATCH, THOMAS. Private, Capt. Christopher Banister s co., Col. Dayid Weels s 
(Wells s) regt. ; enlisted May 8, 1777 ; discharged July 8, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 

7 days, on expedition to Ticonderoga, including travel (140 miles) home ; also, 
Capt. Benjamin Bonney s co., Col. John Dickerson s regt. ; enlisted Aug. 17, 
1777 ; discharged Aug. 22, 1777 ; service, 8 days ; company marched to Ben- 
nington Aug. 17, 1777, on an alarm to reinforce army near that place ; also, 
Capt. Benjamin Bonney s co., Col. Ezra May s regt. ; enlisted Sept. 20, 1777; 
discharged Oct. 14, 1777 ; service, 29 days, on expedition to Stillwater, includ 
ing travel (100 miles) home; roll dated Chesterfield. 

PATCH, TIMOTHY, Tewksbury. Private, Capt. Peter Coburn s co., Col. Ebenezer 
Bridge s (27th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted July 13, 1775 ; 
service, 18 days; also, company return dated Sept. 26, 1775; also, company 
receipts for wages for Sept. and Oct., 1775, dated Cambridge; also, order for 
bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge Camp, Nov. 20, 1775. 

PATCH, WILLIAM, Beverly. Private, Capt. John Dodge s co., Col. Jacob Gerrish s 
regt. of guards; enlisted July 12, 1778; discharged Dec. 16, 1778; service, 5 
mos. 5 days, at Winter Hill ; also, Capt. Jeremiah Putnam s co., Col. Nathan 
Tyler s regt. ; enlisted July 20, 1779; service to Dec. 1, 1779,4 mos. 11 days, at 
Khode Island; also, same co. and regt. ; payroll for Dec., 1779, allowing 1 mo. 
5 days service at Rhode Island, travel (100 miles) included ; also, Capt. 
Benjamin Peabody s co., Col. Wade s regt. ; entered service July 5, 1780; dis 
charged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 3 mos. 18 days, including 12 days (240 miles) 
travel home ; regiment raised in Essex Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 
3 months. 

PATE, EPHBAIM, Plymouth. Private, Capt. Edward Sparrow s co., Col. Nathan 
Tyler s regt. ; enlisted July 11, 1779 ; discharged Dec. 15, 1779 ; service, 5 mos. 

8 days, at Rhode Island; also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Dec., 1779, 
allowing 1 mo. 3 days service at Rhode Island, travel (55 miles) included. 

PATE, EPHBAIM, Plymouth. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Con 
tinental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 9, 1780; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 2 in.; com 
plexion, light; engaged for town of Plymouth ; arrived at Springfield July 8, 
1780 ; marched to camp July 9, 1780, under command of Lieut. Jackson, of the 
artillery ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by 
Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of 
Plymouth for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched to camp 
July 3, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 9, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 18 days, including travel 
(240 miles) home. 

PATE, JOHN, Plymouth. Fifer, Capt. Judah Alden s co., Col. John Bailey s regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to March 17, 
1780; residence, Plymouth. 

PATE, PETER, Abington. Private, Capt. Edward Cobb s co., Col. Titcomb s regt. ; 
pay abstract for travel allowance, etc. ; travel to and from camp (100 miles) 
allowed said Pate ; service in camp, 2 mos. ; company marched to Bristol, 
R. I., April 21, 1777. [See Peter Bate.] 

PATEE, JOHN, Plymouth. Private, Capt. Thomas Mayhew s co., Col. Theophilus 
Cotton s regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 8 days; also, company return dated Oct. 7, 1775; also, order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury, Nov. 8, 1775. 

PATEE, LEVI. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Washburn s co., Col. Eleazer Brooks s regt. 
of guards ; enlisted Nov. 7, 1777 ; service to Feb. 3, 1778, 2 mos. 26 days, at 
Cambridge.

coat or its equivalent in money dated Winter Hill, Dec. 25, 1775. 

PATEGRENO, MANUEL, Boston. List of men belonging to 4th co., 3d Mass, regt., 
who enlisted for the war, taken from Lieut. James Davis s book ; reported 
enlisted in 1779; also, Private, Capt. Prichard sco., Col. John Greaton sregt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; 
residence, Boston. 

PATENGAL, DANIEL, Duxbury. Private, Capt. Benjamin Wadsworth s (2d Dux- 
bury) co. of militia, Col. James Warren s (Plymouth Co.) regt., which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 3 days. 

PATERIGE, ABEL. Descriptive list of men raised for Continental service, as 
returned by Seth Washburn, Superintendent for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Crowl s 
co., Col. Denney s regt. ; age, 17 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 2 in. ; complexion, light ; 
engaged for town of Ward ; marched July 14, 1779. 

PATERIGE, SIMEON, Franklin. Descriptive list of men raised in Suffolk Co. to rein 
force the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to resolve of 
June 9, 1779, returned as received of Maj. Badlam, by Hezekiah Read Miller, 
at Dorchester, July 19, 1779, to be delivered to Justin Ely, Commissioner, at 
Springfield; Capt. Farbanks s (Fairbanks s) co., Col. Haws s regt.; age, 21 
yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 10 in.; hair, brown; eyes, blue; occupation, husbandman; 
nationality, American ; residence, Franklin ; engaged for town of Franklin. 

PATERSON, ABRAHAM. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Cousens s co., (late) Maj. Little- 
field s detachment of York Co. militia ; entered service July 6, 1779 ; dis 
charged Aug. 24, 1779; service, 1 mo. 19 days, on Penobscot expedition. 

PATERSON, ADAM, Amherst. Capt. Archelaus Towne s co., Col. Bridge s regt.; 
receipt for advance pay, signed by said Paterson and others, dated Cambridge, 
July 6, 1775 ; also. Private, same co. and regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; 
enlisted May 1, 1775; service, 3 mos. 8 days. 

PATERSON, ANDREW. Private, Capt. Manasseh Sawyer s co., Col. Dike s regt. ; 
abstract for gun and blanket money, dated Dorchester, Feb. 12, 1777 ; also, 
same co. and regt. ; muster roll for Dec., 1776-Feb., 1777 ; credited to town of 
Princeton ; enlisted Dec. 14, 1776 ; regiment raised to serve until March 1, 
1777. 

PATERSON, CHARLES. Lieutenant, Capt. James Campbell s co., Col. John Ashley, 
Jr. s (Berkshire Co.) regt.; engaged Oct. 14, 1781; discharged Oct. 19, 1781; 
service, 10 days, including 4 days (80 miles) travel home : company marched 
to Saratoga Oct. 14, 1781, at request of Gen. Stark on an alarm. Roll sworn 
to at Sheffield. 

PATERSON, DAVID, Framingham. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve 
of June 5, 1780, returned as received by Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent 
for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield, Aug. 6, 
1780; engaged for town of Framingham; also, list of men raised for the 6 
months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780. 

PATERSON, DAVID, Greenwich. Private, Capt. Jonathan BardwelPs co., Col. David 
Brewer s (9th) regt. ; company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

PATERSON, JACOB, Barre. Private, Capt. Benjamin Nye s co. ; enlisted Sept. 26, 
1777; discharged Oct, 18, 1777; service, 29 days, including travel (128 miles) 
home ; company marched under command of Maj. Jonas Wilder to reinforce 
Northern army for 30 days.

PATERSON, JACOB. Private, Capt. Dan. Haws s co., Col. Samuel Holden Parsons s 
(10th) regt. ; enlistment agreement in which said Paterson and others engaged 
to serve until Jan. 15 " next ; " reported enlisted Dec. 5, 1775, and forwarded 
to camp by John Caldwell, one of enlistment committee for Worcester Co. 

PATERSON, JOHN, Lenox. Colonel ; general return of said Paterson s regt. showing 
field and company officers; ordered in Provincial Congress May 27, 1775, that 
commissions be delivered said officers ; also, Colonel, 26th regt. ; engaged May 
7, 1775 ; service to Aug. 1, 1775, 3 mos. 2 days ; also, Colonel ; list of field and 
staff officers appearing on a return of Capt. David Noble s co., dated Oct. 6, 
1775 ; also, Brigadier General ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported as serving 1 mo. 20 days as 
Colonel, 34 mos. 10 days as General. 

PATERSON, JOHN, New Rutland. Private, Capt. Nathan Hamilton s co., Col. 
Samuel Brewer s regt. ; service from Aug. 3, 1776, to Sept. 30, 1776, 1 mo. 29 
(also given 1 mo. 28) days ; also, same co. ; company receipt for wages for Oct., 
1776, dated Ticonderoga Mills ; also, Capt. Hamilton s co., Col. Brewer s regt. ; 
pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from Fort Edward home, dated Brook- 
field, Feb. , 1777; said Paterson credited with allowance for 8^ days (170 
miles) travel. 

PATERSON, JOHN, Salem. Gunner, ship " Essex " (privateer) , commanded by Capt. 
John Cathcart; descriptive list of officers and crew, sworn to in Suffolk Co., 
June 12, 1780; age, 33 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; residence, Salem. 

PATERSON, JOHN, Scarborough. Fifer, Capt. John Rice s co., Col. Edmund 
Phinny s regt. ; company return dated Sept. 29, 1775 ; enlisted May 15, 1775. 

PATERSON, JOHN. Matross, Capt. Treadwell s co., Col. Crane s regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from April 6, 1777, to June 20, 1777 ; reported 
enlisted into another regiment June 20, 1777. 

PATERSON, JONATHAN. Return made by the Selectmen of Northfield of men en 
gaged by a committee of said town to serve in the Continental Army for 3 
years or during the war, who had been receipted for with other recruits at 
South Hadley, May 13, 1781, by Ithamar Goodman, in behalf of Noah Good 
man, Superintendent for Hampshire Co. ; said Paterson received 90 bounty 
for enlisting to serve 3 years ; also, descriptive list of men raised in Hamp 
shire Co. to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by Noah Goodman, 
Superintendent; age, 33 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in.; complexion, light; hair, 
light ; occupation, carpenter ; engaged for town of Northfield ; engaged April 
21, 1781; term, 3 years; also, Corporal, Capt. Sylvanus Smith s (1st) co., 5th 
Mass. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. David Cobb ; muster rolls for Jan. and 
Feb., 1783; term, during war; reported succeeded by Jacob Dascomb. 

PATERSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Aaron Rowley s co., Col. John Ashley s de 
tachment of Berkshire Co. militia ; enlisted July 22, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 
13, 1777 ; service, 23 days, at Stillwater. 

PATERSON, JOSEPH. List of 9 months men mustered by Thomas Newhall, Muster 
Master for Worcester Co. ; Col. Rand s regt. ; engaged for town of Fitchburg ; 
mustered Aug. 6, 1779. 

PATERSON, JOSEPH. Sergeant, Capt. Nathaniel Cousens s co., (late) Maj. Little- 
field s detachment of York Co. militia; entered service July 6, 1779; dis 
charged Aug. 24, 1779; service, 1 mo. 19 days, on Penobscot expedition. 

PATERSON, ROBERT. Private, Capt. Moses McFarland s co. of invalids stationed 
at Boston, Col. Nicola s regt. ; inspection return dated Aug. 1, 1780; reported 
discharged July 18, 1780.

PATERSON, ROBERT. Receipt dated Uxbridge, April 2, 1781, for bounty paid said 
Paterson by Joseph Daniels, Chairman of a class of the town of Uxbridge, to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; also, descriptive list of 
men raised to serve in the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 
1780, a s returned by Seth Washburn, Superintendent; Capt. Taft s co., Col. 
Tyler s regt. ; age, 40 years; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; occupa 
tion, farmer; engaged for town of Uxbridge; engaged Feb. 19,1781; term, 3 
years; also, return of the sick belonging to 1st brigade in hospital at New 
Windsor, dated Dec. 24, 1781 ; 4th Mass. regt.

for mileage to and from camp [year not given] ; mileage for 150 miles allowed 
said Paterson.

folk Co., June 12, 1780; age, 27 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; residence, Boston.

Shirley ; residence, Temple ; enlisted May 15, 1775 ; mustered July 11, 1775.

PATINGALL, DANIEL. Return of company officers of Col. Dike s regt., showing 
number of men present under them and also those not joined, dated Dor 
chester, Sept. 21, 1776; said Patingall, with others, raised for Capt. Joseph 
Stetson s co. but reported as not having joined.

nard s co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks s (7th) regt. ; muster roll for May, 1781,

days, including travel (96 miles) home ; company marched Aug. 21, 1777, to

PATREQ, JOHN. Attestation dated Damariscotta, June 20, 1780, signed by Jos. 
Rust, Town Clerk, that said Patreg had personally appeared before him and 
sworn to the fact that he had lost his gun while in service as a soldier in 
Capt. Plumer s co., Col. McCobb s regt., on the expedition against Major- 
bagaduce in 1779, and was unable to recover the same.

as returned by Capt. Benjamin Evans, sworn to in Essex Co., Feb. 13, 1778;

co., Col. Hole s regt. ; term, 3 years; reported engaged for New Hampshire.

PATTEN, JOHN. Petition signed by Samuel Gail and Pickering Collings, part 
owners of the schooner "Spring Bird" (privateer), asking that said Patten 
be commissioned as commander of said vessel, fitted out for a 3 months cruise ; 
ordered in Council March 30, 1779, that a commission be issued ; also, peti 
tion dated Boston, April 4, 1780, signed by Richard Hinckly, in behalf of 
Joseph Lee & Co., asking that said Patten be commissioned as commander 
of the brig " Spit-fire " (privateer) , fitted out for a 3 months cruise ; ordered 
in Council April 4, 1780, that a commission be issued; also, Commander, 
brigantine "Spit-fire" (privateer) ; return showing number of prisoners, com- 
"prising officers and crews of 5 privateers belonging to Salem, Marblehead, and 
Cape Ann, taken by a British ship of war, accompanying a petition to the 
General Court asking that measures be taken to effect their release [year not 
given] ; alto, petition dated Boston, April 9, 1781, signed by Job Prince, Jr., 
in behalf of Andrew Cabot and others, of Beverly, asking that said Patten be 
commissioned as commander of the brigantine "Active" (privateer) ; advised 
in Council April 9, 1781, that a commission be issued.

2 days.

PATTERSON, . [This name also appears under the form of Partson, Paterson, Pat-

PATTERSON, . General order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 19, 1776, 

taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; Lieut. Col. Pallisser, 2d 
Engineer, ordered to take the direction of the works upon Mt. Independence 
with said Patterson, Captain, and others, as his assistants. 

PATTERSON, . Return of sentences by a general court-martial held at Albany, 

Col. Wain (Van) Schaick, President, appearing in a general order dated 
Headquarters, Ticonderoga, Nov. 12, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Whee 
lock s Orderly Book; said Patterson, Captain, and other officers of Col. 
Dayton s regt., tried on charge of being concerned in the embezzlement of 
certain effects from Sergt. John Johnson ; said officers reported as acquitted 
with honor, the court being unanimously of the opinion that the charge was 
malicious and groundless ; the acquittal was approved by His Excellency 
Gen. Washington, who ordered the testimony of his approbation to be inserted 
in the general orders of the Northern army. 

PATTERSON, . Lieutenant Colonel, Col. Porter s (Hampshire Co.) regt. ; list 

of officers [year not given].

PATTERSON, DAVID. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Hickok s co., Lieut. Col. Sears s

PATTERSON, EBENEZER. Private, Capt. James Walsworth s co., Col. Elisha Por 
ter s (Hampshire Co.) regt.; enlisted July 22, 1779; discharged Aug. 27,

PATTERSON, JAMES. Seaman, brigantine " Freedom," commanded by Capt. John 
Clouston; engaged Oct. 25, 1776; service to Dec. 25, 1776, 2 mos. ; also, Private, 
same vessel and commander ; discharged Feb. 16, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 16 days ; 
said Patterson reported as among the crew taken in the ship "La Soye 
Planter," a prize of the brig " Freedom," and thereby prevented from arriving 
at Boston until Feb. 16, 1777 ; also reported as having received pay to Jan. 1, 
1777.

mand at the Block House in April, 1781.

PATTERSON, JOHN, Lenox. Colonel, 26th regt. ; service from April 22, 1775, to 
May 7, 1775, 16 days ; also, Colonel ; general order dated Headquarters, Cam 
bridge, July 22, 1775, making disposition of the forces about Boston and 
dividing the army into three grand divisions to consist of two brigades each ; 
said Patterson s regt., of Massachusetts, assigned to a brigade to be com 
manded by Brig. Gen. Heath, which with another brigade and a reserve 
corps for defence of the several posts north of Roxbury, were to be commanded 
by Maj. Gen. Putnam; said Patterson s regt. at No. 3 to take post at No. 1 
and the redoubt between that and No. 2; also, communication dated Ticon- 
deroga, June 3, 1777, signed by said Patterson, stating that Capt. William 
Goodrich, who had been taken prisoner at Quebec " Winter before last " and 
had been exchanged, had served as Major of brigade in said Patterson s brigade 
" since the first of March last " but had not been commissioned, and asking 
that a commission be issued ; ordered in Council June 26, 1777, that Capt. 
Goodrich be commissioned as Major in said Brig. Patterson s brigade; also, 
Brigadier General ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to Dec. 31, 1780.

in Council May 12, 1777, that a commission be issued ; also, 1st Lieutenant, 
brigantine "Montgomery" (privateer) ; petition dated Salem, Feb. 5, 1778,

commander of said vessel ; ordered in Council Feb. 6, 1778, that a commission 
be issued ; also, petition dated Salem, July 20, 1778, signed by Jonathan Peele, 
Jr., in behalf of himself and others, of Salem, asking that said Patterson be 
commissioned as commander of the brig " Montgomery " (privateer) ; ordered 
in Council July 24, 1778, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated

Putnam and others, of Salem, asking that said Patterson be commissioned as 
commander of the brigantine " Mackaroni " (privateer) ; ordered in Council 
June 15, 1779, that a commission be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, June

and others, of Salem, asking that said Patterson be commissioned as com

that a commission be issued ; age, 33 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; complexion, 
light ; also, petition endorsed " May 24, 1782," signed by Thomas Palfray, in

PAUL, DAVID, New Gloucester. Private, Capt. Nathan Merrill s co. ; marched 
from home July 8, 1779 ; discharged Sept. 25, 1779 ; service, 2 mos. 17 days, 
with Col. Jonathan Mitchell s detachment ; company raised in Cumberland 
Co. for service on Penobscot expedition ; roll sworn to at North Yarmouth ; 
also, Capt. Merrill s co., Col. Jonathan Mitchel s detachment; pay abstract 
for mileage, sworn to at North Yarmouth, Nov. 3, 1779; reported as having 
first drawn rations at Falmouth and as discharged at Falmouth ; also, receipt 
dated New Gloucester, Feb. 20, 1781, for bounties paid said Paul and others 
by the Selectmen of the town of New Gloucester to serve in the Continental 
Army for the term of 3 years, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780.

PAUL, EDWARD, Taunton. Private, Capt. James Williams, Jr. s co. of Minute- 
men, which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, 
to Roxbury; service, 12 days; reported discharged April 29, 1775; also, 
Matross, Capt. Samuel Fales s (Taunton) co. of matrosses, Col. G. Williams s 
regt., [Gen.] G. Godfrey s brigade; service, 31 days, on the alarm at Rhode 
Island of Dec. 8, 1776 ; mileage to Blade s Ferry in Swanzey and home (32 
miles) allowed ; also, pay roll of a detachment from Capt. Josiah Crocker s 
co. of matrosses, Col. Mitchel s regt., Brig. Gen. George Godfrey s brigade ; 
service, 8 days; detachment marched to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of 
Aug. 2, 1780. 

PAUL, GEORGE. List of men in service in the Continental Army for the town of

PAUL, HUGH, Sheepscot. Matross, Capt. Samuel Gridley s co., Col. Richard Grid- 
ley s (Artillery) regt.; company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

PAUL, HUGH, Stoughton (also given Braintree) . Return of men raised to serve in 
the Continental Army from Col. Ebenezer Thayer, Jr. s (5th Suffolk Co.) 
regt. ; engaged for town of Braintree ; joined Capt. Burr s (also given Capt. 
Alden s) co., Col. Bailey s regt.; term, during war; reported a transient; 
also, return of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Capt. Lyon s 
co., Col. Benjamin Gill s regt.; residence, Stoughton; enlisted for town of 
Stoughton; joined Capt. Barr s co., Col. Bailey s regt.; term, 3 years; also,

not given]; Col. Bailey s regt.; residence, Braintree; enlisted by Capt.

Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ;

stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light ; hair, brown ; residence, Braintree ; en 
listed Jan. -, 1777, by Capt. Burr at Peekskill ; enlistment, during war.

PAUL, JAMES, Berkley. Private, Capt. Zebedee Redding s co., Col. Gamaliel

1780; discharged Oct. 31, 1780; service, 3 mos. 4 days; regiment raised to 
reinforce Continental Army.

Council Nov. 29, 1776.

taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock s Orderly Book ; said Pawers, Lieutenant,

given]; said Pawhukwaupeet claimed by Stockbridge and Chesterfield; 
allowed to Chesterfield. [See Jacob Paulauwaupeet.]

mustered by Muster Master Wheeler ; reported promoted to Ensign July 1,

PAYSON, EPHBAIM, Jr. Private, Capt. Edward Bridge Savell s (Stoughtonham) 
co., Col. Gill s regt. ; service, 5 days ; company marched to Dorchester Heights 
March 4, 1776, on an alarm. 

PAYSON, GEORGE, Walpole. Private, Capt. Seth Bullard s (Walpole) co. of mili 
tia, Col. John Smith s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 6 days; also, Capt. Joshua Clap s co. (North co. in Walpole), Col. 
Ephraim Wheelock s regt. commanded by Maj. Metcalf ; service, 6 days, at 
Warwick, R. I., on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776; also, Capt. Seth Sumner s co., 
Col. Gill s regt. ; marched from home March 1, 1778 ; discharged April 8, 1778 ; 
service, 1 mo. 8 days ; company ordered to march to Castle Island March 1, 
1778. 

PAYSON, HENRY, Roxbury. Private, Capt. Thomas Mayo, Jr. s co., Col. Eleazer 
Weld s detachment of militia; service from Dec. 9, 1776, to Dec. 29, 1776, 20 
days, probably at Hull. 

PAYSON, JAMES, Rowley. Private, Capt. Edward Payson s (Rowley) co. of militia, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 2 days. 

PAYSON, JOHN, Jr. Cornet, Capt. Robert Perkins s troop of horse, 3d Essex Co. 
regt. of Mass, militia ; list of officers [year not given]. 

PAYSON, JOSEPH, Braintree. Sergeant, Capt. Seth Turner s (Independent) co. ; 
engaged May 8, 1775; service, 8 mos., 1 week, 6 days; also, Capt. Eliphalet 
Sawen s co., Col. Joseph Palmer s regt.; service, 15 days; company assem 
bled March 4, 1776 ; also, same co. and regt. ; service, 4 days ; company assem 
bled at Braintree June 14, 1776. 



1052 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

PAYSON, JOSEPH, East Sudbury. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve 
of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent 
for Middlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, 
descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term 
of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Jus 
tin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, Aug. 9, 
1780; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 6 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of 
East Sudbury ; arrived at Springfield July 20, 1780 ; marched to camp Aug. 
9, 1780, under command of Capt. Daniel Lunt ; also, list of men raised for the 
6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, Private, 3d regt. ; pay 
roll for 6 months men raised by the town of East Sudbury for service in the 
Continental Army during 1780 ; marched Aug. 8, 1780 ; discharged Feb. 8, 1781 ; 
service, 6 mos., at West Point; travel (9 days) allowed. 

PAYSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Amos Perry s co., Col. Haws s regt. ; entered ser 
vice July 28, 1778 ; discharged Sept. 12, 1778 ; service, 1 mo. 17 days, at Rhode 
Island. 

PAYSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Lemuel Clap s co. ; enlisted May 20, 1779 ; dis 
charged Aug. 12, 1779; service, 2 mos. 24 days, with Maj. Nathaniel Heath s 
detachment of guards at Dorchester Heights. 

PAYSON, JOSEPH. Private, Capt. Ralph Thompson s co. ; enlisted Oct. 7, 1779 ; dis 
charged Dec. 1, 1779 ; service, 1 mo. 24 (also given 1 mo. 23) days, including 
travel home ; company raised in Suffolk Co. and served at Castle Island under 
Maj. Gen. Hancock. Roll dated Castle Island. 

PAYSON, MOSES PAUL, Rowley. Corporal, Capt. Edward Payson s (Rowley) co. of 
militia, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days. 

PAYSON, SAMUEL, Roxbury. Return of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army from Capt. Ebenezer Gore s (1st) co., Col. William Mclntosh s (1st 
Suffolk Co.) regt., sworn to Feb. 21, 1778; residence, Roxbury; engaged for 
town of Roxbury; joined Capt. Marshal s co., Col. Marshall s regt. ; term, 3 
years, to expire April -, 1780 ; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, 
Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Jan. 8, 1777; Capt. Christopher 
Marshall s co., Col. Thomas Marshall s regt. ; also, Private, 4th co., Col. Mar 
shall s 10th (also given llth) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for ser 
vice from Jan. 1, 1777, to July 6, 1777 ; reported taken prisoner July 6, 1777 ; 
also, Capt. Christopher Marshall s co., Col. Marshall s regt.; subsistence 
allowed from date of enlistment, Dec. 17, 1776, to Feb. 1, 1777 ; credited with 
47 days allowance ; subsistence also allowed for 11 days (220 miles) travel on 
march from Boston to Bennington. [See Samuel Presson.] 

PAYSON, SAMUEL, Stoughtonham. Captain, Col. John Graton s (Greaton s) regt. 
of Minute-men, which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 8 
days; also, Captain, Col. Joseph Read s regt. ; regimental return dated Camp 
at Roxbury, May 18, 1775 ; commissions for officers of said regiment received 
by Col. Read at Watertown, May 24, 1775; also, Captain, Col. Joseph Reed s 
(20th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged April 27, 1775; service, 
3 mos. 12 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]. 

PAYSON, SAMUEL, Stoughtonham. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the 
Continental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 
1780, returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John 
Glover, at Springfield, July 11, 1780; age, 22 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; com 
plexion, dark ; engaged for town of Stoughtonham ; arrived at Springfield 
July 10, 1780; marched to camp July 11, 1780, under command of Ensign 
Bancroft ; also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 1053 

PAYSON, SAMUEL, continued. 

Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Toto- 
way, Oct. 25, 1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised hy the town of 
Stoughtonham for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched 
July 4, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 8, 1780 ; service, 5 mos. 15 days, including travel 
(220 miles) home. 

PAYSON, SAMUEL. Private, Capt. Nathaniel Clap s co., Col. Benjamin Hawes s 
regt. ; entered service July 26, 1778 ; discharged Sept. 11, 1778 ; service, 1 mo. 
17 days, at Rhode Island. 

PAYSON, SETH, Walpole. Private, Capt. Seth Bullard s (Walpole) co. of militia, 
Col. John Smith s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; ser 
vice, 8 days. 

PAYSON, STEPHEN, Roxbury. Private, Capt. Lemuel Child s (3d Roxbury) co., 
Col. "William Heath s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 15 days ; company discharged May 3, 1775. 

PAYSON, SWIFT, Wrentham. Lieutenant, Capt. Lemuel Kollock s co., Col. John 
Smith s regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 5 days. 

PAYSON, SWIFT. Private, Capt. Samuel Fisher s co., Col. Ephraim Wheelock s 
regt. ; service, 10 days; company ordered to march to Warwick, R. I., on the 
alarm of Dec. 8, 1776. 

PAYTON, HENRY. Boatswain, brigantine "Freedom," commanded by Capt. John 
Clouston ; pay roll of men belonging to said brigantine made up for wages for 
service and while in captivity, sworn to in Middlesex Co. ; shipped Aug. 25, 
1777 ; discharged Dec. 25, 1777 ; service, 4 mos. ; said Payton reported taken 
in the " Freedom." 

PAYTON, JONATHAN. Private, Capt. Addison Richardson s co., Col. Jacob Ger- 
rish s regt. ; entered service Oct. 18, 1779; discharged Nov. 22, 1779; service, 
1 mo. 16 days, at Claverack, including 12 days (240 miles) travel home; regi 
ment detached from militia of Suffolk and Essex counties to reinforce army 
under Gen. Washington. 

PAYZANT, PHILIP, Boston. Private, Capt. Josiah Hayden s co., Col. John Thomas s 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 15, 1775 ; service, 2 mos., 
3 weeks, 1 day; also, muster roll for Sept. and Oct., 1775, dated Camp at 
Roxbury. 

PAZEL, . Private, Capt. Ambrose Bear s detachment of Indians; enlisted Oct. 

20, 1776; discharged Dec. 16, 1776; service, 57 days, under [Col.] Jonathan 
Eddy on expedition against Fort Cumberland, N. S.
